loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto es un joven de 20 años de edad que se dedica a transportar personas en el municipio de Ebejico, trabajo pro lograr un objetivo a futuro de comprar una vivienda, actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para realizar algunas reformar a su motocicleta, el dinero del préstamo será para realizar un mantenimiento al motos, compra de llantas y pagar el seguro de técnomecanica.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is a young man who is 20 years old. He makes a living transporting people in the city of Ebejico. His goal is to buy a home with the money he earns through this work. Currently, he is requesting a loan to do some upgrades to his motorcycle.

The money from this loan will be used to service motorcycles, buy tires, and pay for the services of a mechanic.

loans.use: to service motorcycles, buy tires, and pay for the services of a mechanic.

loans.name: Nurdane

texts.en:
Nurdane is married, a mother of three, and a farmer.  She sells her products twice a week in the bazaar, including milk from her animals.  

With the help of her first loan she will buy organic seeds.  She wants her children to graduate from a university.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff:
Nurdane Hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Çiftçilik yapıyor.  Ürünlerini hafta da iki gün Pazar da satıyor.  Aynı zaman da hayvanları var süt satışı da yapıyor.  Aldığı ilk kredi ile organik tohum alacak.  Çocuklarına üniversite okumasını istiyor.

loans.use: to buy organic seeds.

loans.name: Alejandro De Jesus

texts.es:
Alejandro, de 22 años de edad, es bachiller opción agrícola, él sabe todo lo relacionado a la agricultura, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, juntos tienen un hijo y la casa donde viven es de su madre.

Alejandro, se dedica a la agricultura desde que estaba muy pequeño, su padre le enseño a sembrar maíz, frijol, maicillo y ajonjolí y desde que se acompaño trabaja en sus propios cultivos; decidió dedicarse a esta actividad porque no ha encontrado otro tipo de trabajo; sus cultivos están a 2 kilómetros de su casa y llega hasta allá en bicicleta y su horario de trabajo es de 5 horas al día.

Alejandro, necesita el préstamo para comprar dos vaquillas, que serán otra fuente de ingresos para su familia, pues se alimentaran de la leche y del queso que producirán y los residuos del cultivo agrícola le servirán de alimento para las vaquillas. 

Él, sueña con tener un empleo formal, para ayudar más a su familia, pues sueña con tener a su familia en un lugar estable y digno para vivir.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 22 years old. He studied agriculture in high school. He knows everything about agriculture. He is in a relationship, and his partner works taking care of the household. Together they have a son. The house they live in is his mother's. Alejandro has worked in agriculture since he was very young. His father taught him to plant corn, beans, sorghum and sesame, and ever since then Alejandro has had his own crops. He decided to work in this field because he hadn't found any other type of work. His crops are 2 kilometers from his house, and he gets there by bicycle. His work schedule is 5 hours each day.

Alejandro needs the loan to buy two heifers which will be another source of income for his family. They will consume the milk and cheese the heifers produce, and the remains of the agricultural crops will be used to feed the heifers. He dreams of having a formal job, to provide more help to his family. He dreams of having a stable, dignified place to live in for his family.

loans.use: para comprar dos vaquillas.

loans.name: Blanca Ineth

texts.es:
Blanca es una joven de 24 años de edad que reside en una zona de postconflicto como es Sincelejo, ella trabaja confeccionando su propia línea de confección, pero también hace encargos especiales, como ejemplo, está el vestido fucsia que le encargo especialmente una cliente.
Ella es madre de dos hijos, el mayor de 3 años de edad y la menor con tan solo 3 meses de vida, tiene dos bebes en etapa de crecimiento.
Para mejorar su profesión, aumentar su trabajo, optimizar sus tiempos de producción, la señora blanca quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para invertirlo en la compra de una máquina bordadora y materia prima que sería principalmente tela.
Su sueño es tener un trabajo estable y rentable para pagar la educación de sus muchachos.
texts.en:
Blanca is a 24 year old young woman, who lives in the post-conflict zone of Sincelejo. She works making her own line of clothing. She also makes special requests, like, for example, the fuchsia dress pictured, ordered specifically by a client. She is the mother of two children. The oldest is three years old, and the youngest is only 3 months old. Her two babies are in the growth stage.

To improve her job, increase her work and optimize her production times, Blanca wants to seek economic support to invest in the purchase of an embroidery machine and raw material, primarily fabric. Her dream is to have a stable and profitable business to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: an embroidery machine and raw materials, primarily fabric.

loans.name: Engkoy

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Engkoy, who is a 41-year-old married woman with one son and one daughter.

Engkoy has been selling breakfast food, and her husband has been a driver for three years. She asked for a loan of 5,000,000 IDR from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source in her home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Engkoy will be able to repay the loan she received.

Engkoy and her family want to live a healthy life with a healthy sanitation system and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source in her home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Marcela Ines

texts.es:
Marcela es una mujer de 24 años de edad,  la cual se dedica a la venta de mercancía de uso personal,  reside en una zona de postconflicto, ella es soltera no tiene hijos, en su mente estar ayudar a sus padres, a su familia, quiere con ellos cambiar su realidad, tener un presente más próspero y en un futuro prometedor, donde pueda traer al mundo hijos a vivir en unas condiciones dignas de vivienda.
Actualmente esta joven se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercancía, principalmente accesorios, cosméticos, productos de aseo personal, lociones y cremas, que son los productos de mayor venta en su sector residencial.
texts.en:
Marcela is 24 years old and works selling items for personal use, and lives in a post-conflict area. She is single and has no children, and it is in her mind to help her parents and family. She wants to, with them, change their reality to have a more prosperous present and a promising future, where she could bring children into the world to live in dignified housing conditions.

Currently, she is young and is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as accessories, cosmetics, personal hygiene products, lotions and creams, which are her best-selling products in her residential area.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as accessories, cosmetics, personal hygiene products, lotions, and creams.

loans.name: Rebeca Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rebeca es una joven de veintiún años de edad que logrado con trabajo duro salir adelante y aportar a la mejora de calidad de vida de sus dos hijos y esposo, vendiendo cosméticos, perfumes y artículos para el hogar, ella ha descubierto su vocación para el comercio.
En esta temporada del año las ventas de Rebeca incrementan notablemente y ella debe abastecerse de todos los productos que tienen más demandas,  por eso ha tocado las puertas de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, para que se le beneficie con un financiamiento con el que pueda comprar perfumes para damas y caballeros, juguetes para niños y artículos para el hogar. En un futuro desea poder optar a  un crédito para mejorar su vivienda y  abrir en su casa una tienda.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a young adult, 21 years old, who managed through hard work to get ahead and provide for a better quality of life for her children and husband. Selling cosmetics, perfumes, and things for the home, she has discovered her vocation for commerce.

This time of year, Rebeca's sales increase notably and she should stock all the products with the most demand. Because of this, she has knocked on Kiva's door, together with MiCrédito, to benefit from financing with which she can buy perfumes for women and men, toys for children, and things for the home.

In the future, she hopes to be able to opt for a loan to improve her home and open a shop in her house.

loans.use: to buy perfumes for women and men, toys for children, and things for the home.

loans.name: Edwin Rafael

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre de 39 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, es padre de dos hijos de 15 y 16 años de edad, trabaja como productor agropecuario, alternándose en dos profesiones de cría de animales y agricultura.
Es un hombre responsable, entregado al trabajo y su familia. Edwin buscando la sostenibilidad del negocio y aumentar los ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y pagar la educación de sus hijos, quiere solicitar un préstamo para invertir en insumos agrícolas para la plantación de maíz, tales como semillas, abonos, venenos.
texts.en:
Edwin is 39 years old. He is in a common law marriage with his partner. He is the father of two children, ages 15 and 16. He works as a producer of both agriculture and livestock, alternating between the two professions of breeding animals and farming. He is a responsible man, dedicated to his work and his family.

Searching for the sustainability of his business, and an increase in his income to improve the life of his family and pay for his children's education, Edwin wants to seek a loan. He will invest it in agricultural supplies for planting corn, such as seeds, fertilizers and weed killers.

loans.use: to invest in agricultural supplies for planting corn, such as seeds, fertilizers and weed killers.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is from Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. She lives there with her husband, son, daughter and retired father-in-law. She has a vocational education and specialized as an accountant. She has always been employed and worked in her specialty. Now, she also works as an accountant at the school.

Anahit’s husband is a constructor, and together, they are also engaged in farming. Their farm is cute they have a cow and pigs. Anahit helps her husband a lot with farming work since he has some health problems that cause him great difficulties and feelings of weakness. Anahit asked for this loan of 1,400,000 Armenian drams in order to solve her husband’s health problems and help him to get rid of his discomfort and unhealthy feelings.

loans.use: to solve her husband’s health problems and help him get rid of his discomfort and unhealthy feelings.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene una persona seria, con principios y valores, muy recto en su comportamiento y actitud, se dedica a vender minutos a móviles y fijos.
Rene es padre de un muchacho de 17 años de edad, se separó de su esposa, vive solo y se encarga de mantener su hogar y enviar dinero para el sostenimiento de su querido hijo.
La profesión de Rene no alcanza a percibir los recursos suficientes para su sostenimiento, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para mejorar un poco la productividad de su labor.
El dinero lo invertirá  en la compra de 2 equipos móviles para vender minutos con su respectivo plan, el resto de dinero será para adecuar un carro para vender snacks y café.
texts.en:
René's a serious person: He has principles and values and is very honorable in his behavior and attitude. He earns a living selling minutes for mobile phones and landlines.

René's the father of a 17-year-old boy. He's separated from his wife and lives alone, and he's responsible for supporting his household and sending money to support his beloved son.

René doesn't earn enough from his job to support himself, so he wants to request a loan to improve his work productivity somewhat. He'll invest the money in buying two mobile phones to sell minutes with his own plan. The rest of the money will be for setting up a cart to sell snacks and coffee.

loans.use: to buy two mobile phones to sell minutes with his own plan and to set up a cart to sell snacks and coffee

loans.name: Lami

texts.en:
Lami is a maize farmer from Kusa village. As a Babban Gona member, Lami is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Lami would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Lami can to store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Lami no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Lami hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Idalia Esther

texts.es:
Idalia es una mujer muy trabajadora de cincuenta y cuatro años de edad, que ha dedicado su vida a su negocio de venta de nacatamales y al cuido de sus cuatro hijos. Buscando generar un ingreso que apoyase los gastos de su hogar, esta mujer empezó a vender nacatamales los fines de semanas, luego al notar que era muy rentable empezó a venderlos cinco veces a la semana, hasta la actualidad que los vende todos los días. En los  préstamos de MiCrédito y Kiva encontró buenos aliados para mantener su negocio a flote y por lo cual está profundamente agradecida.  
En esta época del año, Idalia tiene gran demanda, por eso ella ha vuelo a recurrir a un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito que le permita comprar en grandes cantidades maíz, harinas, hojas de empacar, carne de cerdo, especias, verduras, entre otras cosas, que utiliza en la elaboración de sus nacatamales. En un futuro esta emprendedora mujer pretende poder elaborar otros tipos de comida y poder contratar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Idalia (54 years old) is a hardworking woman who has dedicated her life to selling nacatamales [Nicaraguan tamales made of corn, meat and rice wrapped in a banana leaf] and caring for her four children. Looking to generate an income to cover her living costs, this woman started to sell nacatamales on weekends, and then, when she found it was very profitable, began to sell them five days a week, and now she sells them everyday. With the MiCrédito and Kiva loans, she has found good allies to keep her business afloat, and for this she is deeply grateful. 

At this time of year, Idalia is in great demand, and for this reason she has requested a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito to allow her to bulk buy maize, flour, paper packing, pork, spices, vegetables and other things that she will use to prepare her nacatamales. In the future, this enterprising woman aims to develop other types of food and to hire someone.

loans.use: to buy maize, flour, paper packing, pork, spices, vegetables and other things in bulk.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
El año 2014 fue el inicio de un nuevo hombre, un cambio en la vida del señor Jaime, él es un hombre de 30 años de edad, vive en una zona de postconflicto, donde conseguir un trabajo fijo es una tarea bastante tediosa, es padre de 2 hijos por los cuales vela y vive en unión libre con su pareja.
El señor Jaime en ese entonces inicio un negocio de cría de cerdos y encontró en esta actividad le dio oportunidad de soñar, de creer en sí mismo, de que si se puede comprar vivienda, pagar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y seguirá trabajando con empeño y honestidad para alcanzar estos objetivos.
Jaime se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar materiales con los cuales construirá porquerizas, también comprara una cerda de cría.
texts.en:
2014 was the beginning of a new man, a change in the life of Jaime.  He is a 30 year old man who lives in an area of post-conflict, where finding a regular job is a rather tedious task.

He is the father of 2 children for whom he cares for.  He is in a common law relationship with his partner.

Jaime started a business raising pigs and found in this activity the necessary opportunity to dream, to believe in himself, that he can buy a house, pay for the education of his children, improve the living conditions of his family.

He will continue to work with commitment and honesty to achieve these objectives.

Jaime is requesting a loan to purchase materials with which to build pigsties, also to purchase one pig for breeding.

loans.use: to purchase materials with which to build pigsties, also to purchase one pig for breeding.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Janet has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times more than the average Nigerian maize farmer's yield.

Before joining Babban Gona, Janet would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Janet can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Janet will benefit from marketing support that could help her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Janet is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family, and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Zeynep

texts.en:
Zeynep is divorced and a mother of two. She is successfully running a millinery shop which she undertook with zero capital and a lot of debt. In three years she worked very hard, increased the number of her products, started selling trousseau, payed all her debts and started making a profit. She also encourages women around her to make handicrafts and sell them in her shop. This way, many women started gaining money. With the help of her business she gained her self-confidence. With the help of her fourth loan, she is planning to buy new products for her shop. She aims to grow in this business and help more women.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Zeynep Hanım eşinden boşanmış iki çocuk annesi. Bundan üç yıl önce sıfır sermaye ve borçla devraldığı tuhafiye dükkanını başarıyla işletiyor. Üç yıl içinde çok çalışarak ürün çeşidini arttırarak, çeyizlik malzemeleri satmaya başlayarak borçlarını ödeyerek kara geçti. Zeynep Hanım aynı zaman da çevresinde ki kadınlara el işleri yaptırarak dükkanında satmaya başladı. Böylece bir çok kadına para kazanma imkanı sağladı. Bu işe başladıktan sonra maddi durumu düzeldi, kendine olan güveni arttı. Aldığı dördüncü kredisi ile dükkanına yeni ürünler alacak. İşinde daha da yükselmek, kadınlara yardımcı olmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy new products

loans.name: Gisela Maria

texts.es: Gisela, de 23 años de edad, es una madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo, y vive en La Labor, Ocotepeque que colinda con el municipio de Gracias Lempira, vive con su madre e hijo. Ella maneja el negocio de una pulpería desde hace 3 años en su casa, donde ofrece productos como azúcar, manteca, huevos, churros, arroz, frijoles, pan, refresco, jugos y más. Además continúa estudiando. Está solicitando la cantidad de 6,000 lempiras para invertirlo en surtir su negocio con más productos como granos básicos, harina, azúcar, churros, huevos, pan, jugos y refrescos a fin de obtener mejores ingresos que le permitan mejorar económicamente. Esto le ayudara a hacer crecer su negocio y obtener una mayor clientela. Su meta es beneficiar a su familia y con los ingresos obtenidos culminar sus estudios y gastos de su hijo.
texts.en:
Gisela is 23 years old, is a single mother and has one son. She lives in La Labor, Ocotepeque which is adjacent to the municipality of Gracias Lempira. She lives with her mother and her son. She has run a grocery store for the past 3 years from her home. She sells goods such as sugar, lard, eggs, churros, rice, beans, bread, soft drinks, juice, and more. Additionally, she is attending school.

She is requesting a loan for 6,000 lempiras to stock her business with more goods such as basic grains, flour, sugar, churros, eggs, bread, juice, and soft drinks in order to obtain a greater profit, which will allow her to improve financially. This will help her to grow her business gain more customers. Her goal to to benefit her family and complete her studies with the profits gained, and also pay for her son's costs.

loans.use: to stock her business with more food and drink goods.

loans.name: Mamy Nasolonjanahary

texts.fr:
Mamy a 38 ans. Son mari est un menuisier. Le couple a 4 enfants (20-18-16-13 ans) . Deux enfants  suivent leurs études à l’université, les deux autres sont en classe de terminale et troisième.
Les sources de revenus sont diversifiées. Mamy a créé une petite unité de confection à partir d’un prêt. Depuis deux ans elle s’est adonnée à l’activité de poules pondeuses, mais elle se trouvait dans l’obligation de vendre tout le cheptel en raison d’une maladie qui l’a frappée. A l’heure actuelle, elle veut reprendre l’élevage de poules pondeuses d’où la demande d’un second prêt. L’idée de créer l’unité d’élevage est née des conseils de sa sœur qui a suivi une formation technique dans le domaine. Mamy travaille également comme enseignante non permanente dans une école primaire publique la matinée. Elle sait bien gérer  son emploi du temps. 
Le couple vit dans une maison héritée de leurs parents. Le projet du couple est que ses quatre enfants réussissent dans leurs études.
texts.en: Mamy is 38 years old. Her husband is a carpenter. They have 4 children (20-18-16-13 years old). Two of their children are in university, and the younger two are in their last years of high school school and middle school. Their sources of income are diverse. With the help of a loan Mamy started a small business. For two years she immersed herself in her laying hen enterprise, but she ended up having to sell all of her livestock because she fell ill. She now wants to start raising laying hens again and is applying for a second loan. She got the idea to launch the livestock business from her sister who has received training in the field. Mamy also works in the mornings as a part-time teacher at a public elementary school. She knows how to manage her time well. The couple live in a house that they inherited from their parents. Their aspiration is for their children to succeed in school.

loans.use: to buy hens and livestock feed.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane is 45 years old and she lives with her husband and two daughters in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. Gayane has a higher education with a specialty in teaching, but having attended courses of accounting, she now works as an accountant. Gayane’s husband is also employed and the two work so hard in order to cover all their family's needs, especially the expenses of their youngest daughter’s education. She studies at the State Pedagogical Institute the faculty of Arts. She studies in the paid division. This loan of 210,000 Armenian drams Gayane asks as she must.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fees for the second semester.

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es:
Ceferino, de 64 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar porque su familia era de escasos recursos económicos, está casado desde que tenía 23 años de edad, su esposa se dedica a los oficios de la casa y juntos han procreado 6 hijos, de los cuales nadie estudia y los mayores viven en el extranjero y los menores están en casa.

Ceferino, toda su vida se dedicó a la agricultura y la ganadería, trabajó desde muy pequeño con su padre para aprender lo que hoy sabe, ahora tiene un sistema de riego que le facilita el mantenimiento de los cultivos en temporadas de sequía y ordeña dos vacas que le proporcionan suficiente leche para procesarla y después consumirla o venderla; todo esto lo realiza con la ayuda de sus dos hijos varones, quienes le ayudan durante la mañana y su horario de trabajo es de las 5:00 a.m. a 12:00 p.m.

Ceferino, necesita el préstamo para comprar tubería para ampliar el sistema de riego, para darle mejor mantenimiento a su ganado y prepararse para la época de verano; él espera que su ganado le produzca más leche para aumentar la producción y a la vez los ingresos para la familia. 

Los sueños de Ceferino, son poder seguir trabajando y darles el apoyo a sus hijos para que continúen sus estudios porque por falta de recursos económicos no siguieron estudiando.
texts.en:
Ceferino, 64 years old, did not have the opportunity to study because his family was too poor. He has been married since he was 23 years old, and his wife manages their household. Together, they have had six children, none of whom have studied, with the eldest children living abroad and the youngest children living at home. Ceferino has spent his entire life working in farming and with livestock, working since he was little with his father where he learned what he knows today. 

Now he has an irrigation system that helps maintain his crops during droughts, as well as two milking cows that provide enough milk for processing, either for sale or consumption. All of this is done with the help of his two sons, who help him during the morning from 05:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.

Ceferion needs this loan to buy pipes to improve his irrigation system, so that he can improve the care of his livestock and prepare for the summer season. He hopes that his cattle can increase their milk production to increase the income for his family. 

Ceferino's dream is to continue working and to provide support for his children so that they can study, as due to lack of money they have not been able to pursue an education.

loans.use: to buy pipes to extend his irrigation system in order to improve the care of his livestock and prepare for the summer season.

loans.name: Rizal

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Rizal, one of the Ruma agents who lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. As a main source of income, he owns and manages a small stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to his community. Rizal is a young guy who has a big spirit and wish to become an entrepreneur. He is interested in joining Ruma because he wants to improve his entrepreneurial skills as well as make more of a contribution to his community.

As the business runs, Rizal is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits, especially on the weekends. In near future, Rizal is also plans to improve his selling in new products from Ruma, an e-commerce for lower communities called 'Mapan'.

In the photo, Rizal is sitting in his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is from Calape, Bohol. She is a 45-year-old married woman and has four children ages 22, 15, 13 and 9 years. Together with her husband, Evangeline engages in the rice-farming business. Thus, they work together to earn a living. Aside from farming, Evangeline also sells food to the community. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to enhance the growth of her plants. In addition to this, she will also buy food ingredients such as vegetables, meat, cooking oil and spices. In the future, Evangeline dreams of increasing her profits to have enough money to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and food ingredients such as vegetables, meat, cooking oil and spices.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Musa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.
Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Musa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
As a Babban Gona member, Musa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Musa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ahmed has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Ahmed would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Ahmed can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Ahmed will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Ahmed is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Zhaneta

texts.en: Zhaneta fluently and due to her graphic ended her first Kiva loan and she is greatly thankful for support. She also hopeful that she will receive her second loan, since she is having financial hardships in her family. Zhaneta lives with her husband, two sons, and a daughter in the Ddmashen village in the Gegharkunik region. Her husband is a taxi driver. Her elder son is back from abroad and looking for a job and the youngest is still school-aged. Zhaneta’s daughter is a student and she studies Armenian History at the Yerevan State University in the faculty of Pedagogy. She studies in the paid division.  Zhaneta was previously is engaged in farming and agriculture. So, having little income from farming and from her husband’s taxi services, they have serious financial hardships and do not manage to cover their daughter’s education costs. With this loan of 300,000 Armenian drams Zhaneta is asking for, she will pay her daughter's tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition for the first semester

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra is a 60-year-old woman who lives in Catigbian, Bohol. She is married and has four adult children. She helps her husband earn a living by doing a hog-raising business. Her husband works hard as a heavy equipment operator. Thus, she wanted to improve this business for their future needs. But, with raising pigs, she needs a more capital to finance their feed. That is why she is in need of a loan, to sustain buying feed for her pigs and to buy additional piglets as well.  Additionally, Alejandra aims in the future to improve her business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Ameer

texts.en:
Ameer is 43 and she is married. She lives with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Ameer purchases clothes at cheap rates with the help of her husband and sells them in her locality. She has been doing this since 2005 and now she has gotten enough experience to know the clothing business very well. She wants to use her experience and wants to generate more profit, but she needs to take out a loan due to her poor financial conditions. Due to the upcoming winter season, she expects that the demand for clothing will increase.

This is the reason AMEER showed interest in taking a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She would like to buy a variety of clothes at cheap prices, to sell. She hopes that she will use this loan positively and that she can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide a better living standard and charming clothes for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes at cheap prices in large quantities to resell in her community.

loans.name: Plinio Jose

texts.es: Plinio se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de purina de engorde para cerdos de mes y medio, y comprar materiales para realizar mejoras a sus porquerizas, dicho préstamo lo necesita pensando en acelerar el proceso de engorde de los cerdos para tenerlos preparados para la temporada de diciembre, donde percibe mejores ingresos que sirven para el sostenimiento de su familia y ofrecer a sus seres amados una feliz navidad, obsequiando regalos que llene de alegría a los pequeños.
texts.en: Pinio is requesting a loan to purchase Purina feed to fatten up his 1.5-month-old piglets, and to buy materials to improve the pig sties. This loan is necessary to speed up the fattening process of his pigs so he can prepare for the December season, where he will earn more money to support his family and be able to provide his loved ones with a merry Christmas, giving gifts that will fill his children with joy.

loans.use: to buy Purina feed for to fatten up his animals and purchase matarials for the construction of pig sties

loans.name: Thermmai Group

texts.en:
Khamhoung’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Khamhoung and his group are excited that the water filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits. Khamhoung and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years filter users, like Khamhoung’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Koryun

texts.en: Koryun is 24 years old and he lives with his parents in Lchashen in Gegharkunik region. Koryun has not had any higher education. He does different hired constructional work and also helps his parents in their farming work. This farming is the only constant source of income that helps to cover their minimum needs. This young man has serious health problems and he needs permanent medical control on his disease. This loan of 1,400,000 AMD Koryun asks for is for his regular medical check-ups at the hospital. He needs to pass these in order to monitor and control his health.

loans.use: to pay for his regular medical check-ups at the hospital which he has to pass in order to monitor and control his health.

loans.name: Nivis Rosa

texts.es:
Toda una guerrera, luchadora, entusiasta, sonriente así es Nivis, una mujer de 35 años de edad, madre cabeza de familia de 4 hijos, a pesar der que se separó de su pareja, no le quedó grande desempeñar el rol de padre y madre y con su negocio de prestación de servicios de belleza a domicilios genera los ingresos suficientes para alimentar y darles educación a sus muchachos de 11, 10, 5 años y la menor de tan solo 3 meses.
Nivis para mejorar y darle un impulso importante a su profesión quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar una motocicleta para desplazarse hacia sus citas con más rapidez y poder atender un mayor número de clientes en el día.
texts.en:
Nivis: a warrier, a fighter, enthusiastic, smiley. She is a 35-year-old woman, the mother and head of a family of four children, and although she is separated from her partner, she has been able to play the role of both father and mother. With her business of beauty services in the home, she generates enough income to feed and educate her boys, who are: 11, 10 and 5 years old, with the youngest only 3 months old. 

Nivis would like to improve and give a big boost to her business, and is asking for this loan to buy a motorcycle so she can get to her appointments faster, so that she can visit a greater number of clients in a day.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle so she can reach her customers more quickly.

loans.name: Luís Antonio

texts.es:
Luis, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañado desde hace 6 años, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también se dedica al comercio informal y juntos tienen 2 hijos en común.

Luis, se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 13 años, aprendió este oficio cuando anduvo trabajando con personas que ya sabían hacerlo y decidió dedicarse a eso porque le gusto y también porque no encontró otra forma de trabajar.- Pero aparte de eso también cultiva maíz y frijol para el sustento de su familia, la distancia a la que trabaja varia, pero siempre labora 8 horas diarias.

Luis, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaquilla lechera, para que le provea otro alimento para él y su familia.

Luis, sueña con tener su propio negocio de construcción pues es algo que le gusta; pero también desea tener un mejor lugar para vivir.
texts.en:
Luis is 26 years old, completed 4th grade, has had a partner for 6 years. His partner dedicates herself to the household chores and also has a informal business. Together they have 2 children.

Luis has been a bricklayer for 13 years. He learned this trade when he was working as an apprentice and he decided to work in this field because he liked it and also because he didn't find other work. In addition he grows corn and beans to support his family. This distance to travel to work varies, but he always works 8 hours per day.

Luis needs a loan to buy a milk cow in order to provide additional food for him and his family. Luis dreams of having his own construction business as it is something that he likes to do. He also wishes to have a better place to live.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María, de 62 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, es viuda y tuvo tres hijos que ya están casados y viven en el extranjero.

María, vende verduras y frutas desde hace varios años, este negocio lo aprendió sola debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos, ella sale a vender las frutas y verduras casa por casa pero solo por las tardes.
 
María, necesita el préstamo para comprar frutas y verduras como chile, guineos, zanahorias, papas, güisquiles y todo lo necesario que se ocupa para cocinar.

Ella sueña con tener muchos clientes y que puedan llegar a comprar a la casa, para que ella no tenga que salir a la calle.
texts.en:
María is 62 years old, completed 3rd grade, is a widow and has three grown children who live outside the country. Maria has sold vegetables and fruit for several years. She learned this business in order to generate income. She goes out to sell the fruit and vegetables house to house but only in the afternoons.

Maria needs a loan in order to buy fruit and vegetables such as chili, carrots, bananas, potatoes, squash, and everything needed in order to cook.

She dreams of having many customers and that they can come to her house to buy so that she doesn't have to go out into the street to sell.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables such as chili, carrots, bananas, potatoes, squash, and everything needed in order to cook.

loans.name: Abdulkadir

texts.en:
Abdulkadir is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Abdulkadir has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdulkadir would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Abdulkadir can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Abdulkadir will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Abdulkadir is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Phonmeuamgnoy Group

texts.en: Khamfong’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Khamfong and her group are excited that the filter is available on a payment plan that makes it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Khamfong and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users like Khamfong’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Seebounheuang Group

texts.en: Bualen understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Bualen knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Bualen purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Bualen is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Jahangir

texts.en:
Jahangir is aged 45. He is an honest person living in Lahore, Pakistan. He has been doing this business for many years and generating income for his family. All his efforts are for providing comfort to his family members.

He is a milkman by profession. He sells milk and bull calves to the local butcher. He has a few buffaloes and cows. He produces milk two times a day from all his cattle. He provides door-to-door milk delivery to his customers as well and takes money on a monthly basis. He found that he can produce more milk from buffaloes instead of cows, so he decided to buy a buffalo. However, the price of a buffalo is more than that of a cow and he does not have enough savings to buy a buffalo.
Therefore Jahangir has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to be able to buy one buffalo for producing more milk.

Jahangir wants to keep buffaloes instead of cows to grow his business and wants to maintain his cowshed as well. He hopes that he will be able to buy a buffalo and be able to generate maximum income.

Jahangir thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo so he can replace one of his cows with the buffalo and can produce more milk for reselling.

loans.name: Safinah

texts.en:
Safinah is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Safinah is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Safinah would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Safinah will store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Safinah now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma lives in Badian, Cebu with her five school-aged children. Aside from being busy looking after her children, Alma finds a way to operate her business of selling bananas in her neighborhood. She started this business a year ago and earns her 6,000 PHP per month. Alma is asking for a loan so she can buy more bananas that she can resell at the market. Alma hope to have other business options in the future so that she can make the most of her earnings and provide for her children's school fees and healthy diet.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 51 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marilyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a loan of 21,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en: Herbert is a 43-year-old married man with one child who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a business of selling produce, which he has been doing for over 16 years and he started this business after working in a tea factory where he obtained start-up capital for his business. He faces the hardships of inadequate capital and seasonal changes like heavy rains that make drying of the produce very difficult. However, he is looking at installing electricity in his house and renovating his residential home. Herbert needs a loan to buy more beans, rice and cassava flour for selling.

loans.use: to buy more beans, rice and cassava flour for selling.

loans.name: Maria Sabina

texts.es: María, de 43 años de edad, es una madre soltera de 4 hijos que vive con ellos en el municipio de San Marcos, Ocotepeque que colinda con Gracias Lempira. Tiene su propia fuente de ingresos donde elabora y vende tortillas de maíz en su casa. Las tortillas las vende en su comunidad durante el día. Ella solicita la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras para invertir en la compra de maíz para la elaboración de tortillas que le permita cumplir con la demanda que tiene aumentando sus ventas. Tiene como meta brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old. She is a single mother of four children who live with her in the municipality of San Marcos, Ocotepeque which borders Gracias Lempira. She has her own source of income in making and selling corn tortillas in her home. She sells the tortillas in her community during the day.

She is requesting the amount of 5,000 Lempiras [Honduran currency] to buy maize for the production and sale of tortillas, which will allow her to meet demand that has increased sales. Her goal is to provide a better quality of life to her children and grow as a small business.

loans.use: to buy corn for the production and sale of tortillas.

loans.name: Judith Yaneth

texts.es:
Judith es una madre cabeza de familia de 38 años de edad, que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercancía de uso personal, tales como lociones, pijamas, ropa para hombre y mujer y accesorios, es madre de dos hijas, la venta de mercancía representa el 100 % de sus ingresos.
A pesar de ser madre cabeza de familia, lucha diariamente por sus hijas, esas dos muchachas que le inspira fortaleza le dan fuerza para trabajar todos los días y llevar ese alimento tan preciado a la mesa.
Su principal objetivo es ofrecer una buena calidad de vida a sus niñas, seguir pagando su educación y nunca permitir que pasen necesidades.
texts.en:
Judith is 38 years old, mother of two children, and head of her household. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise (personal use products), such as lotions, as well as pajamas, men's and women's clothing and accessories. Her sales represent 100% of her income.

In spite of being a single mother, she strives daily on behalf of her daughters. Those two girls inspire her with fortitude and give her strength to work every day and bring that so precious food to the table.

Her main objective is to offer a good quality of life to her girls, continue paying for their education and never allow them to experience privations.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (personal use products), such as lotions, as well as pajamas, men's and women's clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Sale

texts.en:
Sale is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Sale has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sale would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sale can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Sale will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Sale is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mainonsaard Group

texts.en: Lampham  is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Lampham and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  The water filter Lampham and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Lampham and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Lampham and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is 58 years old, married and has two children. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can contribute to improving the health of her family as well as enhance environmental protection. Husbandry is the main income source of her family so she is able to pay the loan monthly from selling chickens, pigs and vegetables from the garden.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Global Harvest School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Jackson. He is the Director of Global Harvest Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Seguku in Wakiso with 400 students. Global Harvest School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450-liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Global Harvest School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Jackson ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Sonia Esperanza

texts.es:
Sonia, de 60 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada, su esposo es agricultor, juntos tuvieron 4 hijos de los cuales solamente uno vive con ellos.

Sonia, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, a la agricultura y a la ganadería, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 36 años, precisamente desde que se casó, pues esa fue la forma de sacar adelante a su familia; ahora sus cultivos están cerca de la casa y su esposo le ayuda.

Sonia, necesita el préstamo para comprar una yunta de bueyes para el trabajo de la agricultura.

Sonia, desea poder seguir trabajando y apoyando a su esposo en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Sonia, who is 60 years old, studied up until 6th grade. She is married and her husband is a farmer. Together, they have four children, of whom only one lives with them. Sonia works managing the household, as well as in farming and livestock management. She has worked in these areas for 36 years since she got married to help her family get ahead. Now, their crops are close to the house and her husband helps her. 

Sonia needs this loan to purchase a team of oxen for agricultural work. She wants to be able to continue working and to support her husband in farming.

loans.use: to buy a team of oxen for agricultural work.

loans.name: Annastasia

texts.en:
Annastasia is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Annastasia operates a grocery vegetables-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Tonenoy Group

texts.en:
Kaenta is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.

Kaenta and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. The water filter Kaenta and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years. Kaenta and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease.

After totaling up the costs, Kaenta and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Donedumeuang Group

texts.en:
Bounday understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Bounday knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Bounday purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Bounday is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years, so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 57 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudió hasta sexto grado, no continuó estudiando debido a que sus padres eran de bajos recursos económicos, está casada, tiene 2 hijos que ya están casados, en su casa solo vive su esposo y sus 2 nietos.

Juana, se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo desde hace mucho tiempo, especificamente siembra maíz y el terreno donde tiene el cultivo está a una pequeña distancia de su casa.- Pero ella también se dedica a la sastrería, ella confecciona vestidos, blusas, faldas, pantalones, entre otros. 

Juana, necesita el préstamo para cultivar 48 hectárea de maíz y comprar abono, pesticidas, sulfato, semilla y para comprar pollo para engordar.

El Sueño de Juana, es comprar un terreno para cultivar más y también comprar y comercializar gallinas ponedoras.
texts.en:
57-year-old Juana is a housewife. She studied up to the sixth grade and did not continue as her parents did not have the sufficient economic resources. She is married and has two adult children who are married. She lives with her husband and two grandchildren. 

Juana has worked with her husband in agriculture for a long time. Specifically, they grow corn. The plot of land with their crops is located near their house. She also does some tailoring. She makes dresses, skirts, and pants, among other things. 

Juana needs the loan to grow 48 hectares of corn and buy fertilizers, pesticides, sulphates, seeds, and to buy a chicken for fattening up.

Juana's dream is to buy a plot of land to grow more crops and also to buy and sell laying hens.

loans.use: to grow 48 hectares of corn and buy fertilizers, pesticides, sulphates, seeds and a chicken for fattening up.

loans.name: Sunnita

texts.en: Sunnita is 20 years old, a single salesperson at a university and her major is economics. She resides with her parents in Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. She has been working as a salesperson since 2014, earning approximately USD 6 per day. Due to the fact that she is short of financial support, she would like to apply for a loan to pay her tuition fees for the second year. With the loan, she will be able to go through the second year at the university successfully. For her future, Sunnita wants to get a good job and she wants to save money to buy her own house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for the second year

loans.name: Huayaeck Group

texts.en:
Tik’s village sources much of its drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Tik and her group are excited that a filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.

Tik and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years. Within this two years, filter users, like Tik’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is the age of 40 and a mother of four children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services using his auto rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family’s expenses.

Now Razia’s husband wants to buy a new auto rickshaw for proper transportation services but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to buy it. Therefore Razia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Razia’s husband can purchase the auto rickshaw and provide the proper transportation services to earn an income.

Razia and her family will be thankful to Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Eveling Jannet

texts.es:
Eveling Jannet, tiene 24 años de edad, ella es una joven estudiante de la carrera de Contabilidad, le gusta mucho la carrera elegida, ya que desde muy pequeña le gustan los números y los cálculos matemáticos,además eligió ésta carrera por la demanda laboral en la actualidad y la rentabilidad.
Le falta muy poco para terminar, sólo le falta cumplir con un requisito que es obtener el certificado de ingles básico. Le gustaría trabajar en la SUNAT que es una entidad recaudadora de impuestos.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el pago del curso de ingles.
texts.en:
Eveling Jannet is 24 years old. She is a young student studying Accounting. She likes her chosen career as since she was young she has liked numbers and math calculations. She also chose this career because of the current employment opportunities and the return on her investment.

She is almost finished, she only has to complete one requirement, which is to obtain her basic English certificate. She would like to work for SUNAT which is an organization that collects taxes.

The loan she is receiving will be invested in the payment of her English course.

loans.use: to invest in the payment of an English course so she can graduate with her Accounting degree.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es: Doña Damaris es una mujer muy trabajadora, que desea aprovechar su experiencia y el espacio físico en su vivienda muy apropiado para el manejo de la actividad de gallinas ponedoras. Para esto necesita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), dinero que le permitirá establecer su negocio y aumentar los ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Damaris is a hardworking woman who wants to take advantage of her experience and the space available at her house to have laying hens. To do this, she needs a loan of one million Costa Rican colons. This money will allow her to establish her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy laying hens.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, tener dinero para disfrutar de una sana y buena alimentación, poder una vida tranquila, con pocas preocupaciones, sin pasar necesidades es todo lo que quiere Ana María, una mujer soltera de 64 años de edad la cual se dedica a la cría y levante de ganado porcino, este negocio es la única entrada de dinero que tiene para sobrevivir y como tal debe cuidarlo y trabajar con mucho empeño y dedicación para sostenerlo.
Con el claro objetivo de sostener su negocio, de aumentar su cantidad de inventario, aumentar número de clientes, reducir costos de cría, la señora Ana María quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cuido y concentrado para seba y levante de cerdos.
texts.en:
Ana María wants to improve the conditions of her, to have money to enjoy healthy and good food, and to have a peaceful life, with few worries and without passing over necessities. She is a single woman who is 64 years old. She is dedicated to raising pigs. This business is her only source of income to survive and, as such, she much take care of the pigs and work with a lot of effort and dedication to sustain the business.

With the clear goals of sustaining her business, increasing her inventory, increasing the number of clients, and reducing the costs to raise the pigs, Ana María wants to request a loan to buy care and feed to fatten and raise pigs.

loans.use: to buy care and feed to fatten and raise pigs.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer from Bamiyayi village. As a Babban Gona member, Musa is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Musa can store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Musa no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Musa hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Rufai

texts.en:
Rufai is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Rufai has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Rufai would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Rufai can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Rufai will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Rufai is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Margarita Maria

texts.es:
Margarita es una madre soltera, cabeza de familia de 33 años de edad, tiene 4 niños de 11, 8, 7, y 3 años, todos ellos dependen económicamente de ella, no cuenta con un empleo, pero si tiene unas ganas inmensas de salir adelante y generar un ambiente social, recreativo y educativo para sus hijos, pues su principal sueño es pagar la educación y que estos se conviertan en todos unos profesionales.
Margarita quiere solicitar un préstamo para iniciar un negocio de distribución de productos desechables, un negocio que se convertirá en el motor de los sueños de su familia y con el que espera triunfar y tener sostenibilidad en el tiempo.
texts.en:
Margarita (33 years old) is a single mother and the head of a family of four children, who are 11, 8, 7 and 3 years old. All of them are dependent on her, and she does not have a job. However, she is immensely excited to move forward and create a social, fun and educational environment for her children, as her main dream is to pay for their education and help them become professionals. 

Margarita wants to ask for a loan to begin a business distributing disposable products. This business will become the engine to realize the dreams of her family and which she hopes will succeed and become sustainable over time.

loans.use: to start a business distributing disposable products.

loans.name: Nedilyn

texts.en:
Fifty-one-year-old Nedilyn runs this variety store located in front of her house in Tigbauan, Iloilo. It has significantly progressed in her 30 years of operation. She started by selling basic commodities like sachets of shampoo and biscuits, and now she has a wide variety of choices. Aside from this, she was able to put up a small piggery at the back of her house. She estimates that her gross monthly income is PHP 84,000.

But Nedilyn doesn’t stop dreaming. She still aspires for expansion not only to boost her income and savings, but also to extend monetary support to her relatives. This is why she persists despite overdue collectibles that sometimes deplete her capital. She concentrates on her goal to renovate their house and expand her store building.

To take another step towards her dream, she is requesting additional capital of PHP 50,000. She plans to buy more cases of soft drinks and beverages, stock of grocery items, plus additional piglets and feed for her small piggery. With an enhanced business, she can efficiently help her relatives.

Nedilyn is married to Razel, a laborer. Both of them wish that their whole family will stay happy, healthy, and enjoy a good living condition.

She is a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more cases of soft drinks and beverages, stock of grocery items, plus additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Damaso Jose

texts.es:
Damaso tiene 49 años de edad y actualmente se dedica a laborar como empleado en varias fincas. Nació en una familia humilde del campo y allí aprendió desde muy joven las labores agropecuarias mientras veía trabajar a su padre, quien toda la vida se dedicó a la producción agropecuaria. 

Con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos personales, desea iniciar su propio negocio independiente, dedicándose a la cría, engorde y comercialización de pollos, para lo cual ya posee los galpones en la terraza de su casa. Es por esta razón que solicita el apoyo del crédito, pues desea invertirlo en la ampliación de los galpones, comprar polluelos y concentrado para poner en marcha su idea de negocio, la cual alternará con su actual empleo. 

Damaso espera que su proyecto le permita mejorar las condiciones de vida para él y su familia y, sueña con independizarse totalmente, siendo consciente que para lograrlo debe trabajar con empeño y mucha dedicación para que su negocio comience a dar los resultados que desea y, de esa manera tendrá la capacidad para comenzar una producción escalonada que le garantice los ingresos necesarios para mejorar su estabilidad económica y sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Damaso is 49 years old and currently works as an employee on various farms. He was born into a humble farming family and learned agricultural work very young, watching his father who worked all his life in agricultural production.

With the goal of improving his personal income he wants to start his own independent business, raising, fattening and selling chickens. He already has enclosures on the terrace of his house. For this reason he is requesting the help of a loan. He wants to invest it in expanding his enclosures, buying chicks and concentrated feed to start his idea for a business which he would alternate with his current employment.

Damaso hope that his venture will allow him to improve living conditions for himself and his family and he dreams of becoming totally independent. He is conscious that to do this he would have to work with great determination and dedication for his business to begin to produce the results he desires. In this way he would have the capacity to begin a scaled production that would guarantee the income needed to improve his financial stability and his living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in expanding his enclosures, buying chicks and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Mikailu

texts.en:
Mikailu is a maize farmer from Bamiyayi village. As a Babban Gona member, Mikailu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mikailu would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Mikailu can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% over the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Mikailu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Mikailu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Gabriel is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Gabriel would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest time to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Gabriel will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Gabriel now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is a student pursuing a degree in Business Information Technology at Jomo Kenyatta University and Technology (JKUAT).

Roselyne is one of six siblings and was born into a family who are wholly dependent on farming. She dreams of working with an innovative and dynamic firm where she can apply her acquired skills and knowledge. She is a positive thinker who loves reading and motivating others.

With her Kiva loan, Roselyne will be able to complete her final year of studies. With the skills she develops, she will be able to transform the lives of people in her community through technology.

Please help Roselyne achieve her dreams by funding her loan today.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for the final year of her Business Information Technology degree.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
La señora  Juana de 48  años de edad, es casada  tiene un hijo, vive en San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras en casa propia  y se dedica desde hace varios años  a la venta de tortillas y charamusca, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante. 

La señora está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de maíz, leña, azúcar, leche etc. que es la materia prima utilizada en el negocio, ya que viene la época buena  y desea tener surtido para poder tener mejores ventas.

Su sueño es poder mejorar  su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - de Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
Juana is a 48-year-old woman and is married with a son. She lives in San Lorenzo, south of Honduras, in her own home, and has worked for several years selling tortillas and charamusca [Salvadorian sorbet-like frozen food, often made with juice, coconut, Coca Cola or milk]. She is a hard-working woman who wants to get ahead in life.

She is asking for this loan to purchase maize, firewood, sugar, milk, etc., which are the raw materials she uses in her business. The best time for selling is coming up, and she would like to have a range of supplies in order to have better sales, and her dream is to then improve her home.

loans.use: to buy maize, firewood, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en:
Isiyaku is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Isiyaku has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Isiyaku would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Isiyaku can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Isiyaku is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Leyla Del Socorro

texts.es:
Leyla es una mujer muy enérgica de cincuenta y ocho años de edad, apasionada por el trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio de  pulpería, el cual inicio hace seis años como una alternativa para mantenerse ocupada, dado que sus cuatro hijos ya son mayores y han dejado el hogar. Gracias a los prestamos de MiCredito y Kiva ella logro diversificar los productos que ofrece y por ende crecer como comerciante, por eso ella confía fielmente en ambas organizaciones.
En estos momentos, Leyla sabe que necesita mejorar su negocio y la única manera de hacerlo es recurriendo a un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédio, con dicho financiamiento planea comprar grandes cantidades de granos básicos, una vitrina y un freezer. Leyla tiene muchas metas, ella piensa trabajar duro hasta que su negocio sea una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Leyla is a very energetic woman, who is 58 years old. She is passionate about working and has succeeded in taking her grocery store business forward. She started the business six years ago as a way to keep herself busy, since she has four adult children who have left her house. Thanks to loans from MiCredito and Kiva, she succeeded in diversifying the products that she offers and, thus, growing as a businesswoman. Because of this, she trusts faithfully in both organizations.
