At this time, Leyla knows that she needs to improve her business, and the only way of doing it to get another loan from Kiva and MiCredito. With this loan, she plans to buy large quantities of basic grains, a display cabinet, and a freezer.

Leyla has many goals. She plans to work hard until her business is a distributor.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of basic grains, a display cabinet, and a freezer.

loans.name: Ada Maria

texts.es:
Ada es una mujer luchadora de cincuenta y seis años de edad, su esposo es su compañero fiel y su familia de seis hijos son quienes la apoyan en cada decisión que toma, desde hace diez años ella vende lácteos y también cosméticos. Ya ha trabajado con financiamientos de parte de MiCrédito y Kiva, gracias a esto ha crecido notablemente como comerciante, por lo cual se encuentra profundamente agradecida con ambas organizaciones.
Para Ada, siempre es importante tener capital para reforzar su inventario de lácteos, por eso ella ha vuelto a tocar las puertas de Kiva junto a MiCrédito solicitanto un préstamo que le permita comprar más cantidad de leche, queso, leche agria, yogurt, crema, helados, entre otros. Su próxima meta es obtener un préstamo que le permita invertir en cosméticos y perfumes, dada la temporada navideña. En un futuro desea poder comprar un freezer y un exhibidor de productos.
texts.en:
Ada is a 56-year-old woman who is a fighter, and her husband is her loyal companion. Her family of six children support her in every decision she makes, and for 10 years she has sold dairy products and cosmetics. She has already worked with financing from MiCrédito and Kiva, and thanks to this has grown considerably as a wholesaler, and is profoundly grateful to both organizations.

For Ada, it is always important to have capital to increase her inventory of dairy products, and this is why she has come back to knock on Kiva and MiCrédito's doors, asking for a loan that will allow her to buy larger quantities of milk, cheese, soured milk, yogurt, cream, and ice cream, among other items. Her next goal is to get a loan that will allow her to invest in cosmetics and perfumes, given the upcoming Christmas season. In the future, she hopes to be able to buy a freezer and a product display case.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of milk, cheese, sour milk, yogurt, cream and ice cream, among other things.

loans.name: Junaid

texts.en:
Junaid is a 30-year-old married man, living with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a soft drink distributor and offers various brands. He directly purchases these brands from relevant companies and sells at wholesale rates. He has appointed a few distributors who sell his goods over bicycles; in this way he is providing a source of income to the unemployed persons and generating income for his family as well. Nowadays, his customers are demanding two more brands of soft drinks, which is not possible without some capital.

Junaid has already spent his savings to purchase the stock and does not have cash in hand to buy additional brands of soft drinks. Therefore, Junaid contacted BRAC and requested a Kiva loan. He will utilize the loan to purchase desired inventory.

Junaid is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cold drinks of various brands for reselling as a wholesaler in his community.

loans.name: Jeniffer Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jeniffer es una joven de 23 años de edad, soltera y no tiene hijos. Actualmente está desempleada y no le ha sido fácil conseguir nuevas oportunidades de empleo, por esta razón y, con el ideal de generar ingresos por cuenta propia, desea iniciar su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes y legumbrería, para lo cual ya tiene local que se encuentra ubicado en un barrio popular de la ciudad donde reside; el negocio lo ha ido organizando con unos ahorros que poseía, pero actualmente se anima a solicitar el crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (estanterías y vitrinas) y surtido al por mayor (verduras, granos, pastas, productos de aseo y otros productos de la canasta familiar), esto le dará la posibilidad de iniciar con su idea de negocio, con el cual espera atraer muchos clientes para que conozcan la calidad de sus productos y del servicio que ofrece, pues este último será el factor diferenciador que le hará aumentar poco a poco su clientela y por ende, sus ventas. 

Jeniffer es activa, emprendedora y pujante, día a día está en busca de nuevas posibilidades que le abran las puertas para llegar a progresar y mejorar las condiciones de vida y, así avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es tener un minimercado, reconocido, rentable y sostenible en el tiempo, con el que espera generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo a madres cabeza de hogar.
texts.en:
Jeniffer is a 23-year-old woman, single, and does not have children. Currently she is unemployed and it has not been easy to find new employment opportunities. For this reason, with the idea of generating income on her own, she has decided to start her own business, a grocery and produce store. She already has premises for this business located in a popular neighborhood of the city where she lives. The business has been set up with some of her savings, but currently she wants to request a loan to invest in the purchase of fixed assets (display cabinets and shelves) and stock at wholesale (vegetables, grains, pasta, toiletries, and other household products). This will give her the opportunity to start with her business idea, with which she hopes to attract many customers to get to know the quality of her products and her service. The latter will be the differentiating factor that will gradually increase her clientele, and therefore her sales.

Jeniffer is active, enterprising, and strong. Every day she is in search of new opportunities that open doors to progress and to improve her living conditions, thus moving toward her main dream of owning a mini-market that is known, profitable, and sustainable over time. With this, she hopes to generate new employment opportunities for mothers who are heads of their households.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (display cabinets and shelves) and stock at wholesale (vegetables, grains, pasta, toiletries, and other common household products).

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, a sus 24 años de edad, es casado y padre de dos hijos. Nació en una familia humilde que por algunos años se dedicó a la agricultura, razón por la cual hoy en día él se motiva para iniciar un negocio de cría de cerdos. 

Desea sacar este negocio adelante, pero para lograrlo requiere mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, además de una buena inversión, razón por la cual solicita el crédito; con el dinero desea comprar cerdos y concentrado, esto le permitirá dar inicio a su labor con la que espera generar buenos ingresos para salir adelante y tener una estabilidad económica favorable. 

Manuel sueña con fortalecer bien su negocio y hacer de este una buena fuente de ingresos, que sea rentable y que le permita en un futuro, generar oportunidades de empleo, además sueña con convertirse en un gran empresario exitoso y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel, 24 years old, is married and the father of two children. He was born to a humble family that for some years worked in farming, and it is for this reason that today he would like to start a pig breeding business. 

He would like to take this business forward, but to achieve this it will require a lot of effort and dedication, as well as investment, which is why he is asking for this loan. With the money, he wants to buy pigs and feed supplements to help them grow, which will allow him to start working with the hope of generating good income to get ahead and have economic stability. 

Manuel dreams about growing his business and making it a good source of income, so that it is profitable and will give him a future and generate employment opportunities. He also dreams of becoming a great, successful entrepreneur and giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed supplements to start his business.

loans.name: Racha

texts.en: Racha is a 23-year-old, single Lebanese woman, living with her parents. Her father works tirelessly in order to fulfill their daily needs and represents the main income source. Racha is still studying and focusing only on her schooling. Today, with the aim to pay her Technical Studies fees, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans to continue her education.

loans.use: to pay her Technical Studies fees.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem lives in Multan, Pakistan. Like many other households in the country, she belongs to a lower middle class family consisting of her, her husband, and two children. She has big dreams for her children.

Her husband has a lot on his shoulders taking care of the whole family. He used to work for his brother but now he thinks that he should secure his and his family's future by investing in a transportation business of his own. He wants to buy an auto rickshaw, so Tasleem applied for a loan as she believes her husband will be able to repay the loan through hard work. She is obliged to the Kiva team and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 40 years old, married, and has three children attending to school. She sells grocery items for income while her husband sells religious items near the church. She used to work abroad but decided to open a local store instead.

She wants to increase her sales so she is asking for additional capital of P15,000 to buy grocery items such as canned goods, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell. This will help increase her sales and profits. She hopes to continue sending her children to school and also achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Ana Milena

texts.es:
Ana, con 34 años de edad, se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer trabajadora y pujante, con una experiencia en cocina de hace ya varios años.

Actualmente desea comprar un negocio de comidas rápidas que le ofrecen con toda la dotación y los activos ya instalados, pero requiere pintar,  adecuar el espacio y comprar los insumos al por mayor (panes, carnes frías, salsas, gaseosas, desechables, entre otros), es por ello que se motiva a solicitar el préstamo con el fin de dar inicio a su nuevo proyecto productivo.

Es madre de dos hijos y vela porque no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Ana, 34 years old, can be characterized as being hardworking and vigorous, with several years' experience in cooking and food. She is the mother of two children and does her utmost to make sure her children have all they need. 

She wants to buy a fast food business that already has all the staff and services in place, but requires painting, re-fitting of the space and buying the various wholesale supplies (bread, cold meats, sauces, sodas, disposable items, and so on). This is why she is asking for this loan, in order to start her new profitable project.

loans.use: to outfit her space and buy wholesale supplies (bread, cold meats, sauces, drinks, and disposable items, among others).

loans.name: Winner Group

texts.en:
For 27 years now Diana has been selling pastries at the market to support her family. She is married to a supportive husband, Kwebena, who works in a factory.

Due to the financial limits of her trade, she is seeking the help of Kiva through ID-Ghana for a loan to buy more flour, margarine and other pastry ingredients to improve her trade.

She is the leader of the Winner Group. With two other members, this group is located at the Sakaman, in the Chorkor area of the greater Accra region of Ghana. Diana is in the picture, on the left. She is very grateful for this loan opportunity.

loans.use: to buy more flour, margarine and other pastry ingredients for the improvement of her trade.

loans.name: Jaime Luis

texts.es:
Jaime, de 22 años, inicio con un negocio de café internet hace aproximadamente 6 años con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

En el momento, encuentra su motivación para trabajar incansablemente en su hija y es así como desea ofrecerle lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.

Hoy en día su hija tiene 4 años y se han convertido en la alegría de este hombre trabajador.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de 2 computadores y una impresora
Con este préstamo podrá sostener su negocio y a su hija brindándole una calidad de vida mejor.
Apoya a Jaime para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Jaime is 22 years old. He began an internet cafe business approximately 6 years ago with the goal of finding an occupation that would generate income to be able to survive.

At the moment, he finds his motivation to work tirelessly in his daughter. It is in this way that he wants to offer her the best for her life and development.

Today, his daughter is 4 years old and has become the joy of this hard-working man.

He is requesting a loan to purchase two computers and a printer. With this loan he will be able to sustain his business and provide for his daughter a better quality of life.

Support Jaime so that he can continue with his business!

loans.use: to buy two computers and a printer.

loans.name: Mellie

texts.en:
Mellie prays to God that her youngest child who is studying in college will obtain a degree and find a good job with the aid of her business. She is a fish vendor from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo while her husband, Romualdo, is a fisherman.

Mellie decided to sell fish five years ago to augment the income from her variety store which has been suffering from stiff competition and long time debts. Now she has already established a fish vending post at the town’s public market.

Now she wants to develop her business further. She is requesting additional capital worth PHP 24,000, which she will use to buy more volume and different varieties of fish. This supplemental capital will be very important because fish gets more expensive during rainy days. She has to sustain her business especially when her husband cannot go out fishing due to unfavorable weather.

Mellie has received several loans from Center for Community Transformation (CCT) before. CCT has been operating in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo and was able to form several fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. They meet every week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans. Mellie is consistent in attending this weekly fellowship because she can draw strength and inspiration from sharing of testimonies and study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy more volume and different varieties of fish to sell.

loans.name: Gospel Valley School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Moses. He is the Head Teacher of Gospel Valley Primary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Kayunga in Mukono district with 500 students.

Gospel Valley School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-run as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Gospel Valley School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Moses ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 39-year-old married woman. She has four children and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is striving hard to support her children, which includes providing food and healthcare. Her husband is employed in a small factory, but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family.

She started her business sewing clothes to contribute to the family income, and she is very familiar with stitching techniques. She requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, along with some spools of thread, cloth, buttons and needles, so she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. Shaheen hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, spools of thread, cloth, buttons and needles, for her tailoring work.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yakubu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Yakubu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Yakubu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with four kids. Her children do not attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Joyce has operated a vegetable-selling stall for the past seven years. She sells vegetables at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she will purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Manuel Esteban

texts.es:
Con mucho empuje y perseverancia, Manuel desea iniciar un negocio de cría y levante de cerdos en su casa ubicada en el municipio de Cotorra.

Esta idea surge a partir de la necesidad de generar unos buenos ingresos para colaborar con el sostenimiento del hogar en que vive con su familia.

Se caracteriza por ser un hombre alegre y muy colaborador, cualidades que han hecho que se gane el cariño y respeto de la gente de la vereda.
Con este préstamo podrá dar inicio a este negocio.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de cerdos pequeños y en materiales para construcción de una cochera.
texts.en:
With a lot of drive and perseverance, Manuel wants to start a business raising pigs at his home located in the city of Cotorra. This idea arose in part due to the need to generate some good income to collaborate with sustaining the home that he lives in with his family.

He is characterized as being a happy and very helpful person; qualities that have made made him earn the love and respect of people in his town. With this loan he will be able to start his business. The loan will be invested in purchasing small pigs and materials to build a pigpen.

loans.use: to buy small pigs and materials to build a pigpen.

loans.name: Maka

texts.en: Maka is a 30-year-old married woman. She lives in Zugdidi district with her husband, who is a policeman and earns a monthly income. Maka owns a small market and has a good number of clients. She decided to offer an additional service to her clients and requested a loan to purchase a coffee machine. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1400 USD. With the received credit she will purchase the coffee machine and will place it in her market. This will increase her income and she will be able to expand her market in future.

loans.use: to purchase a coffee machine to offer an additional service to her clients.

loans.name: Zainub

texts.en:
Zainub is very sharp and skilled working woman, with a vast experience of twenty years now in the field of hand embroidery. She says it is something inborn, inherited from generation to generation, and shares that its very easy for her. She actually enjoys it and that the fact that she can earn from it is the best part.

She also manages her family and is a mother of seven children living in Multan, Pakistan. She recently completed a big order and has other orders in line for her to manage, but she is now falling short of the money that will help her buy the embroidery raw materials. Therefore she applied for the loan in order to continue her business with the same amount of passion as before. She is really happy and thanks Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials.

loans.name: Hindatu

texts.en: Hindatu is a maize farmer from Sabon Gida Kanti village. As a member of Babban Gona, Hindatu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support she has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, Hindatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hindatu can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Hindatu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use her increased earnings to move into a better home with her family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Ibrahim now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members, and he would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma, 54, and her husband, Willy, are into fishing and fish vending. What they do is work in a kind of coastal fish pond where they build fish cages made of bamboo and net, commonly called “tangkal”. They have been doing this endeavor for more than 30 years, and they are now paying three helpers. With the aid of this business, they were able to send their children to school.

Not all times are favorable for this kind of endeavor. Just two years ago, their area in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo was swept by Typhoon Haiyan which greatly damaged the people’s properties, livelihoods, and lives. Wilma and her family were among those who had risen above the odds and were able to rehabilitate their business.

Now Wilma is aiming to widen her “tangkal” with the use of additional bamboo and sturdy nets. She has requested for PHP 12,000 supplemental capital to buy these materials. This method will help in the continuous recovery of her loss brought by the typhoon and will eventually give her higher profit.

Wilma meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional bamboo, nets and ropes.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a single woman and owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Loice has operated a tailoring business for the past 4 years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is a married woman and has four school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan, that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale

loans.name: Kymkatay

texts.ru: Кымкатай успешно погасила свой кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Средства кредита Кымкатай направила в  ремонт действующих коттеджей и постройку новых, также в приобретение мебели, тем самым увеличив число постояльцев. В основном у Кымкатай останавливаются спортсмены из Казахстана и России. Она вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на ремонт и благоустройство номеров. На доходы от кредита Кымкатай хочет улучшать и развивать свой бизнес, увеличивая конкурентоспособность. Также Кымкатай будет вкладывать в образование младшего сына.
texts.en:
Kymkatay has successfully paid off her loan, and she is thankful to Kiva and everyone who helped her with the financing. Kymkatay directed the funds from the loan into repairing her operating cottages, building new ones, as well as purchasing buildings, thus increasing the number of guests. For the most part, sportsmen from Kazakhstan and Russia stay at Kymkatay's cottages. 

She has again applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) in order to renovate and make improvements to her rooms. Kymkatay wants to improve and develop her business with the funds from the loan, increasing her competitive position. Kymkatay will also invest in her younger son's education.

loans.use: to repair her rental cottages and make some improvements to her rooms so as to become more competitive

loans.name: Asylkul

texts.ru: Асылкул, 50 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. У Асылкул - высшее образование, работает учителем в школе, также 25 лет она занимается сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 5 овец, 3 лошади, на 5,0 Га собственного земельного надела Асылкул выращивает люцерну. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Асылкул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и коз. Доходы от кредита Асылкул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Asylkul is 50 years old, married, and has three children. Asylkul has higher education, works as a schoolteacher, and she has also been farming for 25 years. Today on her farm there are four cows, five sheep, three horses, and on 5.0 hectares of her own land allotment Asylkul cultivates alfalfa. Her monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS). 

With the view of further developing her business, Asylkul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 75,000 som (KGS) in order to buy one cow and some goats. Asylkul plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further increase in size of her herd, and plans to save up for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy one cow and some goats in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is a 26-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a costume jewellery shop, which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband wants to purchase a variety of jewellery for the shop that includes bangles, necklaces, rings, and bracelets. Therefore Zahida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the jewellery. Zahida is hopeful that the loan will be a beneficial one for the business.

loans.use: to buy bangles, necklaces, rings, bracelets, etc., for her husband's costume jewellery shop.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer from Bamiyayi village. As a Babban Gona member, Haruna is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior farming inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Haruna can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season. Then, he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Haruna no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Haruna hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Isya

texts.en:
Isya is a maize farmer from Bamiyayi village. Before joining Babban Gona, Isya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Isya hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer from Gogarma village. As a member of Babban Gona, Iliya is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Iliya is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Mohammed has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land – 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mohammed would have had to sell his maize at harvest (when maize prices are at their lowest) to meet his immediate needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Mohammed can store his maize and sell it at a later date for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Mohammed will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Mohammed is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maria Virgelina

texts.es:
A sus 39 años, Maria tiene mucha energía y empuje para trabajar en su negocio de guardería

Cuida niños en el municipio de Bello, enseñándoles el valor de la amistad, el amor, la familia, entre otros

Es una apasionada por los infantes y siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si para cuidarlos y sacarlos adelante.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales para la adecuación del salón de juegos, la cocina y los baños; de esta forma asegurara que sus niños siempre estarán protegidos y con todas la garantías de diversión y prendizaje.
texts.en:
At the age of 39, Maria has a lot of energy and drive to work in her daycare business. She cares for children in the city of Bello, and teaches them the value of friendship, love, family, and other things. She is passionate about little children and always tries to give her best to take care of them and help them progress.

She is requesting a loan to buy materials to improve the playroom, the kitchen, and the bathrooms. In this way she will make certain that her children are always protected, and have all of the assurances for fun and learning.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve the playroom, the kitchen, and the bathrooms.

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Munawar is a 40-year-old married woman living with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a book shop where he sells stationery in his locality.

To cope with the demand, he wants to buy more stationery items. He wants to buy more copies, lead pencils, drawing pencils, canvases, books, etc. Therefore, Munawar requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy more stationery for students.

Munawar is very happy after taking this loan and praises the lenders, who are taking an active part in fundraising.

loans.use: to buy copies, lead pencils, drawing pencils, canvases, books, etc. for her husband's book shop.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Sani has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, Sani would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sani can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Sani will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Sani is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer from Gangarida village. As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will allow him to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land – 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

As a Babban Gona member, Hayatu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Hayatu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alh. Iliya

texts.en:
Alhaji Iliya is a maize farmer from Danju village. As a member of Babban Gona, Alhaji Iliya is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Iliya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Iliya can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Alhaji Iliya is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and, in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abdullahi	Himidi

texts.en:
Abdullahi is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Abdullahi is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Abdullahi would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdullahi will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season, when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/ha, Abdullahi now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Joshua has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Joshua would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Joshua can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Joshua will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Joshua is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Samaila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Samaila will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Samaila is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike for business.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ihsan

texts.en:
Ihsan is a 41-year-old married mother of one. Three years ago, she started a business of washing beauty salon towels to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their only child.

She is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business; thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a larger washing machine to better satisfy all her customers' demands.

Ihsan hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger washing machine to better satisfy all her customers' demands.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira, 19 years old, is a single Palestinian refugee who seeks beauty and happiness in everything she does. She started providing beauty services from her parents' house and by visiting customers' homes upon request.

Samira has been a skilled hairdresser and makeup artist for four years. She started working at an early age to support her family in making their living. Samira is developing her business and is seeking to open a spectacular beauty salon in the future, when she finds herself financially capable enough to take this step forward.

As for today, Samira is taking her first step towards developing her career. She is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a car that will help her expand her working zone and provide her beauty services freely all over her neighboring villages.

loans.use: to buy a car that will help her expand her working zone and provide her beauty services freely all over her neighboring villages.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ayuba has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Ayuba is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana resides in a small town of Multan, Pakistan with her husband and four children. Her husband is able to earn the bread for the family, but Rehana wanted to share her husband's burden, so she decided to start her clothing business five years ago.

Her embroidery skills are well polished, and her work is admired by her customers. But now the barrier in her way is that she is not in a position to buy the required raw material to continue her work. Therefore, she applied for the loan from BRAC Pakisan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials for her clothing business.

loans.name: Auwalu

texts.en:
Auwalu is a maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Auwalu is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land – 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Normally, Auwalu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Auwalu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price (up to 37% more than at harvest).

With the chance to earn up to $2000 per hectare, Auwalu may now realize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and his family. He would like to use this additional income to provide employment on his farm for members of his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a woman who takes her job very seriously. Three years ago, in a small area of Lahore, she started her embroidery business with the goal of making her children better human beings in the society by educating them all.

So now her dream is coming true, and her children are being educated by their mother in the small town of Multan, Pakistan, along with her husband.

She applied for the loan in order to buy needed raw materials for her embroidery business. Asma is much happier and feels obliged to the the Kiva team and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy needed raw materials for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
The town of Barotac Viejo, in the province of Iloilo, has a sea bordering on one side, which is why fishing and fish selling are two of the residents' most common occupations. Belen started selling fish 37 years ago when she married a fisherman named Danilo. The business has augmented their family’s resources since then. The couple’s combined income has successfully supported their children’s simple needs. Now their children are already grown up and starting their own families.

Belen usually sells the fish that her husband catches. However, due to long time use, their nets are now ruptured and disintegrated. They have to make or buy new fishing nets to replace the old ones. For this reason, Belen is seeking your kindness to lend her PHP 8,000 to buy nets, rolls of nylon, and notches.

Belen wishes to buy another fishing boat that her neighbors can rent. As she and her husband approach their retirement age, they still hope to earn a living through boat rentals.

Belen is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy nets, rolls of nylon, and notches to make new fishing nets.

loans.name: D.f

texts.en:
D.f is a maize farmer from Sarki village. As a Babban Gona member, D.f is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior farming inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, D.f would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, D.f can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season. Then, he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, D.f no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, D.f hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Irimiya

texts.en:
Irimiya is maize farmer from Kanakargo village. As a member of Babban Gona, Irimiya is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria).

Before joining Babban Gona, Irimiya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Irimiya can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Irimiya is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family. In the end, he hopes to use his increased earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Zeebah

texts.en:
Zeebah is a 52-year-old married mother of eight children. She worked in a bakery making "Saj" bread to help her husband cover the increasing needs and expenses of their children. She gained experience in this domain from her mother, and she is well-known among her region for her tasty bread.

Today, Zeebah is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to open her own bakery, selling "Saj" bread. This will increase her family's income and allow her to work independently.
Zeebah hopes to expand her business in the future to stay capable of providing her family with decent living conditions.

loans.use: to open her own bakery, selling "Saj" bread, which will increase her family's income.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia, age 28, is a married woman living with her husband in the area of Lahore Pakistan. She is hardworking and brave and is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Being a mother, she wants to provide better facilities to her children, which is the reason she is doing extraordinary hard work to keep at smiling her children.

She has been sewing clothes since the birth of her two children, when she observed that her husband failed to provide all the necessities for her children. Then she decided to start tailoring work at home and now she is sewing the clothes of her community. She wants to enhance the beauty of her stitching, so she wants to buy a Juki sewing machine. She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives and the local community.

Nazia has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demands. Nazia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons  for her tailoring work.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Normally, to meet his immediate cash needs, Yusuf has to sell his maize at harvest, when maize prices are at their lowest. With this loan, Yusuf can store his maize and sell it at a later date for up to 37% more than the price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Yusuf has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare. Yusuf is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to pay for his children's school fees and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 21-year-old single man. He started his current business, a shop selling mobile phones, nine months ago. Mohamad used to work in a printing company, but he decided to start his own career and develop his living.

Mohamad's business is going fine but not well enough to cover his necessary living needs and increase his business capital at the same time. The lack of liquidity is the problem which prevents him from expanding his business.

Thus an acquired youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will be invested in purchasing new released mobile phones, accessories, and prepaid cards to increase his sales and income at the same time. He hopes to stay capable of expanding his business and opening a wider shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase newly released mobile phones, accessories, and prepaid cards to increase his sales and income at the same time.

loans.name: Rabiaa

texts.en:
Rabiaa is a 26-year-old single lady who is in her first year university, majoring in Radio/TV. She is seeking to graduate with good grades within a few years. Rabiaa has been employed in a gadget and gift shop since 2008, to cover her living needs and pay for her education expenses.

Rabiaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for her university tuition fees. She hopes, in the future, to work in the TV/Radio domain and to open a gadget and gift shop, which she is skilled in managing with her current experience.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fees for her Radio/TV major.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is a 50-year-old married mother of six. Ten years ago, she started working by preparing and selling "Mouneh" (traditional preserved food) to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is well-known among her region for her tasty and delicious "Mouneh."

Hanaa's family income is still not enough to cover any additional expenses. Therefore, she is now acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a partnership in a bakery, which will improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a partnership in a bakery to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Khouloud Group

texts.en:
Khouloud is the featured borrower for Khouloud Group. She got together with her fellow group members to acquire this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and their families' living standards at the same time.

Khouloud is a 39-year-old married mother of two, who started working in handicrafts 10 years ago to help her husband in satisfying the needs and expenses of their family.

Due to increasing living costs, Khouloud is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her children's increasing school tuition fees and stationery.

Khouloud is the lady at the center of the picture, accompanied by Najwa at the right and Huda at the far left side.

loans.use: to pay for her children's increasing school tuition fees and stationery.

loans.name: Layal

texts.en:
Layal is a 26-year-old married mother of one child. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her six-year-old child's school tuition fees.

The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back-to-School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students from low income families. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses.

By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Layal hopes to continue supporting her child's education and improve their living.

loans.use: to pay for her six-year-old child's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Sokaina

texts.en:
Sokaina is a 32-year-old married mother of four, who has run a home products shop for one year. She is working hard to support her husband, who works in the same sector, to increase their beloved family's income and cover their increasing living needs.

Sokaina is working hard to develop her newly established business. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to purchase the new released home products collection to diversify her products and attract customers' attention. Sokaina hopes that one day she will make her working place more attractive with a special artistic way to display her products.

loans.use: to purchase the new released home products collection to diversify her products and attract customers' attention.

loans.name: Lucelly

texts.es:
Mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y tener un negocio sostenible son los grandes sueños de Lucelly, que con su trabajo de zapatería intenta ganarse la vida día a día.
Trabaja en la calle con la colaboración de su esposo quien ha sido un gran apoyo para ella.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de insumos como suelas, cuero, tintes, clavos y pagar algunos proveedores.
texts.en:
Lucelly's main dreams in life are to improve her living conditions and keep her business going. She earns a living making shoes and selling them as a street vendor along with her husband, who has been a great source of support for her.

Lucelly is asking for a loan to buy shoe-making supplies such as leather, dyes, nails and soles, and to pay her suppliers.

loans.use: buy supplies like leather, dyes, nails and soles, and pay suppliers

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona, 44 years old, is a divorced mother of one child. For the past year, this hardworking woman has been putting in so much effort to develop her newly established business to make her living and to cover the living expenses of her child and an additional family member, whom she is socially and financially supporting.

Mona runs a shop selling perfumes, cosmetics, accessories and bags. She is building a good trust bond with her customers and is working hard to provide them with a good quality of products with affordable prices.

Mona is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her merchandise with special autumn and winter newly released cosmetic, perfume and bag collections to increase her sales. She hopes to continue expanding her business and fulfilling her family's increasing living needs.

loans.use: to increase the merchandise of her newly established business with special autumn and winter cosmetic, perfume and bag collections to increase her sales.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 29-year-old married mother of one child, who is working hard along with her husband (who is a plumber) to improve their family's financial situation and provide their child a better life. Zeinab and her family live in a region of Lebanon officially recognized as a poverty pocket.

Zeinab sells clothes out of her home because she can't afford to open a separate shop. She is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to prepare a room inside her house to improve her newly established beauty services business.

She will develop her beauty services skills and will work hard to transform her business into a beauty salon, where she can also sell or rent clothes and special occasion dresses.

loans.use: to prepare a room inside her home to improve her newly established beauty services business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Like many residents of Barotac Viejo, Iloilo in the Visayas region, Susan and her husband Joemarie consider the sea as the main source of their daily living. Joemarie is a fisherman while Susan sells what her husband catches. Usually she also buys additional fish from other fishermen.

Susan experiences rigid competition in this kind of business, but she pursues because it’s her way of helping her husband earn a living. When the weather is unfavorable for fishing and fish selling, she has an alternative source of income -- selling ready-to-wear clothes. She patiently works hard for the sake of her children. Rain or shine, she keeps on. Hopefully all her efforts will be rewarded someday when her children are all professionals. With a college degree, she aspires that her children will have a better opportunity to live a better life.

As a step towards her dream, she needs additional capital of PHP 11,000 that she will use to buy different varieties of fish in volume quantity. It will surely increase her profit and will be of great help to her family.

Susan is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of fish in volume quantity

loans.name: Nohad

texts.en:
Nohad is a 50-year-old married mother of four children. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay education tuition fees for three of her children.

The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back-to-School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students from low income families. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses.

By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Nohad hopes to continue supporting her children's education and improve their living.

loans.use: to pay for her three children's education tuition fees.

loans.name: Yohan Sebastian

texts.es:
Sin mucho capital, Yohan montó su taller de confección con el ánimo de generar ingresos con los cuales pueda sostener sus estudios.
La actividad la aprendió de un amigo y vecino quien le enseño este oficio.

Con sus trabajos, Yohan ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes que le han garantizado muy buenas ventas mensuales, por lo que espera que su negocio siga creciendo y posteriormente pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. 

Con la finalidad de responder a la demanda sus clientes, Yohan busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una maquina recubridora y a la compra de insumos para la confección.
texts.en:
Without much capital, Yohan build his tailor's shop with the goal of generating an income with which he could sustain his studies.

He learned this kind of work from a friend and a neighbor, who showed him this trade.

With his work, Yohan succeeded in attracting a great number of customers, who ensure him very good monthly sales. His goal is for his business to keep on growing and then generate employment for people in need.

With the intention to meet his customers demands, Yohan is requesting a loan, which will offer him the possibility of buying a sewing machine and buying supplies for sewing.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and to buy supplies for sewing.

loans.name: Ratiman

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Ratiman, one of Ruma's agents who lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Ratiman is happily married. He lives there with his children and his wife. As a main source of income, Ratiman owns and manages a small stall that sells mobile phone sim cards and mobile phone airtime credits to his community. He joined Ruma because he is interested in Ruma's system where the salesperson comes to the agent's stall to collect the money.

As the business continues, Ratiman is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits, especially on the weekends. In the near future, Ratiman also plans to improve his selling with a new product from Ruma, e-commerce for lower communities called 'Mapan'.

In the photo, Ratiman is sitting in his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases  for members of his local community.

loans.name: Reno

texts.en:
Reno is a 61-year-old married man. He lives with his wife in Zugdidi district. Reno is unemployed and wants to start a business in order to generate income. The Startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,500 GEL. With the received credit, he will purchase a stock of nuts and will start a trading business. He will purchase nuts from the wholesalers and will resell at a higher price in order to generate a stable income.

Reno awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading nuts to generate income.

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru: Чынара, 49 лет, вдова, есть 3 детей. У нее - средне-специальное бухгалтерское образование, Чынара работает, также занимается сельским хозяйством, в качестве дополнительного дохода для ее семьи. Благодаря упорному труду Чынары, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 коровы, 15 овец, 6 лошадей. На 1,20 Га земли выращивает люцерну и пшеницу для реализации. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль Чынары составляет около 28,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Чынара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров для увеличения удоя органического молока. Доходы от кредита Чынара планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и покупку автомобиля.
texts.en:
Chynara is 49 years old, widowed, and has three children. She has specialised secondary education in accountancy. Chynara works, and also farms as a means of supplementing her family's income. Thanks to Chynara's persistent hard work, today on her farm there are two cows, fifteen sheep, and six horses. On 1.20 hectares of land, she cultivates alfalfa for sale. Chynara's total monthly income is about 28,000 som (KGS). 

With the view of further expanding her business, Chynara has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) in order to buy two dairy cows for increasing her yield of organic milk. Chynara plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further development of her business, and in purchasing a car.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows in order to increase the volume of organic milk sales

loans.name: Zhibek

texts.ru: Жибек, 56 лет, вдова, есть 2 сыновей. У Жибек- высшее образование, работает редактором в местной газете. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается сельским хозяйством, стартовав 35 лет назад. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, лошадь, на 0,06 Га собственного земельного надела Жибек выращивает картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на содержание семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жибек обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 2 бычков. Доходы от кредита Жибек планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и постройку сараев для скота.
texts.en: Zhibek is 56 years old, widowed, and has two sons. Zhibek has a higher education, and works as an editor at the local newspaper. In order to earn extra income for her family, she also works in agriculture, having started 35 years ago. Today on her farm Zhibek has 2 cows and a horse, and also grows potatoes on 0.06 hectares of her own land. Her monthly income is 11,000 som (KGS), however this is not enough means to support her family. In order to further develop her business, Zhibek turned to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase 2 steers, and therefore increase the total number of cattle. With income from the loan, Zhibek plans to invest in further expanding her number of domestic cattle, and in constructing barns for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy two steers in order to increase her income

loans.name: Markus

texts.en:
Markus is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Markus has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Markus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Markus can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Markus will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Markus is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina’s enterprise has benefited from previous cases when she received financial assistance from Kiva. Last time, she used the funds she was given to expand her vending location and make it more spacious for all the inventory she had for display there. Marina’s income increased as a result.

This time, Marina is hoping to use 20 000 Grivnyas to purchase jeanswear for children, as well as workout gear and seasonal footwear . Despite currency and price fluctuations in the Ukraine, Marina is willing to work harder to generate a stable income and provide for her family as much as she can.

loans.use: to purchase jeanswear for children, as well as workout gear and seasonal footwear

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Zoya is from Belaya Tserkov. She runs a shoe business at one of the biggest marketplaces in her home town. She has been a private entrepreneur for 23 years.

Zoya has been working with this type of merchandise for 11 years. She owns her vending facility and the land lot it sits on. She is 55, and she has a grown daughter who is 36.

Zoya needs 40,000 UAH to buy men’s seasonal footwear to sell this winter. She is hoping to diversify her assorted merchandise and re-stock it in order to meet her customers’ demands.

Being sociable and entrepreneurial as she is, Zoya will definitely make a wise investment of the received funds which will lead to consistent growth of her business.

loans.use: to buy men’s seasonal footwear to sell this winter.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 44-year-old entrepreneur from Digos City, Davao Del Sur. She has found ways to make her variety store more competitive. She converted part of the house into a boarding house and started a canteen business for her boarders. Her profit supplements her husband's income. It pays for their daily expenses and the higher education needs of their youngest child.

But there’s a lean season for Lorna’s business. The past semestral break for college students lessened her income. Her student boarders went for their 2-week vacation. Now that they are back for the second semester, Lorna wants to recover some losses and gain a better profit. She will use the loan to buy ingredients, grocery items, and roofing materials for her boarding house.

In due time, she hopes that her enterprises will progress and will give her family a more comfortable life. Lorna meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members every to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients, grocery items, and roofing materials for her boarding house.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Gabriel has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, Gabriel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Gabriel can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Gabriel will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Gabriel is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, no siguió estudiando porque sus padres no quisieron que estudiara, aparte de eso creció en un hogar desintegrado y quienes sufrieron las consecuencias fueron ella y sus hermanos, pero ahora está acompañada su esposo se dedica a la agricultura tienen dos hijos por lo que su familia la conforman cuatro personas.

Flor, se dedica a engordar cerdos en el lugar donde vive porque vive en un lugar rustico y no tiene ningún servicio público, ellos se abastecen de agua por un pozo que está a tres kilómetros del caserío más cercano y pareja ahí mismo cuida ganado porque es corralero de animales y estos trabajo los realizan todos los días.  

Flor, necesita el préstamo para comprar cerdos pequeños para criarlos y engordarlos, porque engordo dos y le fue muy bien.

El sueño más grande de Flor, es comprar un medio de transporte para que se les facilite la salida cuando van a vender los animales.
texts.en: Flor is 26 years old. She studied through high school.  She did not continue her studies because her parents did not want her to study. Aside from this, she grew up in a broken home, where she and her siblings suffered because of it. However, now she has a partner. Her husband works in agriculture. Their family is made up of four, as they have two children. Flor works fattening pigs where she lives, because she lives in a rustic place where there are no public utilities. They stock up on water from a well that is three kilometers from the nearest group of houses. Precisely there they look after the livestock because it is the corral for the animals. These jobs are done every day. Flor needs the loan to buy small pigs to raise and fatten, because she fattened two and it worked well for her. Flor's dream is to buy a mode of transportation that will make it easier to leave when they sell the animals.

loans.use: to buy small pigs to raise and fatten them.

loans.name: Ahmadu

texts.en:
Ahmadu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ahmadu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, Ahmadu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ahmadu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ahmadu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Ahmadu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en:
Mustapha is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Mustapha is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Mustapha would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Mustapha can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Mustapha has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Mustapha is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to repair his house or moving into a bigger home. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Haruna has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Haruna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Haruna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
