Daniel is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Daniel has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Daniel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Daniel can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Daniel will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Daniel is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en:
Nuhu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Nuhu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric tons of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Nuhu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Nuhu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Nuhu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Nuhu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to eliminate pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Любовь не первый раз прибегает за помощью к КИВА. Благодаря полученной от КИВА помощи ее бизнес стабильно развивается, ей удается привлекать новых клиентов. Единственное, что создает трудности в работе для нее – это экономические трудности и нестабильность местной валюты. 
На 50 000 гривен Любовь хочет купить женские халаты и белье на продажу по нынешним ценам. Любовь слышала об очередном грядущем подорожании оптового товара, поэтому и хочет успеть купить партию товара по доступным ценам.

loans.use: to purchase lingerie and bathrobes.

loans.name: Gulan

texts.ru: Гулан, 50 лет, вдова, есть 3 детей, самому младшему сыну 19 лет. Гулан, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2005 году. Благодаря упорному труду Гулан, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы. Также на участке 2,25 Га она выращивает люцерну для внутрихозяйственного потребления и картофель для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль Гулан - 14,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на содержание семьи воспитание и обучение детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку топлива, найм рабочих и аренду трактора для сбора и транспортировки урожая картофеля. Доходы от кредита Гулан позволят улучшить благосостояние семьи, она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, так как хочет накопить средства на пристройку к дому и оплату за обучение сына.
texts.en: Gulan is 50 years old, and widowed with three children; her youngest son is 19 years old. Earning the primary income for her family, Gulan works in animal husbandry and crop cultivation, having started in 2005. Thanks to Gulan's tireless hard work, she currently has 2 cows on her farm. Additionally, she grows alfalfa for personal consumption and potatoes for sale on 2.25 hectares of land. Gulan's monthly profit is 14,000 som (KGS), but this is not enough means to support her family and raise and educate her children. In order to further develop her business, Gulan turned to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase fuel, hire workers and rent a tractor for harvesting and transporting the potatoes. Proceeds from the loan will allow Gulan to improve the wellbeing of her family. She plans to invest in the further expansion of the business, as she wants to save money for an extension on her house and pay for her son's education.

loans.use: to purchase fuel, hire workers and rent a tractor to harvest and transport potatoes

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works in her own "sari-sari" (general) store, which offers a variety of merchandise to her customers. She sells toothpaste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasonings, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar, and bath soap. This has been her business for three years now.

As a mother of three children, ages three to thirteen years, Marilyn wants to manage her business well to support their school needs. She is asking for a loan from CEVI to buy canned sardines, beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar, matches, biscuits, and liquor.

Marilyn hopes to make her business more attractive to people so she can increase her customer base, thus making it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy canned sardines,  beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar,  matches,  biscuits and liquor.

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lorena es una madre de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo.
Se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer activa y guerrera, durante muchos años trabajó como auxiliar de cocina en un restaurante, luego pasó a trabajar como empleada doméstica interna en una casa de familia; pero con el ánimo de pasar más tiempo con sus hijos desea independizarse y montar su propio negocio de venta de postres; la idea surge por la necesidad y para aprovechar que posee amplia experiencia en el manejo de alimentos.

Esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará insumos como dulces, leche, recipientes y utensilios de cocina; así podrá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar muy buenos resultados para seguir apoyando económicamente a su esposo e hijos.

Lorena manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es ver su negocio en funcionamiento, pues sabe que con mucho trabajo, esfuerzo y dedicación podrá sacarlo adelante y lograr que sea reconocido en el sector; así estará en la capacidad de dar mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar a los que ama.
texts.en:
Lorena is a mother of 3 children who she has worked very hard to provide for.  She is characterized as being a very active woman and a fighter.  During many years she worked as a kitchen assistant in a restaurant, and later she worked as a family's housekeeper.  With the aim to spend more time with her children, she wishes to become more independent and start her own business selling desserts.  The idea arose from necessity and to take advantage of her ample experience with handling food.  

This drives her to request the support of a loan with which she will buy supplies such as candy, milk, containers, and kitchen utensils. This way she will be able to start her productive project, which she hopes will have good results so she can continue to support her husband and children economically. 

Lorena states that her greatest wish is to see her business in operation, since she knows that with a lot of work, effort, and dedication she can move it forward and achieve recognition in her sector.  This way she will be able to provide a better quality of life and well-being for those she loves.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as candy, milk, containers, and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Diana Milena

texts.es:
Diana con su gran voluntad y verdaderos deseos de salir adelante junto con su familia compuesta por su esposo y sus dos hijos, decidió emprender con un negocio de venta de mercancía como ropa y accesorios para vestir.  

Estos elementos intenta venderlos para obtener la manutención de su familia.
Es una mujer emprendedora, con visión, juiciosa, organizada y muy simpática; valores que la han convertido en una vendedora muy reconocida.

Su anhelo es poder aumentar y hacer crecer su negocio, es por eso que solicita el apoyo de un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de ropa al por mayor, zapatos y accesorios.
Solo de este modo podrá tener esa gran oportunidad de progresar.
texts.en:
With her great will and true desire to improve her family's financial situation, Diana decided to undertake a business of selling merchandise such as clothes and accessories. Her family consists of her husband and their two children.

She wants to sell these items to support her family.

She is a hard-working woman, with a vision, mature, organized, and sympathetic. These values have made her into a very well-known sales woman.

Her desire is to increase and grow her business, which is why she is requesting a loan to invest into buying clothes at wholesale, shoes and accessories.

This is the only way how she will be able to have such a great opportunity of progress.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale, shoes and accessories.

loans.name: Mariami

texts.en:
Mariami is a 56-year-old woman, from Kutaisi, west Georgia. She has a son and daughter-in-law. In spite of her high education, Mariami was unable to find any stable job and started a private small business.

Mariami needs financial support to open a general store. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. She will purchase all needed equipment and products and will start working as a sales woman.

The loan will greatly assist Mariami, improve her economic situation, and give her family a better lifestyle. She thanks the lenders for helping her to maintain her business.

loans.use: to open a general store and start her own business.

loans.name: Alh. Hussaini

texts.en:
Alhaji Hussaini is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji Hussaini has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric tons of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Hussaini would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Alhaji Hussaini can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Hussaini will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Alhaji Hussaini is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to  eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alisabatu

texts.en:
Alisabatu is a maize farmer from Dogon Awo village. As a Babban Gona member, Alisabatu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric tons of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alisabatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Alisabatu can to store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Alisabatu no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Alisabatu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sea And Salt Group

texts.en:
Mrs Bình is 54 years old and she is married with 3 children. She has been working in agriculture making salt for more than 10 years. Bình lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family belongs to a low-income household, and moreover, in the village, the market need is low in this region. This line of work is very hard and the income is not high enough to do what she really needs to have a comfortable life.

The main hardship that Bình faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase necessary equipment for improving her agricultural productivity. In 2012, Bình joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Since then, her income has increased significantly. She is the leader of "Sea And Salt" Group, which consists of 4 members.

In the future, Bình hopes to make enough money to be able to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase necessary equipment for improving her productivity.

loans.name: Julieto

texts.en:
Julieto's dream is to finish his college degree and obtain a more stable job. He is a 25-year-old single man who works really hard to improve his sari-sari business. He knows that the store's income is unstable, so he also has a car wash service.

He is paying for his college education and has had to to stop studying due to financial problems. He resumes his studies every time he gets the chance.

He will use a loan to buy groceries, toiletries, rice, and beverages. He’s hoping that this amount will enhance the competitiveness of his store. He also plans to raise hogs. It’s hard to imagine how he manages all these tasks, but because of his diligence and hard work, it’s not impossible.

He lives in Digos City, Davao Del Sur together with his parents and siblings. CCT has been operating in this area and was able to form several fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. They meet every week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans. Julieto is consistent in attending this weekly fellowship because he can draw strength and inspiration from sharing of testimonies and study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, rice, and beverages.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar is from the frontier village of Aygehovit in the Tavsuh region. She is very thankful for her first Kiva loan which was great because she managed to develop her farm and earn more income for her family. Gohar has vocational medical education and the specialty of nurse, but she has always been engaged in farming and has never looked for work in her specialty. Since her husband is still working abroad, Gohar has gotten used to all the hard farm work, livestock care (on her farm she has buffalos, pigs, and lots of chickens), and land cultivation (she has nice vineyard and apple, fig, and persimmon trees). Gohar sells a great assortment of very tasty farm products such as macun (national dairy-product) made of buffalo milk, pork, poultry, and eggs. She sells fruit right from her farm, but separates part of it for her family’s use. Gohar lives with her school-aged children and mother-in-law. Gohar requests this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams because she wants to buy 2 pigs (in winter, pork is in great demand) and fodder for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy 2 pigs (in winter, pork is in great demand) and fodder for all her livestock

loans.name: Happy Group

texts.en:
Mão is 41 years old and. She is married with three children. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general items for three years.

Mão lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Mão faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

In 2013, Mão joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Since then, her income has increased significantly. She is the leader of "Happy Group," which consists of four members.

Mão's hopes are for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

loans.name: Anipa

texts.ru: Анипа, 62 года, вдова, 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, с 2000 года занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 15 овец, 2 лошади, а также 1,60 ГА арендованной и 1,56 ГА собственной поливной земли, где Анипа выращивает картофель, люцерну, ячмень. Она известна, как жизнерадостный, честный, трудолюбивый человек. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анипа обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы улучшат благосостояние семьи Анипы, она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и хочет накопить на обучение внуков.
texts.en:
Anipa is 62 years old, widowed, and has three children. She has a secondary education, and since 2000 has worked in agriculture. On her farm, Anipa has 4 cows, 15 sheep and 2 horses, and also grows alfalfa, potatoes and barley on 1.60 hectares of rented and 1.56 hectares of owned land.

She is well-known as a cheerful, honest, hard-working person. In order to further develop her farm, Anipa turned to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS), which she will use to purchase sheep for fattening and resale. The income will improve the wellbeing of Anipa's family; she plans to use it to develop her farm and wants to save for her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Dayyabu

texts.en:
Dayyabu is a Babban Gona maize farmer.  Dayyabu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. 

Traditionally, Dayyabu would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona Dayyabu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Dayyabu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. 

Dayyabu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having had no money to purchase better inputs to improve his yield and looks forward to using his additional earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Musa is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.
Traditionally, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona Musa, he can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Musa has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Musa is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having had no money to pay for his children's school fees and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Moko Sane Moko Sane Group

texts.en:
The community group Moko Sane Moko Sane now comprises five mothers with 12 children between them. They come from Chorkor-lantemaa mi, which is west of the greater Accra region. They are known for their hardworking and responsible nature and are motivated to improve their personal circumstances. At the moment, they are striving to make a good living for their children and provide them with better life opportunities. Unfortunately, they were not able to study and they found it necessary to work from a young age to help with the household costs.

Due to her appetite for moving forward, the group co-ordinator is Emelia, who has a business making and selling gari from her home. She works ten hours every day selling gari to order, both to businesses and in the market. With her loan she plans to buy more cassava to make gari. The Moko Sane Moko Sane group is grateful for the help that Kiva investors provide to people with few resources and to poor countries such as Ghana, to enable them to have a way to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy more cassava to make gari.

loans.name: Alive For Health Group

texts.en:
Christiana is from the Korle Gorno district of Chorkor. She lives with her husband and son. She does not want shortage of income to be the reason why her child can not have access to formal education.

She currently sell provisions at a very busy market place to earn a monthly income of 200 GHS. She believes she can earn more income if she buys more items. She received training from ID-Ghana to develop her skills to increase her income. She needs a loan to buy more items.

Christiana formed a 4-member group to apply for a group loan. The other members of the group also seek funds to increase their own \ businesses so they can lead a better and more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy more items.

loans.name: Wo Fee Ekome Group

texts.en:
Fusena is a young businesswoman. She is a representative of the 'Wo Fee Ekome' group (see group picture, Fusena is in the middle).

Fusema has been in the bread business for the past eight years. She opens her business six days a week from 8am to 6pm.

Fusena established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning materials, and provides food from the profits she gets from the business with the support of her husband.

Fusena and her group members need a total of 2,300 GHS, of which she is entitled to 800 GHS, which she will use to buy more bread to nourish and supply her clients and buyers. She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Fusena is married and has three children, all of whom attend school.

In the future, Fusena plans to generate more money to provide for her childrens' education. She believes that educating her children to university will better the lives of her family.
Fusena and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bread to nourish and supply her clients and buyers.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is woman in her late 40s. She has a loving husband, and she has been married long enough to see her three children grow into young adults who are married and have families of their own. Esperanza lives with her husband, and they take care of each other.

In order to earn a living, Esperanza sells plastic lunch boxes and breakfasts at a small store. She started this business five years ago, and she enjoys it because it provides her with a fair income to contribute to her household.

Esperanza has been doing well with her business and now she is looking to restock her inventory to meet client demand. To achieve this goal, she is seeking a 5,000 MXN loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to stock her business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a 36-year-old woman who lives under free union with her boyfriend. Together, they are the parents of four children, aged 16, 13, 7, and 2. She is proud because they have been keeping up with the daily challenges of life. Her biggest achievements are finishing construction on her house, moving her family ahead, and getting a business of her own.

Josefina earns a living by crafting different kinds of purses for different kinds of equipment. Her main customers are policemen who work near her house. She enjoys her job very much.
She likes working because it allows her to contribute to the household income. Josefina is applying for a 21,053 MXN loan to buy raw materials that she will craft into articles she will sell later.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Keep Smiling Group

texts.en:
Liên is 53 years old and married. She has been operating a food stall selling rice noodles for six years.

Liên lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Liên faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to diversify her food by purchasing additional types of ingredients and equipment for cooking and serving more customers.

In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of "Keep Smiling," which consists of four members.

Liên's hopes are for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to diversify her food by purchasing additional types of ingredients and equipment for cooking and serving more customers.

loans.name: Hiệp's Group

texts.en:
Hiệp is 39 years old and married. She has had a retail business selling dry food for five years.

Hiệp lives in Yen Dinh district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region and the income from this job is not high enough to do what she really needs to live a comfortable life.

The main hardship that Hiệp faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to increase the quantity of food to resell.

This is Hiệp's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan will improve her living standard. She is the group leader of a three-member group.

Hiệp's hopes are for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of food to resell

loans.name: Elver Emiro

texts.es: Elver es un hombre emprendedor cuya principal prioridad en la vida es ofrecer bienestar y una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, es por ello que inició su negocio de venta de bebidas aromáticas y café en Soledad un municipio del Atlántico.  Su anterior empleo como ayudante en una cafetería, le permitió adquirir el conocimiento para que posteriormente emprendiera su propio negocio, sin embargo consideró que deambulando por las calles del municipio en su bicicleta obtendría mejores resultados. Instaló una canastilla en la parte delantera de su bicicleta donde porta las cafeteras llenas de bebidas aromáticas y café, y demás insumos para despachar sus productos.  Alternamente comercializa prendas de vestir por encargos que le realizan vecinos y amigos, y a partir de las 4p.m. hasta las 8 p.m. presta servicio de mensajería a una empresa privada, cuya labor es entregar encomiendas en su bicicleta.  Elver desea aprovechar la demanda que se aproxima a raíz de las fiestas decembrinas, las cuales reactivan mucho el comercio en general, es por ello que logra vender muchas más bebidas calientes a sus clientes quienes está en las calles más temprano realizando su trabajo, y para cumplir con su propósito está  aplicando un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en café, bolsas aromáticas, azúcar, vasitos desechables y un nuevo surtido de prendas de vestir.  A futuro Elver desea tener un local y generar los recursos necesarios para costear la educación académica de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elver is an enterprising man whose chief priority in life is to offer well-being and a better quality of life to his family. Because of this, he started his business selling aromatic drinks and coffee in Soledad, a municipality in Atlántico. His previous employment as a coffee shop assistant allowed him to acquire the knowledge to later open his own business. However, he thought that wandering through the municipality's streets on his bicycle would obtain better results. He installed a small basket on the front part of his bicycle where he transports coffee pots full of aromatic drinks and coffee, in addition to supplies to serve his products.

He also sells articles of clothing through orders that neighbors and friends make. From 4PM to 8PM, he offers his services as a messenger in a private company, where he delivers parcels on his bicycle. Elver wants to take advantage of the coming demand from the festivities in December, which kick-start business in general. Because of this he is able to sell many hot drinks to his clients who are on the streets early doing their jobs. In order to meet his goal, he is applying for a CrediKiva. This is the first financing he has done with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He will invest it in coffee, aromatic bags, sugar, disposable cups, and new selection of articles of clothing. In the future, Elver hopes to have a shop and to generate the resources necessary to finance the academic education of his children.

loans.use: invest in coffee, aromatic bags, sugar, disposable cups, and a new assortment of articles of clothing.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is a 30-year-old woman. She is married to a loving husband, but she hasn't been lucky enough to have children of her own yet. She is waiting to have a reliable and high income before bringing children into this world.

Araceli's household is mainly supported by her husband, but she like to play a contributing role by working and earning money of her own. To make a living, she sells fish at the market. She sells them as pets and she does well because she has no competition. However, Araceli thinks she can perform better if she is able to buy showcases and fishbowls to display her fish. To get them, she is looking for a 10,000 MXN loan. She dreams of having another business selling pet fish.

loans.use: to buy tanks and fishbowls.

loans.name: Revelyn

texts.en:
Revelyn is a mother of 3 children, aged 7, 8, and 13. She and her husband, who is a farmer, live in the community of Valencia in Bohol.

Revelyn is dependent on her hog raising business and sari-sari (general) store to earn an income and give her family what they need. Her store has existed for 4 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, cigarettes, chips, piglets, and feed.

Revelyn hopes to have an abundant life as a result of her successful business. Her income will be used to buy food and pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, cigarettes, chips, piglets, and feed.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
God continually molds the people who are willing to submit to His tending hands. Nena, 49, is a single parent who has learned to give up her former unpleasant lifestyle through the guidance of God and her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative in Polomolok, South Cotabato.

She managed to turn her old habits into productive ways of income generation. She now has a variety store that she wishes to transform into a grocery store someday. She also retails pork, meat, rice, and RTWs (ready-to-wear) such as pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, undergarments, and other ready-to-wear apparel. The income derived from her business sustains her and her child’s everyday needs. It’s challenging for her to manage her household and business simultaneously, but her child serves as her daily motivation.

Nena focuses on her goal to provide for her child’s needs to complete her college degree soon. This goal fuels her to expand her business by trying to meet the demands of customers. She plans to put additional shelves inside her store and fill it with stocks of merchandise. She will also buy more up-to-date clothes and add sweaters or jackets in time for the cold Christmas season. Later on, she will also buy a big freezer where she can store large volumes of meat and frozen foods. For now, she needs additional capital worth 30,000 PHP to partially attain her goal. She hopes you are willing to help a single parent like her.

Nena regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional shelves and merchandise for her store; and to buy more up-to-date clothes to sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a 51-year-old single woman. Despite her status, she works hard to sustain a living for herself and extend meager financial assistance to her siblings, nephews, and nieces. She doesn’t want to work for herself alone. As of today, she is busy selling general commodities in the area of Polomolok, South Cotabato.

Sometimes she feels sad having no husband or child, and her parents have already died. She’s just thankful that there's this fellowship group* that she attends faithfully every week, where she finds encouragement and inspiration to see life as a blessing. It is also through them that she was encouraged to request a loan to improve her store. Hence, Vivian knocks at your generous hearts to lend her 20,000 PHP that she will use to acquire greater quantities of groceries, soft drinks, and sacks of rice to resell. You may help her in your kind little way.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to acquire greater quantities of groceries, soft drinks, and sacks of rice to resell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a young 21-year-old mother. She is married, and her children are aged 2 and 3. With the help of her husband, they have established a sand and gravel business together. They started this business 3 years ago.

Mercy is asking a loan to buy items that they can use for the business such as a shovel, sacks, screens, and boots. This will help make their work easier.

In the future, Mercy plans to build her own house for her family to live in comfort.

loans.use: to buy a shovel, sacks, screens, and boots.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 38-year-old married woman living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his rickshaw which always remains in a bad condition. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. For this reason, Kousar has contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can repair his rickshaw. He wants to maintain the engine’s piston, repair one wheel and wants to pay the labor costs for it. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers. 

Kousar is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. Kousar thanks Kiva and the field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband in repairing the engine’s piston, one wheel and for paying labor costs.

loans.name: Maria Lidora

texts.en:
Maria is 20 years old. She lives with her boyfriend and her boyfriend’s family. Eight people live in their small rental house. Maria had a kid two years ago. She just finished college and has been working ever since. Because she has always had an entrepreneurial spirit, she took over managing the school pub. In the small town where they live, the school pub is unique.

Maria has been in this business for one year and is doing well. She sells products like candies, ice cream, sandwiches, juices, and lunches. Her principal problem is economic because she doesn’t have enough money to invest in expanding the business. This loan will allow her to hire a cook because nowadays she has to transport her boyfriend’s family to the bar to cook each day. Her boyfriend works as a fisherman but his income is low. So, the money that Maria earns is the principal income for her household, including her boyfriend’s family. In the future, she would like to have a mini-market because she knows about the business and can get new customers in town.

loans.use: to hire another cook and offer more food products at the bar she manages.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is from Badian, Bohol. This place is known for its suppliers and makers of mats locally known as "banig".

Sofia a 35-year-old married mother of 3 children aged 6, 12, and 16. She is involved in buying and selling colorful mats in her town.

Sofia is requesting a loan to buy more mats that she can sell for a profit. Whatever income she will earn will supplement her husband's harvest from the farm. It will be used for her children's school fees and for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy more mats.

loans.name: Tazhihan

texts.ru: Тажихан, 57 лет, замужем, есть 5 детей. У Тажихан среднее образование, сейчас она на пенсии, также 30 лет назад она решила начать свой бизнес, которым и занимается до сих пор. Тажихан занимается сельским хозяйством, у нее есть 2 коровы. На 1,80 Га арендованной и 0,54 Га собственной земли выращивает органические помидоры, арбузы, дыни и хлопок для реализации. Все накопленные средства Тажихан старается вкладывать в развитие бизнеса,однако нужно улучшать и жилищные условия семьи. Поэтому, Тажихан и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов для проведения в доме ремонтных работ. Тажихан планирует и дальше расширять ее бизнес и улучшать условия проживания семьи.
texts.en:
Tazhihan is 57 and married with five children. She has a high school education and is now retired. She also decided 30 years ago to start her own business, which she maintains to this day. She works in farming and has two cows as well as 1.8 hectares of rented and 0.54 hectares of her own land where she grows organic tomatoes, watermelon, melon and cotton for sale. 

Tazhihan tries to put all her savings back into her business; however, she needs to improve her family's living conditions. Therefore, she has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 KGS to purchase building materials to do home renovation work. She plans to further expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials in order to repair her house

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 35-year-old single woman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She buys and sells cocoa to the people around her town and has been in business for four years. She is a hardworking woman looking forward to expanding her business so that she will be able to sell in big quantities. However, she always complains of competition and price fluctuations to meet all her personal and business expectations. Joyce is requesting a loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.en:
Rosa is 21 years old, and a year ago she got into the university. She’s studying engineering in animal husbandry. The small town in which she lives is three hours away from the city. She travels each week to study in the provincial capital, but her parents don’t have enough money to help her economically, so she needs more money to pay for her maintenance. Thus, she’s decided to raise chickens and it will give her a reliable income. Rosa lives with her parents and her sister, and recently she had a kid.

Since childhood, Rosa has stood out in school and college. She hopes to become an engineer and help support her whole family. She has some experience raising chickens, and with her technical knowledge she hopes to go ahead with her entrepreneurship. Rosa is requesting a loan to buy chickens and chicken feed. She has the right infrastructure in her house, and her sister will help with that, too. Rosa feels optimistic and knows that by working hard she can get whatever she wants. Her dream for the future is to continue with her new business and open a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Luz Nelly

texts.es:
Luz es una emprendedora y dinámica mujer de 60 años de edad, comerciante independiente; ya que desde hace 5 años comenzó a vender mercancía a sus familiares, amigos y compañeros, con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues invertirá el dinero en la compra de surtido al por mayor como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, espumas, entre otros, brindando mayor variedad y un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que hará más rentable su negocio.
Trabaja sola todos los días durante 9 horas.

Luz tiene el firme propósito de sacar adelante su proyecto productivo, pues quiere convertirse en una empresaria exitosa y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para su grupo familiar y sabe que con los prestamistas de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar puede lograr todo eso y más.
texts.en:
Luz is an entrepreneurial, independent and dynamic 60-year-old woman and merchant. Five years ago, she started to sell merchandise to relatives, friends and colleagues in order to earn an income to contribute to her household expenses. 

The loan that she is requesting is to strengthen her business as she will invest the money by purchasing a wholesale assortment of perfumes, creams, deodorants, foams, etc. to provide a wider variety and better service to her customers, which will also benefit her business. She works independently every day of the week for nine hours. 

Luz has a firm goal of moving her business forward, as she wants it to become a successful business and wants to ensure a better quality of life and welfare for her family – and knows that with the Kiva lenders and Interactuar she can achieve all of this and more.

loans.use: to buy a wholesale assortment of perfumes, creams, deodorants, foams, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Obreras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES OBRERAS” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rafaela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de ropa, tienda de carnicería, venta de comida, venta de mantas de vicuña, venta de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rafaela es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su amiga y decidió emprender su propio negocio hace cuatro años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la frontera Bolivia – Perú y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
C.F. PANAMERICANA
texts.en:
The credit group "Mujeres Obreras" [engl. "Working Women] is starting its fifth loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Focus Group Villa Exaltacion. This group consists of eight members and is lead by a board, of which Rafaela is the president.

The businesses, which improve the members' financial situations, are various. Among others: vegetable sales, clothe sales, a butcher's shop, food sales, sales of blankets made of vicuña wool, jacket sales.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs, where Rafaela is a member. She says that she has been a member in Pro Mujer for four years. She joined by the invitation of a friend, who is a customer of the institution. At the moment she owns a business of selling clothes. She says, she has learned this trade from her friend and decided to open her own business four years ago.

The loan she is requesting now is for increasing the capital (to buy clothes at wholesale) which she will acquire from the whole-sellers at the border of Bolivia and Peru. Afterwards she sells them in her stall.

This kind of work allows her to generate an income to support her family financially, because she is a single mother.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the field of health and the training the institution offers.

C.F. PANAMERICANA

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en: Jacinto is a 65-year-old widower from Badian, Cebu. He owns a business selling school supplies and photocopying services to students. At the moment his biggest challenge is paying for the repair of one of his two photocopying machines. He is requesting a loan to pay for the repair and also buy pens, notebooks and paper to sell. In the future, he hopes to continue making his business successful. His income will pay for household expenses and expand his business.

loans.use: to pay for to repair a photocopying machine and buy school supplies.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en: Lita is 49 years old, married and the mother of three children, one of whom is still in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. Lita has been in this business for ten years and has taken out and repaid four prior loans from NWTF.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, de 55 años de edad, es agricultor, solo estudio hasta primaria, está casado y tiene un hijo con su esposa, el cual viajo para el extranjero y su esposa ayuda mucho en las labores que realiza el.

Carlos, antes trabajaba como albañil hasta la edad de 25 años, luego se mudó a vivir en la zona rural, porque su esposa es originaria del lugar donde actualmente viven, desde entonces junto a su esposa se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado que también es una de sus fuentes económicas.

Carlos, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas y para comprar concentrado para su ganado y algunas vacunas para prevenir enfermedades en ellos.

Su sueño es mejorar sus cosechas y también que sus ganados tengan buena salud.
texts.en:
Carlos is 55 years old, a farmer, and only went to primary school. He is married and he and his wife have a son, who traveled abroad. His wife is helping him a lot with the work he does.

Carlos used to work as a bricklayer until he was 25 years old, then he moved to a rural area because his wife originates from the place where they are living now. Since then, he and his wife dedicated themselves to agriculture. He raises cattle, which is another source of income.

Carlos needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies and to buy concentrate for his cattle and some vaccines to prevent diseases in them.

His goal is to improve his harvest and also for his cattle to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to buy concentrate for his cattle and some vaccines to prevent diseases in them.

loans.name: Los Girasoles De Moron Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “LOS GIRASOLES DE MORON” conformada por 05 socios. Este es el caso de Jorge de 59 años de edad soltero. Él se dedica al trabajo de albañilería. Su mayor deseo es de poder terminar de construir su casita es por ello que Solicito el crédito para la compra de cemento y ladrillos. El grupo “los girasoles de morón” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Jorge es el primero del lado izquierdo viste camisa color celeste.
texts.en:
This is the new "Sunflowers of Morón" group, which consists of five members. Jorge is an unmarried 59 year-old who does masonry work. His greatest wish is to finish building his house, which is why he is requesting the loan in order to purchase cement and bricks.

The "Sunflowers of Morón" group is grateful to the people who made this Kiva loan possible, allowing him to continue improving. Jorge is the first on the left wearing a light blue shirt.

loans.use: to purchase cement and bricks.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
El  señor José de 60 años de edad es casado vive con su esposa al sur de Honduras, donde cuenta con una pulpería que vende de todo lo relacionado con la canasta básica como ser: refresco, manteca, azúcar, papel higiénico, carne y embutidos etc., se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 14 años, es conocido por ser una persona muy luchadora y con el deseo de seguir adelante. 

El señor está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de abarrotería como ser: pan, huevos, manteca, azúcar refrescos, etc. Esta muy contento de el apoyo que Prisma le puede brindar.

Su sueño es que su negocio crezca para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Octubre 2015
texts.en:
José is 60 years old, married and lives with his wife in the south of Honduras where he has a grocery store that sells basic goods such as drinks, butter, sugar, toilet paper, meats and sausages. He has made a living with this business for 14 years and is known as a very hardworking person with a desire to move forward. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase grocery supplies such as bread, eggs, butter, sugar, drinks, etc. He is very pleased with the support that Prisma has been able to provide. His dream is to have his business grow and to be able to improve his quality of life. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  October 2015

loans.use: to buy grocery supplies such as bread, eggs, butter, sugar, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is from Badian, Cebu, which is about two hours away from Cebu City. Business is thriving here because the community is so close to the city. Marilou earns a living by raising hogs and selling RTW (Ready-to-Wear) clothing. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more clothes to sell and more feed for hogs. She will use her profit to provide a better life to her six school-aged children. Marilou dreams of expanding her business so she can continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and clothes.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly is 28 years old, married and lives in Badian, Cebu with her husband and two children. She helps her husband meet the family's expenses by raising hogs, and is requesting a loan to buy more piglets and feed for them to eat. This loan will allow her to save money by buying sacks of feed instead of individual kilos. Merly plans to make her piggery bigger someday so she can house more hogs. Her income will pay for her children's food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed for them to eat.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is 23 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur who earns a living by buying and selling frozen food in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell. Wilma has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Amadeo

texts.es:
Amadeo, de 64 años de edad, es agricultor, estudió hasta primer grado, no siguió sus estudios por la pobreza en que creció, está casado, tiene 4 hijos junto a su esposa y todos ya están casados.

Amadeo, se dedica a la agricultura desde que estaba muy joven, sus padres le enseñaron este trabajo con el fin de que tuviera una fuente de ingreso para su bienestar; ahora especificamente siembra maíz.

Amadeo, necesita el préstamo para comprar una yunta de novillos de repasto para venderlos cuando estén grandes y gordos.

Amadeo, sueña con tener una casa digna.
texts.en:
Amadeo, a farmer, is 64 years old and is married with four children, all of whom are now married. He studied up to the first grade but was unable to continue due to the poverty in which he grew up.

Ever since he was very young, Amadeo has been involved in agriculture. His parents taught him this trade so that he would have a source of income, and he is growing corn at the present time.

Amadeo needs the loan so he can buy a pair of young grazing steer to sell them when they become large and fat.

He dreams of having a decent house.

loans.use: to buy a pair of  young grazing steer to sell when they have become big and fat.

loans.name: Ratna

texts.en:
While travelling on the scenic roads of Koraput, when travellers stop at Ratna’s tea stall, they are pleasantly surprised by the smell of home-cooked chapatti-sabji and pakoras wafting from the kitchen. Ratna is a 35-year-old widow from a village of Koraput district.

While she has been running this stall for the last seven years, lately she has been facing stiff competition from other stalls that have cropped up in the area. One day, it struck her that to attract customers to her stall, she would have to do something different. She started making pakoras and chapatti-sabji and sold them at her stall. That quickly became the USP (unique selling proposition) of her small tea stall. But, to expand her business further and increase profits, it is necessary that she buy the raw ingredients at a wholesale rate.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use the loan amount to this purpose to cater to a larger clientele. The higher profits earned will add to the family income, and she will have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients at a wholesale rate.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.en:
Maria is 63 years old and she’s married. She lives in a small community far away from the city, where the principal source of income is fishing. She has a daughter who is still in high school, and her husband is a cabinetmaker. They live in a rented house with no basic utilities except electricity, and the bathroom is outside the house.

Maria is a little worried because her daughter will finish school in almost two years. Her biggest dream is to see her daughter go to the university and get a degree. She knows that she has to start saving money to pay her daughter’s expenses because she will live in the city near the university. However, her husband's income is barely enough to pay for their rent and food each month.

Maria has experience raising chickens but she doesn’t have enough money to invest in her business. From her last sale, she only recovered the capital. With this loan she will purchase chickens, chicken feed, and vitamins and pay for electricity. She considers herself an entrepreneurial person who will combine her income with her husband's earnings in order to help the family to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, chicken feed, and vitamins and pay for electricity.

loans.name: Arline

texts.en:
Arline works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Arline has requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been in this business for 4 years now, and Arline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is a 31-year-old widowed lady from a small village of Koraput district, Odisha, India. She is a blessed mother of two sons and two daughters who live with her in her parental house after her husband's death.

Dali got major support from her father and brother after she lost her husband to undertake the business in order to earn her living and support her family financially. Dali runs a grocery store in her area and has a good reputation in the community, due to her quality service.

Dali, in order to diversify her product line, is requesting a loan amount of 25,000 INR to purchase more items at wholesale to stock up in her store in order to meet the rising demand of her customers with her supply.

She has a plan to convert her grocery shop to a big wholesale shop and have a pretty good amount of earnings so that she will be able to provide her children the best education and see them become successful.

loans.use: to purchase more items at wholesale to stock up in her store in order to meet the rising demand of her customers with her supply.

loans.name: Narendra Kumar

texts.en:
Narendra Kumar is a 33-year-old married and differently abled person. He is a blessed father of a small toddler.

Narendra Kumar is a farmer. His wife assists him in the fields. He is passionate about farming. From his childhood, he had been observing his father toil away in the fields, understanding the soil conditions and checking for pests, and has seen his father feel a sense of joy when the final produce is harvested.

Narendra Kumar took up farming eight years ago, to feel this very sense of fulfillment and joy. He keeps himself updated about the various farming techniques and innovations in quality of seeds, fertilizers and pesticides, and tries to use the knowledge while cultivating the vegetables.

But, due to unexpected conditions, productivity is not as expected at times, and he falls short of funds. Therefore, Narendra Kumar is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum in order to purchase a high-yielding variety of seeds, organic fertilizers, and other farm equipment in order to get higher productivity and raise his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a high-yielding variety of seeds, organic fertilizers, and other farm equipment.

loans.name: Rosa Iris

texts.es:
Rosa Iris tiene 51 años de edad, está casada, tiene dos hijos mayores de edad, de los cuales solo uno depende de ellos. Doña Rosa recuerda que desde los 15 años le ha gustado mucho la cocina, no pudo terminar sus estudios ya que necesitaba generar ingresos para ayudar en los gastos a su mamá, empezó ayudándole a un chef Italiano, logró aprender todo tipo de pastas y a realizar pizzas, lo cual actualmente es su fuerte. Continuó trabajando en diferentes sodas y restaurantes, cuando decidió casarse y formar su familia, monto su propia soda, luego paso a ser un restaurante reconocido de la zona, muy famoso por las pizzas y las pastas que realizaban. Pero con el pasar de los años aumentaron el alquiler del local y tuvo que trasladarse a otro local. Hace unas semanas consiguió un local, justo al frente de donde estaba su antigua y famosa pizzería. Este es mucho más barato y está en un mejor punto para continuar con sus clientes anteriores y nuevos clientes. 
Necesita este crédito para poder comprar un juego de comedor, congelador de 8 pies, plancha de gas y un freidor de dos canastas. Con el objetivo de brindar un servicio ágil. 
Este restaurante de doña Iris le brinda empleo a dos madres jefas de hogar, las cuales trabajan con ella desde hace 5 años. 
El mayor anhelo y objetivo de este restaurante es poder brindar empleo a más jóvenes de la zona, para que puedan asumir los gastos existentes en sus hogares.
texts.en:
Rosa Iris is 51 years old, married, and has two grown children, only one of whom is dependent on her.

Rosa remembers that since she was 15 years old she loved cooking. She was not able to finish school and had to generate some income to help her mother with household expenses. She started working as an assistant to an Italian chef and learned about all kinds of pastas and how to make pizza, which is now her specialty.

She continued to work at different shops and restaurants when she decided to get married and start her own family. She then opened her own soda shop which later became a well-known restaurant in the area, famous for its pizzas and pastas. But as time went by the rent kept increasing and she had to move to another location. She found a new spot just a few weeks ago, right across the street from where her previous and famous pizzeria was. It is much less expensive and is at a better place to continue with her previous customers and to acquire new ones.

She needs this loan so she can buy dining room furniture, an 8 cubic foot freezer, a gas grill, and a fryer with two baskets so she can provide smooth service to her customers. Iris's restaurant provides employment to two mothers who are heads of household and have been working with her for five years.

The greatest challenge and goal of this restaurant is to provide employment to more young people from the area so they can take on some responsibility for the expenses in their households.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her restaurant.

loans.name: Urkupiña Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “URKUPIÑA” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Pamela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de condimentos, venta de muebles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Pamela es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hermana que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de prendas de vestir; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella aún es soltera.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Urkupiña" communal bank begins its ninth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Pan American Regional Office. It is composed of eight members and is headed by a board in which Pamela is the President. Businesses in which members of the communal bank are engaged are varied and include selling food, clothes, condiments and furniture.

The loan they're taking out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs such as Pamela, who notes that she became a member of Pro Mujer three years ago upon the invitation of her sister, who is a client of the institution. Today she has a business selling fabric and clothing. She says that she learned this business several years ago on her own initiative.

The loan will be for increasing her capital (purchasing wool wholesale), which she will acquire from the wholesale sellers in the city of El Alto. Then, after making it into products, she will market them in fairs in El Alto. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is still single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health center offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase wool wholesale.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 48-year-old married woman with four children. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines.

Jocelyn has requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs. She has been in the pig fattening business for 5 years, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Constance

texts.fr: Divorcée et âgée de 45 ans, Constance est une femme qui vit à Adidogomé. Sans enfant à sa charge, Constance est une revendeuse des objets en plastique et des casseroles. Constance s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Constance sollicite ce prêt pour commander des séries bassines et de casseroles en vue de mieux revendre puis de pouvoir  satisfaire parfaitement les attentes de ses clients et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour subvenir à ses charges et besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Constance is a forty-five year-old divorcee living in Adidogomé. She has no children to provide for.

Constance retails plastic objects and cooking pots. She procures her merchandise four times a month at the market and resells it from a shed in front of her house.

Constance requests this loan to order sets of buckets and pots. Her goal is to improve her sales and to be able to perfectly meet her clients needs. She wants to generate a good profit margin so that she can pay for her expenses and daily needs.

loans.use: to buy five set of pots.

loans.name: Kanchan's Group

texts.en:
Kanchan, standing to the right hand side in the photograph, is a 31-year-old vigorous lady who resides in a village of Koraput district, Odisha, India. Her family comprises her husband and two children (one son and one daughter). Both of her children attend school and read in class 8 and class 9. Kanchan has an elementary education. Her husband is a farmer. To supplement her income, Kanchan has been stitching clothes for many years.

She mainly stitches pants, t-shirts, blouses, petticoats etc. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers.

For this reason, she, along with her group member, has sought a loan of 24,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She intends to use this loan amount to buy a new sewing machine and necessary sewing materials so that she can fulfill the increasing customer demand and also create a means of increasing revenues to generate a healthier source of income.

She is thankful to her lenders for their tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and necessary sewing materials so that she can fulfill the increasing customer demand.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase ingredients, such as noodles, meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc., for her business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 5 years, and she also earns additional income from her general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. Rosemarie dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as noodles, meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business

loans.name: Cherrylyn

texts.en:
Cherrylyn is a 42-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cherrylyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a larger variety of fish to sell to her customers.She has been in this business for 5 years.

Cherrylyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dona

texts.en:
Dona is a 25-year-old married woman with one child, who is currently in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Dona runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items, such as canned goods, candies, soft-drinks, beer, detergent soap, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Dona has been in this business for 7 years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, candies, soft-drinks, beer, detergent soap, biscuits, etc.

Dona would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items, such as canned goods, candies, soft-drinks, beer, detergent soap, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Cactulo Enrique

texts.es:
Cactulo es un hombre muy honrado y trabajador, tiene cincuenta y dos años de edad, es vendedor ambulante de leche agria por las mañanas y por las tardes vende gaseosa, frituras, golosinas, entre otras cosas. Él es un cliente recurrente para MiCrédito y Kiva, gracias a los múltiples prestamos que se le han entregado, ha podido salir adelante y crecer como comerciante. 
Ahora él ha vuelto a recurrir a Kiva junto a MiCrédito, pero esta vez no ocupara el financiamiento para su negocio, sino que con este instalara en su casa de habitación un servicio higiénico, debidamente conectado a las tuberías de su ciudad, lo que incrementara notablemente su calidad de vida, además que no seguirá contaminando el suelo. El planea seguir trabajando con ambas organizaciones para poco a poco ir mejorando su casa y su negocio.
texts.en:
Cactulo is an honest and hardworking man. He is 52. He sells yogurt door to door in the mornings and in the afternoons he sells soda, fried foods, snacks and other things. He is a repeat customer at MiCredito and Kiva, and thanks to the multiple loans they have given him, he has been able to get ahead and grow as a salesman. 

Now, he has turned to Kiva and MiCredito again, however this time the loan isn't for his business, but to install a bathroom in his home. It will be connected to the city sewage system, which will significantly improve his quality of life, and he won't continue to contaminate the soil. He plans to continue working with both organizations to improve his home and business little by little.

loans.use: to install a bathroom in his home.

loans.name: Noel De Jesus

texts.es:
Noel, de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, pero dejo de estudiar por dedicarse a trabajar y a ayudar a su padre en los trabajos agrícolas, está acompañado y su pareja han procreado dos hijos que están estudiando.
 
Noel, es una persona muy trabajadora, se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas y a la venta de medicina y vitaminas en su comunidad; la venta de medicinas las realiza desde hace 15 años y la agricultura la aprendió gracias a su padre.

Noel, necesita el préstamo para comprar medicina y vitaminas para seguir vendiendo y llevar el sustento diario para su familia y seguir mandando a sus hijos a la escuela.

Noel, sueña con seguir trabajando en el negocio de medicina y contratar a dos personas más para que vendan medicina y mejoren sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Noel is 54 years old he completed high school but he stopped studying in order to work and help his father with his agricultural activities. He is married and he has two children who go to school.

Noel is a very hard-working person: he engages in agriculture and he sells medicines and vitamins in his community. He has been selling medicines for 15 years and he learned how to work in the agricultural field thanks to his father.

Noel needs a loan to buy medicines and vitamins to keep on selling them and to provide his family with their daily necessities; he also wants to keep sending his children to school.

Noel dreams to keep working in his medicines selling activity and to employ to more people to help him sell medicines thus increasing his income.

loans.use: buy medicines and vitamins to sell.

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en:
Arshad is a 32-year-old ambitious school owner who started a community school in the year 2012. His aim is to contribute to the literacy rate of his community and make education available to more students than those who are currently enrolled in schools.

Once his school was open, it drew attention in the eyes of many community members and the enrollment increased rapidly. Today there are 538 students in his school, more than 40% of whom are females. Due to the recent increase in enrollment level, his school now lacks the capacity to hold such a large number of students. Trying to accommodate the large number of students, Arshad has requested a loan of 150,000 PKR to build new classrooms. Arshad says, "This will not only help me increase space in the school but will also allow me to enroll additional students in the future."

loans.use: to build new classrooms to accommodate the large number of students.

loans.name: Santa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Santa, de 42 años de edad, es viuda, tiene dos hijas de 18 y 15 años de edad y las dos viven con ella y están estudiando.

Santa, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y a los oficios domésticos y a la crianza de cerdos y ganado; hace varios años se dedicó a trabajar como empleada doméstica y viajó a la ciudad donde trabajo 4 años y fue ahí donde conoció al padre de sus hijas, pero lastimosamente hace seis años falleció y ella tuvo que luchar para que sus hijas estudiaran y tuvieran todo lo necesario. 

Santa, necesita el préstamo para comprar tres terneras para seguir trabajando porque hace tres años sufrió una enfermedad y tuvo que vender sus animales para pagar el tratamiento y ella desea empezar nuevamente con su pequeña ganadería, para mejorar sus ingresos para darles a sus hijas el estudio y una buena alimentación y darle seguimiento a su negocio. 

Santa, sueña con construir una vivienda digna para su familia, porque actualmente vive en casa de láminas.
texts.en:
Santa, 42 years old, is a widow and has two daughters – 18 and 15 years old. The two live with her and are studying in school. 

Santa makes a living farming, doing household jobs and raising pigs and cattle. Several years ago, she worked as a maid and traveled to the city where she worked for four years and there she met the father of her children. Unfortunately, he passed away six years ago, and she has had to fight for her daughters so that they study and have everything they need.  

She needs a loan to purchase three calves in order continue working. Three years ago, she became ill and had to sell her animals to pay for treatment. She hopes to begin raising cattle again to improve her income in order ensure her daughters study and have good nutrition – and to continue her business. 

Santa dreams of building a dignified home for her family because they currently live in a house made of sheet metal.

loans.use: to buy three calves.

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr: Mariée, Angèle est une femme âgée de 41 ans habitant à Adidogomè. Angèle est une revendeuse des pagnes qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois  au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Pour ce fait, Angèle sollicite ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagne en vue de bien revendre et de gagner une marge bénéficiaire qui servira à venir en aide à son mari pour soutenir les charges quotidiennes de la famille et donné une meilleur éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Angèle is a forty-one year-old married woman living in Adidogomè.

Angèle retails "pagne," a local fabric, that she procures twice monthly at the market. She retails itinerantly in neighboring areas.

Angèle requests this loan for this business. She will use it to order pieces of pagne fabric with the goal of selling well and earning a profit, which will be used to help her husband with the family's daily expenses, and to give a better education to her children.

loans.use: to buy nine pieces of "pagne" (local dress fabric).

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 55-year-old farmer from Alexeeva village in the Ungheni region. Her husband Ion works as a driver at railroads. They have three children and three nice grandchildren. Sofia and Ion are very hardworking people. They have been tilling 4 hectares of agricultural land for 13 years including 1 hectare with a plum orchard. On the rest of the agricultural land she grows cereals. Sofia also raises two pigs, two cows, some rabbits and poultry. The sale of agricultural goods significantly increases her family's income.

Growing plums is a good business and Sofia decided to plant more plum trees. Sofia will use this loan to expand the orchard and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase plum trees

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María es una mujer muy tranquila e inteligente, tiene treinta y nueve años de edad, es madre de tres niños, su esposo es el primero en alentarle para que siga andando en el camino del comercio. Posee un negocio donde oferta ropa interior, camisetas, calcetines, licras, blusas, vestidos, entre otros productos, gracias a préstamos anteriores de MiCrédito y Kiva ella ha logrado ir expandiéndose cada vez más y por ende creciendose como comercianta. 
Esta temporada es clave para el negocio de María, por eso ella ha tomado una buena decisión que es solicitar un financiamiento de Kiva junto a MiCrédito para comprar mercadería nueva en ropa interior, brasieres, calcetines, camisetas y blusas. En un futuro planea mejorar la infraestructura de su local, ahorrar sus ganancias para construir su casa y lograr que sus hijos vayan a la universidad.
texts.en:
Maria is a very calm and intelligent woman. She is 39 years old and is the mother of three children. Her husband is the first to encourage her to continue along her business path. She has a business where she sells underwear, shirts, socks, lycra, blouses, dresses and other products. Thanks to previous loans from MiCrédito and Kiva she has been able to expand her business more and more and to grow as a businesswoman.

This season is key for Maria's business so she has made a good decision to ask for this loan from Kiva, along with MiCrédito, in order to purchase new merchandise such as underwear, bras, socks, shirts and blouses. In the future she plans to improve her business' infrastructure, save her earnings to build a house, and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise such as underwear, bras, socks, shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en: Sobia is 40 years old and runs a school aimed at improving learning outcomes. There are 193 students in her school, of whom 46% are females. When she decided to open a school, she met with a number of challenges, including her lack of her ability to hire qualified teachers. Recently she requested a loan of  80,000 PKR to renovate her school. Her school building is old and needs a substantial amount of repair and maintenance. Aiming to provide education to a larger number of students, Sobia plans to scale up her school by adding additional classrooms in the future. She also plans to invite teachers from renowned public schools as guest speakers so students can benefit from their experience.
