"I cannot afford to hire expensive instructors but I can definitely invite them to my school as a guest," says Sobia.

loans.use: to renovate her school.

loans.name: Leli

texts.es:
Leli, de 41 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora, respetable y honesta, es muy reconocida por los miembros de su comunidad, no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela y se dedica a la crianza de cerdos junto a su hija, mientras su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.  

Leli, desde muy joven se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, actualmente tiene tres cerdos engordando para venderlos cuando estén más gordos, pero además vende empanadas de plátano, tostadas y yuca frita, para generar ingresos y apoyar a su esposo en los ingresos del hogar y tener una mejor estabilidad económica para su familia.
 
Leli, necesita el préstamo para comprar cuatro cerdos pequeños y para comprar plátanos y yuca para el negocio.

Leli, sueña con construir su propia vivienda porque donde vive alquila y quiere ampliar más las galeras para comprar más cerdos.
texts.en:
Leli, 41 years old, is a hardworking, respectable and honest person. She is very well known by the members of her community. She didn't have the opportunity to go to school and she makes a living raising pigs with her daughter, while her husband makes a living in farming. Since Leli was very young she has made a living raising pigs. She currently has 3 pigs being fattened to be sold when they are fatter, but she also sells banana empanadas, tostadas and fried yuca (traditional snacks) to increase income and help her husband by paying some household expenses and to provide her family with more economic stability. 

Leli needs a loan to buy 4 small pigs and to buy bananas and yuca for her business. Leli dreams of building her own home because where she lives she is renting and she wants to increase the size of the lots in order to buy more pigs.

loans.use: to buy 4 small pigs and to buy bananas and yuca for her business.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en: Four years ago Shaheen started a small school, offering primary education to a handful of students. Her aim was to start something that will generate money for her children’s education as well as contribute to the society. She is 44 years old and manages a school of 137 students, 65% of whom are female. She has requested a loan of 100,000 PKR, which will be used to purchase furniture, computers and a water cooler. Shaheen feels happy to be contributing to the development of her community. "Parents in our community want to send their children to school, but unfortunately many cannot afford quality education," says Shaheen, whose objective is to change this and made education affordable and accessible.

loans.use: to purchase furniture, computers and a water cooler.

loans.name: Nicodemus

texts.en:
Nicodemus is a maize farmer from Bazai village. As a Babban Gona member, Nicodemus is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Nicodemus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Nicodemus can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Nicodemus no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Nicodemus hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nika

texts.fr: Nika est une femme mariée âgée de 38 ans habitant à Adidogomé avec ses deux enfants à charge. Nika est une revendeuse de la peau de bœuf « Akpama » qui achète ses marchandises trois fois par mois au marché et le revend là. Nika demande ce prêt pour commander le sac de peau de bœuf afin de pouvoir mieux revendre puis de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière élevée pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Nika is a thirty-eight year-old married woman. She lives in Adidogomé with her two dependent children.

Nika retails cow hide, known as "Akpama." She purchases her merchandise three times a month at the market, where she also retails.

Nika is requesting this loan to order a bag of cow hide. Her goal is to sell better and to meet her customers' needs. She wants to be highly financially independent to help her children get a school education.

loans.use: to buy one bag of cow hide.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme mariée âgée de 45 ans résidante à Adidogomè. Mère de quatre enfants, Yawa est une revendeuse de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à domicile. Yawa désire ce prêt pour commander des cartons de spaghettis et des bidons d’huile. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne vente, Yawa compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Yawa is a forty-five year-old married woman living in Adidogomè. She is a mother of four.

Yawa retails groceries that she procures four times a month at the market. She resells from a stall by her house.

Yawa wants this loan to order boxes of spaghetti and cans of oil. With the profit that will result from good sales, Yawa plans to improve her seller's services, help her family enjoy good life conditions, and insure a good school education to her children.

loans.use: to buy ten boxes of spaghetti and three cans of oils.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is a 40-year-old trader from Ungheni. She sells clothing and shoes for children in an open-air market. Inga doesn’t have a boutique, only a small table, but she manages to get minimum income. Inga has been working for 12 years as a saleswoman and has a lot of loyal customers. Her husband, Ion, works for a sausage factory in another region of Moldova, Anenii Noi. Their daughter, Ecaterina, studies Economics in Romania and she works also.

Winter is coming soon but Inga doesn't have the necessary goods for sale. Inga will use this loan to purchase winter clothing and shoes for sale. This loan will increase her income and level of life of her family.

loans.use: to purchase goods for sale

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida works hard to support her family. Aida is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Aida requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like sticky rice, sugar, coconut, etc. for her food production business.

Aida has been in this business for 20 years now.

Aida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sticky rice, sugar, coconut, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Joyce Mae

texts.en:
Joyce Mae is 22 years old and married with one child. Joyce Mae works very hard to provide for them.

Joyce Mae runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Joyce Mae has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as noodles, coffee, sugar, biscuits, canned goods, detergent soap, etc.

Joyce Mae would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. Gina is married and has a business direct selling personal collection products in the Philippines.

Gina requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more personal collection products to sell to her customers.

Gina has been in this business for 15 years now.

Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more personal collection products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lenaida

texts.en:
Lenaida is 49 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lenaida has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. Lenaida requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lenaida has been in this business for six years. Lenaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Cantibura

texts.en:
Cantibura is 59 years old and widowed with two children. With two children currently in school, Cantibura works very hard to provide for them.

Cantibura runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Cantibura has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, sanitary pads, noodles, soft drinks, shampoo, fabric conditioner, milk, juice, etc.

In the future, Cantibura would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Crislyn

texts.en:
Crislyn works hard to support her family. Crislyn is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Crislyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Crislyn has been in this business for three years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Crislyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel is 34 years old and has a live-in partner with four children.

Razel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Razel has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Razel aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sheila Mae

texts.en:
Sheila Mae is 30 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Sheila Mae is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

Sheila Mae has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 51 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Evangeline has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Miguela works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Miguela is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like sticky rice, coconut, sugar, etc. for her food vending business.

Miguela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sticky rice, coconut, sugar, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Mylinda

texts.en:
Mylinda is 39 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Mylinda is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Mylinda has been raising livestock for 7 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 36 years old and has three children. Evelyn is married and has three children who are in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Evelyn has been in pig fattening for 8 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela works hard to support her family. Miguela is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Miguela requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Miguela has been in this business for 5 years now.

Miguela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jose Ivan

texts.es: José Ivan  tiene la edad de 26 años, está soltero y vive con los padres actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de almacigo y abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café que quieren iniciar. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jose Ivan is 26 years old, he is single, and he currently lives with his parents. He wants a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer and to assist with a coffee plantation that they want to start. He hopes to maintain the crop well in order to get better production and therefore have better income. 

He hopes that in the future he can give his family a better quality of life and better economic stability, and that he can continue growing as a person and a producer. This is the first loan he will receive from FUDECOSUR. He has never had any other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and supplies

loans.name: Claudia Alibet

texts.es:
Claudia, de 32 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la venta de pupusas, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañada y junto a su pareja ha procreado un hijo y su pareja trabaja de seguridad en un hospital.

Claudia, tiene 8 años de experiencia en la venta de pupusas, porque ella ayudaba a su madre a vender los días domingos cuando había partidos de fútbol, pero desde hace tres años tiene su propio negocio y de esa manera se gana la vida trabajando honradamente.

Claudia, necesita el préstamo para comprar harina y preparativos para seguir vendiendo pupusas y para comprar otra plancha para hacer pupusas.

Claudio, sueña con construir una galera más grande para su negocio y que su hijo estudie y tenga mayores oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Claudia is 32 years old and works doing housework and selling pupusas. She studied up to Grade 4. She is in a relationship and together with her spouse has a child. Her partner works as security in a hospital.

Claudia has 8 years experience selling pupusas as she helped her mother sell on Sundays when there were football games. Three years ago she started her own business and in this way she earns her living with honest work.

Claudia needs the loan to buy flour and supplies to continue to sell pupusas and buy another grill to cook pupusas.

Claudio dreams of building a bigger kitchen for her business and for her son to study and have better employment opportunities.

loans.use: to buy flour and supplies to continue to sell pupusas and buy another grill to cook pupusas.

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en:
Yohanna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yohanna has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yohanna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support,Yohanna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Yohanna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Yohanna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all of his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mucungwe I Group

texts.fr:
Bénoît fait partie du groupe  Mucungwe I et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 44 ans et est marié à Concilie ,une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de 7 mois à 17 ans,dont  4 étudient. 

Il est cordonnier   depuis  18 ans. 

Il est son à troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de semelle et une grande quantité de colle pour la fabrication et la réparation  de  souliers. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une parcelle et construire une maison en matériaux durables,et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Bénoît belongs to group Mucungwe I and lives in Bujumbura. He is forty-four years old and married to Concilie, a farmer. Together they have seven children between the ages of seven months and seventeen years. Four of the children are in school.

He has been a shoemaker for eighteen years.

This is his third loan with Turame. With the loan granted by Kiva, he will increase his capital and buy many soles as well as a large quantity of glue for the making and repair of shoes.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a plot of land and build a house in permanent materials. He would also like to see his children study.

loans.use: increase his capital and purchase many soles as well as much glue to make and repair many shoes.

loans.name: Laázarus

texts.en:
Laázarus is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Laázarus is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Laázarus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona Laázarus can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Laázarus has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Laázarus is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having had no money to pay for his children's school fees. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alhaji Magaji

texts.en:
Alhaji Magaji is maize farmer from Lili village. As a member of Babban Gona, Alhaji Magaji is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Magaji would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Magaji can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
Alhaji Magaji is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
La señora María de 41 años de edad es casada, tiene tres hijos vive en  Nacaome, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica hace 12 años  a la venta de golosinas y comidas, sus clientes son las personas que transitan por la zona, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de salir adelante.

La señora María está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de frescos, pollo, carnes, papas patastes repollo etc. que es la materia prima que usa para las golosinas, con el apoyo de este préstamo  pretende mejorar sus negocio y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida. Agradece a Prisma por la oportunidad que le puede brindar.

Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2015
texts.en:
María is 41 years old, she is married and she has three children. She lives in Nacaome, a valley in south Honduras. She lives in her own house and she has been engaging in selling sweets and meal for 12 years. Her customers are people travelling to her area. She is a hard-working woman strongly determined to progress in life.

María is requesting a loan to buy fruit drinks, chicken, meat, potatoes, chayote and cabbage, that is the basic ingredients she uses to prepare sweets. Thanks to this loan she wants to improve her activity as well as her standard of living. She is grateful to Prisma for the chance they are able to give her.

She dreams of improving her activity as well as her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015

loans.use: to buy fruit drinks, chicken, meat, potatoes, chayote, cabbage and other ingredients.

loans.name: Jihan

texts.en:
Jihan is a 35-year-old married woman from Dier El Balah city, located in the Gaza Strip. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all of the family's needs. She wants to improve her family's standard of living and help them live more comfortably.

Jihan took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Jihan will be able heat water more efficiently andenable the family to take warm showers, while also decreasing the electricity expenses.

Jihan appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Genara is 53 years old and has one child who in still in school.

Genara has a general store business in the Philippines. Genara requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Genara has been in this business for 10 years. Genara would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 34 years old and married with one child.

Belinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Belinda has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from a computer shop.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Belinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Umar

texts.en:
Umar is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Umar is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Umar would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Umar will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season, when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Umar now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Yudis Antonia

texts.es: Yudis es una ama de casa de 55 años que encontró la oportunidad de generar ingresos para ayudar a su cónyuge con los gastos en el hogar a través de una inversión que realizó al adquirir unos apartamentos para a futuro entregarlos en arriendo y cuyo canon le proporcionaría un ingreso seguro para el bienestar de su familia.  Ella es madre de tres hijos mayores de edad y reside en compañía de su cónyuge en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla.  En la actualidad desea realizar unas mejoras a las condiciones habitacionales de estos apartamentos para entregarlos en arriendo y para ello está  aplicando un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con los que comprará materiales de construcción, pinturas, cerámica para pisos y paredes, cielo raso y demás.  Con esta inversión sus apartamentos serán entregados a la mayor brevedad a sus inquilinos y su sueño de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia se harán realidad.
texts.en:
Yudis is a 55-year-old housewife who has found the opportunity to earn an income to help her spouse with the household expenses through an investment that she made in buying some apartments in order to rent them out in the future. The rent money she will receive will provide her a stable income for the wellbeing of her family. She is the mother of three adult children and lives with her spouse in a neighborhood in the municipality of Barranquilla.

She currently wants to make some improvements to the conditions of the rooms in these apartments that she will rent out and it is for this, that she is apply for a Kiva loan. This is the first loan she has taken with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan she will buy construction materials, paint, tiles for the floors and walls, ceiling and others. With this investment, she will be able to begin renting her apartments to her tenants as soon as possible and her dreams of improving the quality of life of her family will become a reality.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, paint, tiles for the floors and walls, ceiling and others.

loans.name: Angel Antonio

texts.es:
Angel, de 39 años de edad, es una persona honesta, trabajadora y responsable, se dedica a la agricultura desde muy pequeño, su padre le enseño a trabajar y ahora tiene 5 años de trabajar en sus propios cultivos y actualmente tiene 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijol, mientras su esposa se encarga de los oficios domésticos. 

Angel, cultiva sus propios granos básicos, pero además aprendió el oficio de la albañilería con lo cual tiene ingresos extras para sacar adelante a su familia.

El dinero del préstamo lo necesita para comprar dos sacos de abono foliares para controlar las plagas y obtener un mayor rendimiento en sus cosechas.

Angel, sueña con sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz más el próximo año, para mejorar sus ganancias y además darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Angel is 39 years old. He is an honest, hard-working and responsible person work who has worked in agriculture since he was small. His father taught him to work and he has worked his own crops for five years. He currently has 7,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 square meters of beans, while his wife takes care of the domestic duties.

Angel cultivates his basic grains but he also learned the bricklaying trade where he gets additional income to get his family ahead.

The money from the loan is needed to buy two bags of foliar spray to prevent infestations and obtain higher yield from his crops.

Angel dreams of planting 14,000 square meters of corn next year, to improve his profits and to provide education for his children.

loans.use: to buy two bags of foliar spray to prevent infestations and obtain higher yield from his crops.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Mika now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Laazarus

texts.en:
Laazarus is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Laazarus has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Laazarus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Laazarus can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Laazarus will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Laazarus is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a maize farmer from Doya village. As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ayuba no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Ayuba hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to purchase a motorbike and do business with it.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ma. Patricia

texts.en:
Ma. Patricia is 31 years old and has two children. Ma. Patricia is married and has two children who are in school.

Ma. Patricia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Patricia requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Patricia has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Patricia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 40 years old and has four children. Cristina is married and has four children who are in school.

Cristina is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Cristina has been raising livestock for 11 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial, de 60 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable, toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, porque no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a una escuela, luego se casó y junto a su esposa procrearon dos hijos, los cuales con mucho esfuerzo han sacado adelante; pero hace poco tiempo se separó de su esposa por problemas familiares y él quedo con la responsabilidad de sus dos hijos. 

Marcial, toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre, pero también aprendió el oficio de la albañilería y de estos trabajos obtiene ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades.   

Marcial, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizante y comprar cuatro quintales de abono para darle la nutrición a su cultivo y de esa forma obtener una buena cosecha.

Marcial, sueña con ver a sus hijos preparados académicamente y que cambien su situación económica.
texts.en:
Marcial is 60 years old. He is a hardworking person and very responsible. He has worked in agriculture his whole life because he didn't have a chance to go to school. Later, he married and had two children with his wife, whom they have gotten ahead with a lot of hard work. Some time ago, he separated from his wife due to family problems and he had the responsibility of raising their two children.

Marcial has worked his whole life in agriculture, which he learned from his father. He also learned the trade of bricklaying, and from these two jobs he makes income to cover his needs.

Marcial needs the loan to buy fertilizer and four quintals of compost to feed his crop and obtain a good harvest. He dreams of seeing his children get an education and change their financial situation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and four quintals of compost to feed his crop and obtain a good harvest.

loans.name: Nancy Tatiana

texts.es:
Nancy es una joven de veinte y tres años de edad, muy emprendedora y madre soltera de una pequeña niña. Ella se dedica a vender ropa, joyas de acero y otros accesorios como pulseras carteras y aretes. 
Casi está por empezar la temporada navideña y por lo tanto Nancy necesita estar lista para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, por eso ella ha solicitado un préstamo a Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le otorgue un financiamiento que le permita invertir en la compra de mercadería nueva y a la moda. En un futuro ella desea poder ser una comerciante independiente, también pretende comprar un automóvil en el cual pueda salir a ofertar sus productos.
texts.en:
Nancy is a young, entrepreneurial woman who is 23 years old. She is a single mother to a young girl. She works selling clothing, steel jewelry, and other accessories such as bracelets, purses and earrings.

She is about to start the Christmas season and because of this, Nancy needs to be ready in order to meet the demand of her clients. This is why she has applied for a loan from Kiva, together with MiCredito, so that they will provide her with the financing that will allow her to invest in the purchase of new and in season merchandise. In the future, she hopes to be able to be an independent saleswoman and also hopes to buy an automobile with which she could get out to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy new, in season merchandise.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 24-year-old single man from Qabatiya, located in Jinen City. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. However, he wants to improve his family's standard of living help them live more comfortably.

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a solar system and water tank for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able heat water more efficiently, enable the family to take warm showers, while also decreasing the electricity expenses.

Ahmad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system and water tank for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi, 24 years old from village Sartichala. He has wife, 5 year-old son and parents. The only employed person in the family is Giorgi's mother, who is a teacher and gets a fixed income. The family has also income from small agribusiness and from rent also. However they find it hard to generate the significant income in order to meet all family-expenses.

Giorgi decided to start his own business and seek for the credit among local financial institutions. His request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. Giorgi will purchase the needed apparatus and open a car wash service near his house.

It is obvious that the job is hard for Giorgi, but he is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop his business gradually. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased regards Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to purchase the needed apparatus and open a car wash service  .

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is maize farmer from Bazana II village. As a member of Babban Gona, Mathew is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mathew would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Mathew can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher prices than the market price at harvest.

Mathew is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 30 years old. He lives in the Gaza strip with his small family. A few months ago he started his business. He has a poultry farm; it’s a good business, but still needs a lot of improvement.

He applied for this loan to buy feed and chicks per customer requests, which will increase his income, helping him to improve the financial conditions for his family.

Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy some feed and chicks per customer requests,

loans.name: Laarazu

texts.en:

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana, who is 32 years old, lives in Kutaisi, West Georgia. She has a husband, who works at the factory and gets a fixed income. Nana wants to have her own income and trade at the local market.

Nana lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require a stable income and business experience. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Nana to get a loan of 5200 GEL and start a trading business. She will purchase a stock of jewelry and will trade at the local open market. Nana thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in great location and the only business of this kind in the area.

With the support of the Start Up program, Nana will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle her financial difficulties. She needs your support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry and trade at the local jewelry market.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a twenty-year-old single woman living in West Irbid. She is studying to take her ‎bachelor's degree in archaeology. She is trying her best to finish her degree and help her eight ‎family members. But recently she has been falling short in paying her fees.

Anwar decided to apply ‎for an educational loan to help her cover her semester fees. Anwar wants to work in the ‎same field.‎

loans.use: to help her cover her semester fees

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en:

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.
