Traditionally, Halima would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Halima will store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Halima now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Habila

texts.en:
Habila is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Habila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Habila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Habila can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Habila will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Habila is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Jairo Jackson

texts.en:
Jairo is a 26-year-old fisherman, who lives in a rich area that is mostly dedicated to fishing. Fishing is the principal income of the zone’s people. He finished high school a year ago but he has been dedicated to fishing since he was 15 years old. His journey starts at 5 am and finishes in the middle of the afternoon.

He still lives with his mother, brothers and nephews. The house where they live is small and it barely has electricity and has no drinking water, and the house’s bathroom is outside the house. Some months the business is poor and Jairo dedicates himself to agriculture and helping to raise chickens with his mom. When he isn’t working, he is also dedicated to odd jobs.

He is young and still wistfully says that due to the economic difficulties of his mother he cannot go to university. He would have liked to be a lawyer. He wants to continue to work hard like his mother taught him and in the future buy a place in the town market where he can sell his seafood. The loan’s money will be used to fix the boat's engine and purchase a new fishing net.

loans.use: to fix the boat's engine and purchase a new fishing net.

loans.name: Bellas Esmeraldas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BELLAS ESMERALDAS” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nicolasa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pan, venta de comida, venta de manta, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nicolasa es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de chompas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su tía y decidió emprender su propio negocio hace veinte años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de chompas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializara en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association, "Bellas Esmeraldas" will begin it's sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal Panamericana. The group is made up of eight members and is led by a directive board where Nicolasa is the president. Among the businesses that the members of the communal association carry out are: bread sales, food sales, blanket sales, clothing sales and cosmetics sales. The loan that they will receive will benefit these small businesses.

Nicolasa is a member of this group and she says that she has been involved with Pro Mujer for two years. She joined because of advertising that the institution did her in region. She currently has a business selling sweaters. She explains that she learned this business from her aunt who worked to start her own business 20 years ago.

The loan that she is currently requesting will be used to increase her capital (purchase sweaters in bulk) that she will buy from wholesalers in the city of El Alto. Afterwards, she will sell them in the markets in El Alto. This type of work allows her to generate an income in order to support her family economically as she is married and has four children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health center that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy sweaters in bulk.

loans.name: Malgrekatonewende Saidou Group

texts.fr:
Mr  SAÏDOU est le  responsable du groupe MALGREKATONEWENDE  SAÏDOU.  Il  est marié et père de  02 enfants.  Le plus âgé a 05 ans  et  le moins  âgé a 02 ans. Personne ne va à l’école et il a 04  personnes en charges.
Mr  fait le maraîchage et l'élevage depuis 20 ans. Il s’approvisionne au barrage dans un village environnant.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter  10 sacs  d’engrais,  05 boîtes  d’herbicides  et  01 moto pompe.
Il  veut  utiliser les bénéfices   du  prêt   pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. SAÏDOU is the official of the group MALGREKATONEWENDE SAÏDOU. He is a married father of two children. The older is 5 years old, and the younger is 2. None goes to school. He has four persons to support.

Mr. SAÏDOU has been operating a market garden for twenty years. He gets his supplies at the [checkpoint] of a nearby village.

With the money granted, he intends to purchase 10 bags of fertilizer, 5 cans of pesticide, and a motorized pump.

He wants to use his profits from the loan to reinvest in his business. His ambition is to provide an education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bags of fertilizer, 5 cans of herbicide, and a motorized pump

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old single man living with his four-member family in Irbid, a city in ‎northern Jordan. Irbid became a conflict area because of the security situation in Syria.

‎Mohammad goes to university and is majoring in civil engineering. He tried to find suitable work that he could do while he studies, but he was not able to find a job. His father is retired and is living on his retirement ‎salary, and his mother is a housewife. Mohammad is applying for an education loan to help ‎him cover his next semester fees. ‎

loans.use: to cover his next semester fees.

loans.name: Laafi La Boum Group

texts.fr:
Mr SALFO  est le  responsable du groupe LAAFI LA BOUM.  Il  est marié et père de 01 enfant de 05 ans. Personne  ne va à l’école et il a 02 personnes en charges.
Mr fait du maraîchage depuis 08ans. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché de son village.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter 02 sacs d’engrais.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne construire une maison.
texts.en:
Mr. SALFO is the official of the group LAAFI LA BOUM. He is a married father of a 5-year-old child. No one is in school. He has two persons to support,

Mr. SALFO has been operating a market garden for eight years. He gets his supplies at the market in his village.

With the money granted, he intends to purchase 2 bags of fertilizer.

He wants to use his profits from the loan to reinvest in his business. His ambition is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Pedro Efrain

texts.es:
Pedro, de 39 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora y responsable, se ha dedicado a trabajar la agricultura, está acompañado, junto a su esposa ha procreado dos hijos y están estudiando.

Pedro, desde que tenía 14 años de edad se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura, pero también vende pan dulce y atol por lo cual sale cada día a trabajar para poder ganar el sustento diario.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una motocicleta, porque la que tenía ya termino su vida útil y la necesita para repartir el pan, pues es su medio de transporte para vender sus productos.

Pedro, sueña con cultivar hortalizas, porque su padre le enseño como hacerlo.
texts.en:
Pedro, 39, is a hardworking and responsible person who has earned his living working in agriculture since he was 14. He's married and he and his wife have had two children, who attend school.

Pedro also sells pan dulce [sweet bread] and atol [beverage made of corn and masa]. He goes out every day to work and earn a daily living.

He needs the loan to buy a motorcycle, because the one he had is no longer reliable. It's his means of transportation and he needs it to distribute his bread and sell his products.

Pedro dreams of growing vegetables because his father taught him how to do it.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Naema

texts.en:
Naema, is a mother of six kids and a tailor. She lives in Jamala, a village near Ramallah. Some of her kids are in college and others are still in school. Naema has owned her tailoring business for 20 years in order to help her husband with the expenses for their kids and to improve their standard of living.

Naema is requesting a loan to purchase thread, needles, silk and beads. She hopes to improve her business and attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, silk and beads in order to improve her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, chicken feed, and animal medication.

loans.name: Dije

texts.en:
Dije is a maize farmer from Makwala village. As a Babban Gona member, Dije is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Dije would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Dije can to store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Dije no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Dije hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to ensure that all of her children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en:
Yohanna is maize farmer from Makwala village. As a member of Babban Gona, Yohanna is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Yohanna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Yohanna can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Yohanna is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to  acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Adamu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Adamu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Adamu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Adamu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Adamu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about not having money to pay for his children's school fees, and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Lawal is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Lawal is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Lawal would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Lawal will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Lawal now has the opportunity to realize his dream of expanding his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Kasimu

texts.en:
Kasimu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Kasimu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Kasimu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Kasimu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Kasimu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Kasimu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Flor Y Cielo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR Y CIELO” iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Florentina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne, venta de zapatos, venta de enlatados, venta de dulces, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Florentina es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su sobrina que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de calzados para damas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su yerno y con el poco de capital con el que contaba decidió emprender su propio negocio hace tres años, quien le ayuda en su negocio es su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de calzados por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Flor y Cielo" will start its 10th loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal Panamericana. It is comprised of eight members and is directed by a board of directors, where Florentina is president. The business that the members of the communal bank conducts is varied, including: the sale of meat, shoes, canned goods, candies, and vegetables.

The loan they receive will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs where Florentina is a member. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, joining by an invitation from her niece who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling women's footwear. She learned this business from her son-in-law, and with the little capital she had, she decided to start her own business three years ago. Her husband helps her with her business.

The loan that she will receive now will be to increase her capital (to buy footwear in bulk), which she will buy from wholesalers from the city of La Paz and will subsequently sell in her sales space. This way of working will allow her to generate resources to support her family economically, as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy footwear in bulk.

loans.name: Alh. Lawal

texts.en:
Alh. Lawal is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alh. Lawal has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alh. Lawal would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Alh. Lawal can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alh. Lawal will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land. Alh. Lawal is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 27-year-old single man  from Qabatiya , located in Jinen City. he works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. However, he wants to improve his family's standard of living help them live more comfortably.
 
Jihad took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a solar system and for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Jihad will be able heat water more efficiently, enable the family to take warm showers, while also decreasing the electricity expenses.
 
Jihad appears in the photo

loans.use: buy a solar system and for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Marekhi

texts.en:
Marekhi, 30 years old married woman is from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. The family had no source of income, until Marekhi opened a small store for soft drinks and chewing-gum and start working as a sales lady. She needs financial assistance for satisfying her clients needs and start selling various kind coffees.

After several unsuccessful attempts, Marekhi applied for the credit to MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. With the received amoung Marekhi will purchase a special coffeemaker and start producing many kinds of coffee. As the demand is high, she will be able to make more profit and have her own loyal costumers.

Marekhi and her husband rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful for the loan. The family will have enough income to tackle their financial difficulties and live better.

loans.use: to purchase a coffeemaker for her newly opened store .

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Trinidad works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Trinidad is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for her food vending business.

Trinidad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cristina is 32 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Cristina has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 10500 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Cristina has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Doris Cristina

texts.es:
Doris es una mujer soltera de 62 años de edad, la cual está solicitando un préstamo para iniciar un negocio de venta de calzado ambulante ofertara a sus amigos y vecinos, ella no cuenta con un empleo, se cansó de tener que pedir dinero para comprarse algo, quiere contar con su capital para satisfacer sus necesidades y demostrar a todos que ella puede lograr todo lo que se propone.
El dinero será destinado para la compra de sandalias que es el calzado más usado en la zona.
texts.en: Doris is 62 years old and single.  She is requesting a loan to start a business selling shoes door to door, offering them to her friends and neighbors.  She doesn't have a job and is tired of having to ask for money to buy something.  She wants to have her own capital to satisfy her needs and show everyone that she can achieve what she proposes.  The money will be used for buying sandals, which are the footwear most used in the area.

loans.use: start a business selling sandals.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco, de 27 años de edad, es un joven muy entusiasta, estudio un técnico en computación la universidad, actualmente está acompañado, tiene un hijo de dos años de edad y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Francisco, siempre ha sido una persona con muchos deseos de superación, mientras estudiaba ayudaba a su madre y sus hermanos a cultivar la tierra, porque su familia trabaja dos hectáreas de maíz y él les ayudaba todas la tardes porque en la mañana estudiaba; pero desde hace dos años trabajaba como empleado en un puesto de venta de celulares y accesorios.

Francisco, necesita el préstamo para comprar accesorios para celulares porque recién apertura su negocio en la ciudad.

Francisco, sueña con mejorar su negocio y que sea más rentable.
texts.en:
Francisco, age 27, is a very enthusiastic young man. He has a university degree in computer science. He lives with his partner, and he has a two-year-old child. His partner devotes herself to the household tasks.

Francisco has always had a great desire for success. While he was studying, he helped his mother and brothers to cultivate the land, as his family farms two hectares of corn. He helped them every afternoon because he studied in the morning. But, for the past two years he has been employed in a cell phone and accessories store.

Francisco needs the loan to purchase accessories for cell phones, because he recently opened his business in the city. Francisco dreams of improving his business, and that it may be more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for cell phones, because he recently opened his business in the city.

loans.name: Rupa's Group

texts.en:
At the age of 35, Rupa, standing to the extreme right in the photograph, is known in her village for her innovative, colourful designs in weaving. She weaves tablecloths and cushion covers with absolute creativity and design. She later sell these products to cloth traders, wholesalers, and retailers.

Managing a family of five, including her parents and two kids, she weaves with precision and subtlety for almost seven hours. She is the only breadwinner of the family and undertook this business after she was separated from her husband.

She wants to spread her skills and utilize her talent more by increasing her business. She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 36,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy different colours, starch, and cotton threads, thereby increasing her stock.

Let us weave her desire of increasing her capital and giving a better life to her family.

loans.use: to buy different colours, starch, and cotton threads, thereby increasing her stock.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Haruna has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Haruna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land. Haruna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and his family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Les Talentueuses Group

texts.fr: Amina est une femme âgée de 40 ans ,mariée mère de 4 enfants dont tous scolarisés. Elle exerce son activité depuis 15 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est son dynamisme et le travail bien fait, le respect de la clientèle, elle est la seule dans sa zone d'habitation à vendre la farine.Elle veut acheter le maïs à 325 000 f pour la transformation en Farine. L'utilité du prêt c'est de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 4 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévue à ACFIME.
texts.en: Amina is a 40-year-old woman and the married mother of four children, all in school. She has had her business for fifteen years. What drives her business is her energy, a job well done, and the respect from her customers. Amina is the only one in her residential area selling cornmeal. She wants to purchase corn worth 325,000 francs to produce cornmeal. The loan is for stocking up on enough of it to bolster her business. She has already had a loan four times, and has paid them back to ACFIME as planned.

loans.use: to purchase corn to produce cornmeal

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yusuf has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Kiva's field partner Babban Gona, Yusuf would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to a 21,668 NGN loan from Babban Gona Yusuf can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Yusuf will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Yusuf is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to store his maize, eliminating pressure to sell it for a low price at harvest.

loans.name: Flor Yungueñita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR YUNGUEÑITA” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Laura es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chompas, venta de mantas, venta de ropa, servicio de transporte, venta de juguetes. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Laura es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de unas amigas y emprendiendo este negocio por iniciativa propia hace doce años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas del departamento de Oruro y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan los ahorros y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association "Flor Yungueñita" will begin their eighth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal Los Andes. The group is made up of eight members and is led by a board of officers of which Laura is the secretary. Among the varied businesses that the members of the group carry out are: sweater sales, blanket sales, clothing sales, transportation services, and toy sales.

The loan that they will receive will benefit the small businesses including Laura's. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago after she received an invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling clothing. She shares that she learned this business from some friends and began this business of her own initiative twelve years ago.

The loan that she will receive will be used to increase her capital (to purchase clothing in bulk) that she will purchase from wholesalers in the area of Oruro. Afterwards, she will sell it in her store. This type of work allows her to generate an income to support her family economically as she is married and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the savings and the health center that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 21-years-old single young lady from Rafah city. Her father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely cover all the family needs.

Fatima is a student in the university where she studies Health Sciences. She wants to take the BSc. degree and find a job to help his family in part of their expenses.

Fatima took a USD murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her study. By taking this loan, Fatima will be able to do his homework and write reports easily. Fatima appears in the photo

loans.use: buy a new laptop to help write reports at her university study for a BSc. in Health Sciences.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Kiva's field partner Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at a low price at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to a 19,341 NGN loan from Babban Gona, Ibrahim will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Ibrahim now has the opportunity to fulfill his dream of building up his farm and profits to benefit him and his family. He would like to use this additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to store his maize, eliminating pressure on him to sell it at a low price at harvest time.

loans.name: Panfilo Exequiel

texts.es:
Panfilo es un hombre muy trabajador y esforzado, a sus cincuenta y un años de edad, se levanta desde las tres de la mañana a trabajar duro en sus siembras de ajonjolí y sorgo. Su hijo y esposa, son su principal ayuda, el encontró en MiCrédito y Kiva, grandes aliados.
En estos momentos, Pánfilo ha recurrido a un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, ya que planea usarlo en la compra de pesticidas, abono y contratación de mano de obra para sacar adelante su cosecha de ajonjolí. En un futuro se ve comprando más tierra para cosechar y distribuyendo su producto a grandes exportadores.
texts.en:
Panfilo is a very hard-working and earnest man. At 51 years old, he rises at 3 in the morning to work hard in his sesame and sorghum plots. His child and wife are his principal help. He found MiCrédito and Kiva--great allies.

In these times, Panfilo has appealed for a loan from Kiva together with MiCrédito. Now he plans to use it to buy pesticides and fertilizer, and to hire manual labor to get his sesame harvest off the ground. In the future, he sees himself buying more land to harvest and distributing his yields to large exporters.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer, and to hire manual labor.

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en:
Kabiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Kabiru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Kabiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Kabiru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Kabiru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land. Kabiru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and his family, and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Famille Kyanda Group

texts.fr: Avant sa mort, l'époux d'Emilianne a initié cette dernière dans l'activité de vente de matériels de pêche qu'il exerçait couramment. Emilianne a présentement une expérience de quatre ans; elle trouve que cette activité est rentable car elle réalise moyennement une vente journalière de deux cent cinquante dollars. Ce crédit sera orienté dans l'achat pour revente de nouveaux filets de pêche en remplacement de filets maillants prohibés. Comme obstacle, Emilianne a parlé de la fermeture momentané du lac, période pendant laquelle les pêcheurs n'ont quoi faire de matériels de pêche. Elle a pour projet d'agrandir son activité et d'effectuer des voyages à DUBAI, le lieu principal d'approvisionnement pour ces articles. Avec une bonne rentabilité, elle serait capable d'assurer la scolarité des orphelins sous sa charge, leur alimentation et la construction d'une belle maison. Sur photo, Emilianne est la dame assisse devant son étalage et habillée en pagnes multicolore.
texts.en:
Before he died, Emilianne’s husband introduced her to the business of selling fishing supplies and equipment that he used to sell well. Emilianne currently has four years of experience; she finds this work to be profitable, since she realizes average daily sales of $250.

This loan will be applied to the purchase of goods, new fishing nets for retail sale for replacing the prohibited gill nets. As for obstacles, she has talked about the momentary closing of the lake, during which fisherfolk have fishing equipment.

Her plans include expanding her business and traveling to DUBAI, the main place for supplies of these items. With good profitability, she would be able to ensure an education for the orphans in her care, as well as their food and building a nice house. In the photo, Emilianne is the woman sitting in front of her display and dressed in multi-colored ‘pagne’ cloth.

loans.use: to do commerce in new fishing nets

loans.name: Erika Vanesa

texts.es:
Erika es una joven de 19 años de edad que para darle rienda suelta a sus sueños de tener un hogar propio y pagar su educación, inicio  con un negocio de venta de ropa, el cual opera desde su hogar pero también sale todos los días a vender puerta a puerta, es una mujer muy luchadora y perseverante, una persona que busca por todos los medios triunfar y dejar su huella.
Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para diversificar su oferta de productos a los clientes, dicho dinero le permitirá ampliar su portafolio ofreciendo productos como desodorantes, lociones, cremas de manos y surtida ropa para hombre y dama
texts.en: Erika is a 19 year old youth, who in order to give loose reins to her dreams of having her own home and paying for her education, started a business selling clothing, which she operates from her home, but she also leaves everyday to sell door to door.  She is a very dedicated and persevering woman, a person who looks for every way to triumph and leave her mark.  Currently, she is requesting a loan to diversify her selection of products to offer her customers.  The loan money will allow her to amplify her portfolio, offering products like deodorants, lotions, hand creams, and a selection of women's and men's clothing.

loans.use: to purchase deodorants, lotions, hand creams and a selection of clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Luz Enid Del Carmen

texts.es:
Luz se dedica a la fabricación y venta de artículos para bebe.
Es casada, es madre de tres hijos y con gran satisfacción y amor por su trabajo, pues este le ha dado lo necesario para vivir.

Solicita un aliento económico el cual invertirá en la compra de insumos como tela, hilos, encajes, y una maquina tejedora la cual le permitirá mejorar su producción.

 Con este préstamo podrá sacar adelante su empresa y podría convertirse en una gran empresaria a futuro.
texts.en:
Luz makes and sells baby items.

She is married, and the mother of three children. She feels great satisfaction and love for her work, as it has given her what she needs to live.

She is requesting a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of supplies such as fabric, thread, lace, and a weaving machine that will allow her to improve her production.

With this loan, she will be able to move her business forward, and she could become a great businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, such as fabric, thread, lace, and a weaving machine.

loans.name: Marleny Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen es una mujer casada de 58 años de edad, independiente, soñadora, responsable y trabajadora, madre de 5 hijos, que ante las necesidades económicas de su hogar, busco la manera de generar ingresos sin descuidar lo más importante en su vida que son sus hijos, por ello junto unos ahorros e inicio con la venta de productos de la canasta familiar, la cual ubico en una alcoba de su hogar y poco a poco ha ido surtiendo y comprando estantería para darle forma de tienda.
Su principales sueños es pagar la educación de sus muchachos y mejorar las condiciones de vivienda y está convencida que con su tienda y junto con su esposo lo logrará.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para compra de surtido como gaseosa, grano, carnes frías, snacks, dulces, cervezas y accesorios.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen is a 58-year-old woman who is married, independent, responsible, hardworking and a dreamer. She is the mother of five children. Due to the economic needs of her household, she was looking for a way to generate an income without losing sight of the most important thing in her life, which are her sons. Because of this, she gathered some savings and began selling staple goods from a room in her home. Little by little, she has been stocking her store and buying shelving units to make this space into a store.

Her main dream is to pay for her children's education and to improve their living conditions. She is convinced that with her store, together with her husband, they will be able to achieve this.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy items to stock her store such as soda, grains, cold cuts, snacks, sweets, beer and accessories.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store including soda, grains, cold cuts, snacks, sweets, beer and accessories.

loans.name: Marilyatou

texts.fr: Agée de 34 ans, Marilyatou est une femme mariée qui vit à Agoè. Avec deux enfants à charge, Marilyatou est une revendeuse des objets en plastiques. Marilyatou s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Mariulyatou sollicite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de bassines et sceaux en plastiques en vue de mieux revendre et satisfaire parfaitement les attentes de ses clients puis réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin d’aider son mari à subvenir aux charges et besoins quotidiens de ses enfants.
texts.en: Marilyatou, aged 34, is a married woman living in Agoè. With two children to support, she is retailer of plasticware. She gets her supplies once a month at the market and resells out of her house and by crisscrossing nearby neighborhoods. Marilyatou is requesting this loan to order dozens of plastic basins and buckets with the aim of having better sales and satisfying fully the expectations of her customer. Then she can realize a good profit margin for helping out her husband to cover day-to-day expenses and to meet the children’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase 6 dozen buckets and 15 dozen basins

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, She also earns additional income from coconut grinding. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 50000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 35 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business

loans.name: Sohort's Group

texts.en:
A young widowed woman is living in a 2 bedroom house located in Tbaung Khmum province, Sohort is 19 years old and she has a young child. To make a living, she has been growing cassava to support her family's living condition for years. Her daily income is about 12USD per day. After expenses, she can save around 7USD each day.

In order to save her business, she decides to get a loan which is the first loan for her group with VisionFund. Her group contains four members, and she is a group leader. Sohort will use her portion of loan to buy fertilizer to grow her cassava. She hopes her cassava will be growing well which provides her a better returns so as to save for future needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer so her cassava grows well, which will provide her a better return so as to save for future needs. .

location.town: Tbaung Khmum Province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Savy is a 36-year-old farmer living in Tbaung Khmum province and a married mother of four children, three of whom are dependent on her. She has been growing cassava as the main source of income for ages. Moreover, she has been growing rice and rubber plants to earn supplementary income as well. The crop has been threatened by drought recently, which caused her to earn lower income than expected.

This is the first time of her with VisionFund by leading a group of two and she is going to manage her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to produce good outputs. She hopes to get higher yields so that she can earn more income to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to produce good outputs so that she can earn more income

location.town: Tbaung Khmum Province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr:
Membre depuis Décembre 2009,  cette brave femme a une expérience dans le programme des Bancs Villageois et a comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Ramatoulaye est mariée, âgée de 31 ans et mère de 05 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires (patte d’arachide et d’huile de palme).
 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 10 sacs de 50 kg  d’arachide et  05 bouteilles de 20 litre d’huile de palme qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour le revendre en détails chez elle.

Les bénéfices lui serviront  de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et d’aider son mari dans la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
A member since December 2009, this good and honest woman has experience in 'banc villageois' programs. Her main work involves small-scale commerce. Ms. Ramatoulaye is married, 31 years old, and the mother of five. She is active in selling grocery items, such as peanut butter and palm oil.

With this loan, she intends to purchase ten 50-kg sacks of peanuts and five 20-liter bottles of palm oil, which she buys from the weekly markets to resell at her home.

The profits will be used to meet the needs of her children and to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase ten 50-kg sacks of peanuts and five 20-liter bottles of palm oil

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ayuba has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, which is 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ayuba had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, in order to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Ayuba is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ever Luis

texts.es:
Ever es un hombre de 34 años de edad que busca mejorar las condiciones de vivienda de su familia y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus dos hijos de 5 y 6 años de edad, por ello quiere acudir a un apoyo crediticio para la compra de purina de engorde para cerdos y compra de materiales para la construcción de porquerizas.
Este honesto, trabajador hombre se la juega toda por su negocio, quiere triunfar y ser un importante porcicultor de la zona, quiere ser grande para enorgullecer a sus hijos y dejarles una excelente herencia.
texts.en:
Ever is a 34-year-old man who is seeking to improve the living conditions of her family and offer a better quality of life to his two children who are 5 and 6 years old. Because of this, he is asking for a loan to purchase Purina feed to fatten pigs and to buy materials to construct pigsties.

This honest, hardworking man is risking it all for his business. He wants to succeed and be an important pig farmer in the area in order to make his children proud and to give them a good inheritance.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs and construction materials to build pigsties.

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr:
29 ans, Joséphine est mariée et il est conducteur salarié dans une entreprise privée. Le couple a deux petites filles de 4 et 9 ans et elle sont tous scolarisées dans une école privée.
Avant 2003, elle travaillait dans une entreprise de zone franche, et depuis lors, elle vend des ustensiles de cuisine, car elle voulait avoir sa propre activité. C'est une femme travailleuse qui exerce à part ce commerce d'autres activités dans d'autres secteurs comme l'élevage porcin et la fabrication et vente des briques. 
Son désire est d'améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille. Elle a déjà acquis un terrain et est encours d'acheter petits à petits les matériaux nécessaires pour la construction de sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Joséphine, aged 29, is married, and [her husband] is a salaried driver at a private company. The couple have two young girls, aged 4 and 9, who are both in a private school.

Before 2003, Joséphine used to work at a company in the free zone. Since then, she has been selling kitchen utensils, since she wanted to have her own business. This is a hard-working woman who has other work, aside from her business, in other sectors, such as raising pigs and producing bricks to sell.

Her wish is to improve her family's living conditions. She has already acquired a plot of land and is in the middle of purchasing bit by bit the supplies necessary for building a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils and plastic tubs, buckets, cups, etc.

loans.name: Faruq

texts.en:
Faruq is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Faruq is grateful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Faruq would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Faruq will store the maize he harvests and delay selling until a date later in the season. Then he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Faruq now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Andrawus

texts.en:

As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Andrawus would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Andrawus will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize -- a premium of up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Andrawus now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community on his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdulkadir would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, in order to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Abdulkadir can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Abdulkadir will benefit from marketing support that could help generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Abdulkadir is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

Yusuf is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yusuf has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.
