Yusuf is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Naomi has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Naomi would have to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, in order to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Naomi can now store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Naomi will benefit from marketing support that could help her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Naomi is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Farasoa

texts.fr:
Farasoa a 42 ans, Elle est mariée et son mari est chauffeur. Le couple a deux enfants et ils sont tous étudiants à l'université. L'ainé est en 4ème année en médecine et le second 1èré année en polytechnique. Son activité génératrice de revenu est vente des vêtements. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 1997. Elle en possède donc plusieurs années d’expériences. 
Sa priorité est actuellement les études de ses enfants, et pour pouvoir les financer jusqu'à terme, l'amélioration de son revenu est le meilleur moyen. C'est pourquoi, elle voudrait développer et étendre son activité d'où la raison de sa demande de prêt. Elle voudrait des bonnes carrières pour eux.
texts.en:
Farasoa is 42 years old and married. Her husband is a driver. The couple have two children, both university students. The older is a senior in medicine, and the second one is a freshman in sciences/engineering. Farasoa’s revenue-generating work is in selling clothing. She has been in this business since 1997. So she has several years of experience.

Her priority is currently her children’s education. To be able to finance it to completion, the best way is to improve her income. This is why she would like to develop and expand her business, thus the reason behind her loan application. She would like good careers for her children.

loans.use: to purchase skirts, shorts, and outfits to resell

loans.name: Alicia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Alicia, una señora muy carismática de sesenta años de edad, todos los días inicia su día muy temprano, limpiando su puesto de trabajo en uno de los mercados de su ciudad, ella vende productos de plástico, y también platos, vasos, cubiertos y bolsas desechables, esta emprendedora mujer ha hecho de su negocio algo estable. 
En estos momentos, Alicia está teniendo mucha demanda de sus productos, por lo tanto ella para poder estar siempre abastecida ha solicitado un préstamo de Kiva junto MiCrédito con el que pueda comprar grandes y variadas cantidades de productos desechables. En un futuro desea poder incursionar en la venta de otros además de mejorar la infraestructura de su puesto en el mercado.
texts.en:
Alicia is a very charismatic lady, age sixty. She starts her day very early every day, cleaning her workplace in one of the markets of her city. She sells plastic products, and also disposable plates, glasses, cutlery, and bags, and this enterprising woman has turned her business into something stable.

At the moment, Alicia has a lot of demand for her products. Therefore, in order to always be well-stocked, she has requested a Kiva loan with MiCrédito, so that she may purchase large and varied quantities of disposable products.

In the future, she wants to venture into selling other products, in addition to improving the infrastructure of her store in the market.

loans.use: to purchase large and varied quantities of disposable products.

loans.name: Rosa Elida

texts.es: Rosa, es una madre soltera, de 60 años, que vive en el municipio de Mercedes, Ocotepeque que colinda con el municipio de Gracias, Lempira tiene 4 hijos y actualmente esta viviendo con una hija.  Ella maneja un puesto de comida donde vende pupusas, tajadas con pollo y otras cosas desde hace 10 años en su casa. Ella solicita la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras para invertir en productos para elaborar mas platos de comida y tener mejores ventas . Su sueño es convertirse en una fuerte microempresaria
texts.en:
Rosa is a single mother who is 60 years old and lives in the municipality of Mercedes, Ocotepeque which borders the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. She has four children and currently lives with her daughter. She runs a food stall from her home where she sells pupusas (stuffed tortillas), fried plantains with chicken and other things. She has been doing this for ten years.

She is applying for a loan in the amount of 5,000 Lempiras to invest in products to make more dishes and have better sales. Her dream is to become a strong micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy products to make more dishes.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yakubu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, in order to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu will benefit from marketing support that could help him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Yakubu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jaider Alonso

texts.es:
El señor Jader es un hombre de 32 años de edad que actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para iniciar un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, esta decisión la toma de la necesidades de generar ingresos para aportar en su hogar, puesto que conseguir empleo se ha tornado un trabajo bastante tedioso y aspira no solo a tener ingresos fijos sino también triunfar y brindarle la oportunidad a personas que como él, en algún momento necesitaron de un empleo.
El dinero será para la compra de un carro de comidas rápidas, uniformes, enseres, y surtido.
texts.en:
Jaider, 32, is currently requesting a loan to start a business selling fast food.

He made this decision because he needs to earn an income for his household, and finding a job has become very tiresome. He wants to have a steady income as well as be successful and give people like himself who need a job the opportunity to work.

The money is to buy a fast-food cart, uniforms, equipment, and provisions.

loans.use: to start a fast-food business

loans.name: Ishaku

texts.en:
Ishaku is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Ishaku is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to end the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Ishaku would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, in order to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Ishaku can now store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Ishaku has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Ishaku is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to pay for his children's school fees. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sahura

texts.en:
Sahura is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Sahura has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sahura would have to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, in order to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sahura can now store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Sahura will benefit from marketing support that could help her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Sahura is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family, and looks forward to using her additional earnings to diversify her farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ema

texts.en:
Ema is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ema is grateful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Ema would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Ema will store the maize he harvests and delay selling until a date later in the season. Then he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Ema now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nirina Sabine

texts.fr:
Sabine est une femme travailleuse et débrouillarde de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari est secrétaire dans une entreprise d’abattoir. Le couple est parent de quatre enfants âgés de 8 à 15 ans. Ces derniers sont tous scolarisés dans une école privée.
Elle exerce deux activités complémentaires pour gagner sa vie. Il s'agit de l'élevage porcin et boucherie. Elle voudrait développer l'activité élevage et demande un crédit pour augmenter les nombres de cheptels.
Son objectif est le bien-être de ses enfants: leurs pouvoir offrir une meilleur qualité de vie et les voir réussir dans leurs études.
texts.en:
Sabine is 40 years old and a hardworking and resourceful woman. She is married and her husband is a secretary at a slaughterhouse enterprise. The couple are the parents of four children, aged 8 to 15, who are all in a private school.

Sabine has two complementary businesses to earn her living. They involve raising pigs and a butcher shop. She would like to develop her livestock business and is asking for a loan to increase her herd.

Her goal is focused on the well-being of her children: to be able to provide them with a better quality of life and see them succeed in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase 5 piglets

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a maize farmer from Kugawa village. As a Babban Gona member, Timothy is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Kiva's field partner Babban Gona, Timothy would have had to sell his maize at harvest when the price of maize is at its lowest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to a 8,588 NGN Babban Gona loan Timothy can now store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

With the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Timothy no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Timothy hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to store his maize harvest, eliminating pressure on him to sell it at a low price at harvest.

loans.name: Adelmarie Claudia

texts.fr:
Claudia est une femme courageuse et travailleuse de 42 ans. Elle est veuve depuis 2011 et mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Depuis le décès de son mari, elle a  à assumer seule les devoirs parentales vis à vis de ses enfants. Puisqu'elle ne reçoit pas de pension de veuvage donc elle devait se débrouiller pour améliorer le revenu, c'est pourquoi, elle commençait à exercer une activité de vente des goûters pour les élèves à part la vente des friperies (son activité depuis toujours. Elle a passé un contrat avec  le directeur de l'établissement où elle exploite la vente de goûters.
Malgré sa situation, elle ne se plaint et ne baisse jamais les bras, toujours dynamique et prête à avancer et à continuer la lutte.
texts.en:
Claudia is a courageous and hardworking woman who is 42 years old. She has been a widow since 2011 and the mother of two children, who are both in school. Since her husband died, she has taken on the parental duties by herself with regard to her children. Receiving no widows’ pension, she therefore was on her own in figuring out how to improve her income. This is why she started a business selling snacks for children, aside from the sale of secondhand clothing (the business she has always had). She signed a contract with the director of the establishment where she sells her snacks.

Despite her situation, she has no complaints, and she never rests, always energetic and ready to go forward and continue in her struggles.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, snacks, and some used clothing

loans.name: Fidel Ángel

texts.es:
Fidel, de 54 años de edad, es una persona honesta, trabajadora y responsables, está casado y con su esposa procrearon tres hijos, pero sus hijos ya crecieron y formaron sus propias familias y su esposa le ayuda a darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos y a cuidar sus animalitos. 

Fidel, ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura, porque ese fue el oficio que le enseñaron sus padres y es de donde el obtiene ingresos para comprar lo que se necesita un su hogar. 

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar cuatro novillas, para poder y obtener ganancias a corto plazo.

Fidel, sueña con tener 12 novillas para obtener mejores ganancias y de esa manera poder vivir una vida más tranquila.
texts.en:
Fidel is 54 years old and is an honest, hardworking and responsable person. He is married and has three children with his wife. His children are now grown up and have their own families. His wife helps him to maintain his crops and care for his animals.

Fidel has worked in agriculture his whole life as that is the trade that his parents taught him. This is where he obtains an income to purchase what his household needs.

He needs the money from the loan to buy four heifers in order to obtain short-term income. Fidel dreams of having 12 heifers to obtain greater profits and in this way, be able to live a calmer life.

loans.use: to buy four heifers.

loans.name: Abdulhadi

texts.en:
Abdulhadi is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Kiva's field partner Babban Gona, Abdulhadi would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With a 18,519 NGN Babban Gona loan he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member Abdulhadi will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. He is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for them.

loans.use: to store his maize, eliminating pressure on him to sell it at a low price at harvest time.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Silas has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Kiva's field partner Babban Gona, Silas would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With a 34,352 NGN Babban Gona loan he can store and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member Silas will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. He is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to store his maize, eliminating pressure on him to sell it at a lower price at harvest time.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESPERANZA” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nelly es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de chinelas, venta de zapatos de cholita, venta de perfumes, venta de comida, venta de cosméticos. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nelly es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa para cholita; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió desde pequeña, ya que ayudaba a su mama en la venta de ropa y decidió iniciar su propio negocio hace varios años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de polleras y mantas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association "Esperanza" will begin its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal Los Andes. The group is made up of eight members and is led by a board of officers of which Nelly is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association have are varied and include: clothing sales, sandal sales, Cholita shoe sales, perfume sales, food sales and cosmetics sales.

The loan they will receive will benefit the small businesses including Nelly's. She says that she has been involved with Pro Mujer for two years and joined because of the invitation she received from a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling clothing for Cholitas [members of a Bolivian social and political indigenous movement; Cholitas distinguish themselves by wearing bowler hats and colorful skirts and shawls.] She shares that she learned this business when she was young as she would help her mother by selling clothes and decided to start her own business a few years ago.

The loan that she will receive will be used to increase her capital (to buy skirts and shawls in bulk) which she will buy from wholesalers in the city of El Alto. Afterwards, she will sell them in her store. This type of work allows her to generate an income in order to support her family economically as she is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and the health center that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy polleras (skirts for women) in bulk.

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en:
Alhassan is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhassan has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhassan would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Alhassan can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Alhassan will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Alhassan is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola es una hermosa joven de 25 años de edad, madre cabeza de familia, tiene un pequeño de 8 años el cual ama con todo su corazón y desde que nació esta criatura lo único que ha hecho es luchar por ofrecerle una vida digna, que tenga todo para crecer como un niño sano, sonriente y bien alimentando, ha entregado su juventud a favor de su pequeño.
Ella se dedica a ofertar servicios de salón de belleza, ya tiene bastante experiencia en el campo y quiere dar un gran paso que es, constituir un local, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para montar toda la peluquería inicialmente en su vivienda mientras junta recursos y fideliza clientes para trasladarse a un almacén.
Por ello solicita un préstamo para comprar los enseres y activos para su proyecto, tales como espejos, máquinas, silla de motilar y productos químicos.
texts.en:
Paola is a beautiful 25-year-old woman who is a mother and the head of her family. She has an 8-year-old little boy who she loves with all her heart. Since this child was born, she has done nothing but strive to offer him a decent life, so he will have everything he needs to grow up healthy, happy, and well fed. She has given up her youth for her child.

She works offering beauty salon services. She has quite a lot of experience in this field, and she wants to take a big step and open a salon. She wants to request a loan to set up the beauty salon initially in her home while she gathers resources and builds a loyal clientele in order to move to a store.

That is why she is requesting a loan to buy the equipment and assets for her project, such as mirrors, machines, a barber chair, and chemical products.

loans.use: to buy the equipment and assets for her project, such as mirrors, machines, a barber chair, and chemical products.

loans.name: Gulkaiyr

texts.ru: Гулькайыр, 44 года, замужем, мать 2 дочерей. Образование у нее средне-специальное, работает медицинской сестрой. На протяжении 25 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, мастер в своем деле. Она достигла больших успехов в своем бизнесе. В хозяйстве имеет корову, 10 овец. Также есть земельный надел, 1,30 ГА собственной земли, где Гулькайыр выращивает ячмень для реализации. Совокупная прибыль составляет около 11,000 сом (KGS). Гулькайыр обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков. Это позволит Гулькайыр развить бизнес, построить сараи для скота и увеличить доход от бизнес деятельности.
texts.en:
Gulkaiyr is 44, married, and the mother of two daughters.  She has a specialized secondary education and works as a nurse.  For the past 25 years, she has also been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture.  She runs her own business and she's been quite successful.  Gulkaiyr currently has one cow and 10 sheep.  She also grows barley for resale on 1.3 hectares of her own land.  She makes a total income of about 11,000 som (KGS).

Gulkaiyr has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy two steers.  This will allow her to grow her business, build a barn for her livestock, and increase the income she makes from her farming activity.

loans.use: to buy two steers in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Sonia De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer que le gusta asumir retos, tiene treinta y nueve años de edad, buena madre, esposa e hija, piensa que su familia es algo primordial para luchar día a día. Ella está en un negocio en el cual el comerciante tiene que ser fuerte y saber administrar sus ganancias, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a vender distintos tipos de pescados y mariscos en el mercado de su ciudad, gracias al apoyo que ha recibido por préstamos de MiCrédito y Kiva, ella ha logrado mantenerse a flote y soportar los tiempos de escasez. 
En estos momentos que ya casi comienzan las fiestas navideñas, la comercialización de su producto tiene gran demanda, por eso ella ha solicitado un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito que le permita comprar contenedores de mariscos de la mejor calidad. En un futuro planea comprar unos frezzers más grandes para salvaguardar su producto, también mejorar su puesto de venta y ahorrar para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Sonia is a woman who enjoys a challenge. She is thirty-nine years old, a good mother, wife, and daughter. She feels her family is the most important reason to work hard day by day. She is in a business where the merchant has to be strong and know how to administer their earnings. This entrepreneurial woman sells a variety of fish and seafood in the market in her city. Thanks to the support she has received via loans from MiCrédito and Kiva, she has been able to keep her business afloat and survive moments of scarcity.

It’s almost time for the Christmas season, when her product has great demand. Because of this, she has requested a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito which will allow her to buy containers of the highest quality seafood. In the future she plans to buy some larger freezers in order to store her product, and she’ll also improve her sales stall and save in order to build her house.

loans.use: to buy containers of the highest quality seafood.

loans.name: Corazón De Rosario Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZON DE ROSARIO” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maritza es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas de vicuña y alpaca, venta de comida, venta de artículos de limpieza, venta de fruta, tienda de barrio. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maritza es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a promocionar a su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas de vicuña y alpaca; da a conocer que este negocio inicio hace varios años con el apoyo de su madre. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de mantas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
“CORAZON DE ROSARIO” communal bank will begin the fourth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional hub.. It is made up of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors with Maritza as its President. Members of this communal bank have a variety of businesses, including: selling vicuña and alpaca manta weavings, food sales, cleaning product sales, fruit sales, and a neighborhood store.

The loan they will take out will benefit female small business owners. One of them is Maritza. She says she has been in Pro Mujer for three years, joining through an invitation from an institution promotion in the area. Currently, she has a business selling vicuña and alpaca manta weavings. She started this business several years ago with support from her mother.

The present loan will be to raise capital (buy mantas in bulk) which she will acquire from wholesalers in the city of El Alto. Then she will sell them in markets in El Alto. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially. She lives with a partner and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy manta weavings at wholesale.

loans.name: Asabe

texts.en:
Asabe is maize farmer from Sabon Garin Kuzuntu village. As a member of Babban Gona, Asabe is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support she has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Asabe would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Asabe can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Asabe is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use her increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:

Musa is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Akbilek

texts.ru: Акбилек, 40 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Акбилек среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она уже много лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Акбилек, на сегодняшний день у нее есть две коровы, 6 овец. Акбилек обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для закупки 4 нетелей. Она намерена и дальше увеличивать поголовье скота и развивать ее бизнес.
texts.en:
Akbilek is 40, married, and the mother of four children.  She has a secondary education.  In order to provide a source of income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry for many years already.  Thanks to her perseverance, dedication and hard work, she currently owns two cows and six sheep.

Akbilek has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy four heifers.  She intends to further increase her livestock headcount and to develop her farming business.

loans.use: to buy four heifers in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Renaul Manuel

texts.es:
Renaul tiene 50 años y vive en el municipio de Tierralta. Es padre soltero y tiene 3 hermosas hijas de 8, 6 y 4 años, quienes son su motivación principal y la razón para levantarse cada mañana a encontrar la forma de brindarles la mejor calidad de vida que le sea posible. La necesidad económica lo llevaron a reflexionar sobre qué hacer para tener un sustento para su familia, así que decidió comenzar su propio negocio.

Este amoroso y responsable padre decidió comenzar un negocio de elaboración de ladrillos, pero para lograr este objetivo le hace falta capital para invertir y tener un buen comienzo, pues su principal objetivo es obtener ganancias suficientes para el sustento de su familia. Ha decidido pedir un préstamo que le permita crear su negocio a través de la compra de moldes para bloques, arena, cemento, baldes y una pala.

El mayor sueño de Renaul es poder comprar su propia casa algún día, de manera que pueda brindarle a su familia un lugar seguro donde puedan crecer felices. Usted puede ser parte de esta hermosa historia, un préstamo ayudará a comenzar la construcción de un sueño.
texts.en:
Renaul is 50 years old and lives in the township of Tierralta. He is a single father and has three beautiful daughters, ages 8, 6, and 4, who are his principal motivation and his reason for getting up every morning to find the way to offer them the best quality of life that is possible for him. Economic necessity brought him to reflect on what to do to have sustenance for his family. Thus he decided to begin his own business.

This loving and responsible father decided to begin a business of making bricks, but he lacks the capital to invest to achieve this goal and have a good start, since his principal objective is to obtain sufficient earnings for the support of his family. He has decided to ask for a loan that will allow him to create his business through the purchase of molds for blocks, sand, cement, buckets, and a shovel.

Renaul's great dream is to be able to buy his own house some day, so that he can offer his family a secure place where they can grow up happy.

You can be part of this beautiful story. A loan will help him to begin the construction of a dream.

loans.use: to buy molds for blocks, sand, cement, buckets, and a shovel.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Kwakwa village. As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Ibrahim can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ibrahim no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Ibrahim hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to fulfill the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Samaila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land – 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila had to sell his maize at harvest, when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can store his maize and sell it later for up to 37% more than the price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Samaila will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Samaila is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Eli

texts.en:

Traditionally, Eli would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona Eli can store her maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Eli has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. 
Eli is thankful that she no longer has to worry about having had no money to purchase better inputs to improve her yield and looks forward to using her additional earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Maria Luz Elena

texts.es:
Ella es Luz Elena, una mujer, sonriente, alegre, luchadora, una persona fiel y honesta que detrás de esa sonrisa oculta el dolor de haber perdido a su esposo.
En su espalda carga la responsabilidad de mantener un hogar conformado pro 10 hijos, para su suerte muchos de ellos son mayores de edad y se valen por si mismos, mientras ella sale todos los días a trabajar entre 12 y 15 horas en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para abastecer su negocio con un completo surtido de víveres, abarrotes, productos lácteos entre otros, tales como: panela, arroz, café, chocolate, frijol, azúcar, etc.
texts.en:
Luz Elena's a smiling, happy, and persevering woman, a faithful and honest person whose smile hides the pain of having lost her husband.

The responsibility of supporting a household of 10 children rests on her shoulders. Fortunately many of them are adults who take care of themselves, while she goes out every day to work between 12 and 15 hours a day in her grocery business.

Luz Elena's requesting a loan now to stock her business with a complete supply of provisions: groceries, dairy products, raw cane sugar, rice, coffee, chocolate, beans, sugar, and others.

loans.use: to buy a complete supply of provisions, including raw sugar cane, rice, coffee, chocolate, beans, and sugar

loans.name: Flor Alba

texts.es:
Mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda siempre ha sido el sueño de Flor Alba, una mujer humilde, que se dedicaba a las labores domésticas, atiende diariamente a sus dos hijos de 12 y 15 años de edad junto con su esposo, una vez que termina las labores de aseo del hogar, de inmódicamente pasa a su faceta de vendedora de ropa, ella es muy activa, siempre está buscando que hacer, para ella es muy importante su labor, puesto que complementa los ingresos con los que se sostiene su hogar.
Un objetivo que se ha trazado la señora Flor Alba es lograr la independencia económica, tener un local de ropa, generar empleo y que su negocio sea sostenible y rentable.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa juvenil para hombre y dama con la que espera mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes y llegar a más personas, que hablen de su negocio, eso es lo que espera.
texts.en:
Flor Alba's dream has always been to improve her living conditions. She is a modest woman who earns a living in domestic work. Together with her husband, she daily looks after her 2 children, ages 12 and 15 years old. Once she finishes her household cleaning work, she immediately goes to her role as a clothing seller. She is very active, always looking for something to do. Her work is really important to her since it supplements the income with which she supports her home.

One objective Ms. Flor Alba has considered is to achieve economic independence, to have a clothing shop, to create employment, and that her business may be sustainable and profitable.

She currently requests a loan in order to purchase junior's clothes for men and women, with which she hopes to improve her sales, increase her clients, and reach more people who may speak about her business. That is what she hopes for.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothing.

loans.name: Marie Thérèse

texts.fr:
Marie Thérèse a 40 ans maintenant. Elle est mariée et son mari est maçon tâcheron donc il y a des moments pendant lesquels il ne trouve pas de travail. Le couple a deux enfants qui ne sont plus entièrement à leur charge parce qu'ils ont déjà leurs propre job. Ils habitent encore avec eux.
Elle vend des téléphones portables il y a maintenant cinq ans. Elle est travailleuse, active et dynamique. Avec le prêt, elle va acheter des téléphones supplémentaires Son but est de diversifier les marques pour attirer beaucoup de clients.
L'objectif du couple est d'épargner davantage afin de pouvoir acheter une voiture 4L. Cette voiture va être utilisée comme TAXI et ce sera son mari qui va la conduire.
texts.en:
Marie Thérèse is 40 years old.  She is married to a bricklayer (contractor) who doesn't always find work.  The couple has two children who are no longer fully their dependents because they have their own jobs.  However, the children still live with them.

Marie Thérèse has been selling cellular phones for the past five years.  She is an active and energetic retailer.  She will use her loan to buy additional phones.  Her goal is to diversify the brands that she sells so that she can attract more customers.

Marie Thérèse and her husband share the same goal; they want to increase their savings in order to buy a car (Renault 4L).  Marie Thérèse's husband will  use this car to work as a taxi driver.

loans.use: to buy various types of cellular phones.

loans.name: Obeida Rosa

texts.es:
Obeida es una mujer de 29 años de edad que con su trabajo de artesanías trata de mantener en pie una tradición familiar que con el pasar del tiempo ha ido desapareciendo, debido a la fuerte competencia  que hay en la zona.
Su propósito es renacer esta linda profesión, mostrar sus productos a los habitantes de la zona y los extranjeros, hacer que sus semejantes tengan sentido de pertenencia por lo suyo, por lo que fabrican sus manos, por  accesorios y artículos tradicionales, pero será un proceso largo que y complicado que está dispuesta a asumir.
Obeida quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de palma, pinturas, caña flecha, con las cuales fabrica, canastas, sombreros entre otros artículos, cabe de decir que esta es la única manera que tiene para generar los ingresos para subsistir.
texts.en:
Obeida is a 29 year old woman who with her work with crafts tries to maintain alive a family tradition that with the passing of time is disappearing due to the strong competition in the area.

Her goal is to revive this lovely profession, showing her talent to the inhabitants of the area and foreigners, making her fellow human beings have a feeling of belonging because of her work, for what she makes with her hands for accessories and traditional products. It will be a difficult and long process that she is ready to assume.

Obeida wants to request a loan for the purchase of palm, paint, caña flecha (Gynerium sagitatum) to fabricate baskets and hats and other articles. Needless to say it is the only method she has to generate income to subsist.

loans.use: to buy palm, paint, caña flecha (Gynerium sagitatum) to fabricate baskets and hats.

loans.name: Julian Andres

texts.es:
Julián es un hombre casado que tiene 26 años y vive en el municipio de Sonsón. Junto a su amada esposa tienen un pequeño hijo de tan solo 3 años, quien se ha convertido en el motor e impulso de la vida de estos padres. Este hombre siempre se ha destacado por su responsabilidad y entrega a su familia tanto así que comenzó su propio negocio con el fin de tener un mejor sustento y ser independiente para tener tiempo que dedicarle a su familia. 

Este padre comprometido comenzó hace poco un negocio de cría de ganado, terneras para ser más específico, algo que aprendió a hacer gracias a su padre y con el que espera obtener grandes ganancias. Su principal objetivo es que su negocio sea sostenible de manera que proveer a su familia nunca sea un problema. El pide un préstamo para comprar 4 terneras de levante. 

Como para Julián lo más importante en su vida es su familia, en especial su pequeño hijo, espera con el negocio poder brindarle una educación de calidad que le permita ser un gran hombre el día de mañana. Ayuda a este padre y esposo a hacer sus sueños realidad y brindar una gran vida a toda su familia, done ahora.
texts.en:
Julián is married, 26 years old, and lives in the municipality of Sonsón. He and his beloved wife have a young son who is just 3 years old, and who has become his parents’ reason for living. Julián has always been exceptionally responsible and dedicated to his family. So much so that he started his own business with the goal of being able to provide a better living and being independent so he could have time to dedicate to his family.

This dedicated father began, a short while ago, a business raising cattle - heifers, to be more specific. He learned this business thanks to his father, and hopes to make good money from it. His main goal is for his business to be sustainable, such that providing for his family will never be a problem. He is requesting a loan to buy 4 young heifers.

Since the most important thing in life for Julián is his family, especially his young son, he hopes with his business he will be able to provide his son a good education so he can be a great man in the future. Help this father and husband make his dreams a reality so he can provide a great life to his family. Donate now.

loans.use: to buy 4 young heifers.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ayuba has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Ayuba is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Andriantsilavo

texts.fr:
Andriantsilavo est un artiste talentueux de 49 ans. Il est marié et père de quatre enfants de 11 à 21 ans. Ces derniers sont tous scolarisés et sa femme exerce une activité de vente de sables.
Il est peintre depuis 1991. Il a beaucoup de commande actuellement et son problème est la hausse des prix des matériels nécessaires pour la production et ceci a un impact négatif sur le bénéfice. Le prêt va lui permettre d'acheter différents types et sortes d'huiles (peintures) pour que ses tableaux puissent afficher et éditer sa spécificité et sa personnalité. Son souhait est d'avoir une gallérie un jour
texts.en:
Andriantsilavo is a talented artist.  He is 49, married, and the father of four children between the ages of 11 and 21.  All his children go to school. His wife sells sand.

Andriantsilavo has been a painter since 1991 and he has received many orders recently.  However, the price of painting supplies has increased, which constitutes a major hurdle and negatively impacts his profits.  Thanks to his loan, Andriantsilavo will be able to buy various types of oil paints, which will allow him to show his specificity and his personality.  His dream is to have his own gallery one day.

loans.use: to buy oil paints, canvases and frames.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 40-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and five kids in a simple house. Sami works as an employee in a local company, where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. He would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Sami took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water-purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Sami will be able to provide clean water, especially for his kids.
Sami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water-purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Maicol

texts.es:
Él es Maicol, es un hombre de 29 años de edad que se encuentra sin empleo, es una persona responsable, respetuosa, honesta, entregado en cuerpo y alma a su familia, tiene un pequeña de 4 años de edad que es la luz de sus ojos, esa niña significa todo para él, y es ella la razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un préstamo, pues quiere iniciar un negocio de tienda de productos de la canasta familiar, para generar el capital suficiente para forjar un futuro para su muñeca.
El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de un enfriador, mostrador, estantería, y surtido en general de víveres, abarrotes, productos de refrigeración, refrescos, snacks, etc.
texts.en:
Maicol is 29 years old and unemployed. He is responsible, respectful, honest, and very devoted to his family. He has a 4-year-old daughter who lights up his life. She means the world to him and he is requesting a loan to support her. He wants to start a grocery store to generate enough capital to build a future for his daughter.

The loan will be used to purchase a cooler, counter, shelves, and assorted general food, grocery, refrigerated products, soft drinks, snacks, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a cooler, counter, shelves, and assorted general food, grocery, refrigerated products, soft drinks, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 27 years old. He lives in Gaza with his small family. One year ago he started his business. He has a poultry farm; it’s a good business, but still needs a lot of improvement.

He applied for this youth loan to buy some feed and chicks per customers' requests, which will increase his income, helping him to improve the financial conditions for his family.

Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy some feed and chicks per customers' requests.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a maize farmer from Dankwaire village. As a Babban Gona member, Hassan is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Hassan would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Hassan can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Hassan no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Hassan hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alh. Shehu

texts.en:

Before joining Babban Gona, Alh. Shehu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Shehu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alh. Shehu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Alh. Shehu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr:
La famille d’Émilienne vit à la campagne. C'est une femme dynamique et travailleuse de 44 ans. Elle exerce avec son mari beaucoup d'activités génératrice de revenu surtout dans le secteur agriculture. La raison est de pouvoir offrir à sa famille une meilleure condition de vie. Parmi celles-ci est l'élevage de poulet de chair, activité objet de sa demande de crédit, celle-ci est la plus récente, commencée en mai 2014, donc encore besoin de développement. Elle démarrait avec 15 têtes de poussins chair et l'exploitation ne cesse pas de développer durant jusqu'à maintenant.
L'époux travaille aussi en tant qu'agent de sécurité chez un particulier étranger. Le couple a deux enfants de 10 et 15 ans et ils sont tous scolarisés.
texts.en: Émilienne is a 44-year-old dynamic and hardworking woman who lives in the countryside with her family.  In order to improve their family's living conditions she and her husband are involved in various income-generating activities, especially in the field of agriculture. One of their businesses is poultry (broiler) farming.  It is to boost this particular activity that Émilienne is taking a loan.  Started in May 2014, poultry farming is her most recent activity and it still needs to be developed.  Started with 15 young chicken, Émilienne's poultry farming business has never stopped growing.  Émilienne's husband also works as a security guard for a foreign individual.  The couple has two children, ages 10 and 15, who both attend school.

loans.use: to buy young broiler chickens and poultry fodder.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
María tiene 50 años y vive en el municipio del Santuario. Es madre soltera de un hijo ya adulto al que crio con amor y mucha entrega, algo que hoy agradece y por lo cual admira enormemente a su madre. En el año 2000, por necesidad económica, María decidió comenzar su propio negocio, empezó a vender comida con el fin de tener una mejor calidad de vida. 

Aunque no ha sido fácil ella siempre se ha destacado por ser una ardua trabajadora siempre con las ganas de salir adelante. Ahora quiere llevar su negocio a otro nivel, lamentablemente no cuenta con el capital que requiere para invertir en su negocio, y además a su edad nunca ha tenido un préstamo por lo que resulta dificultoso acceder a la banca tradicional.

Hoy encuentra en Kiva e Interactuar la oportunidad de acceder a un préstamo que le permita comprar una freidora y materia prima para la elaboración de sus alimentos. Confía en que esta inversión le ayude a aumentar sus clientes, a consolidar su negocio para así algún día poder dejárselo a su hijo. Ayude a María con un préstamo para que su sueño pueda convertirse en realidad.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old and lives in the town of Santuario. She is a single mother of an adult son, who grew up with love and great dedication, something that he is grateful for today and for which he greatly admires his mother. 

In 2000, out of economic necessity, María decided to start her own business. She began selling food in order to have a better quality of life. Though it has not always been easy, she has always stood out for being a strong worker with the desire to succeed. Now, she would like to take her business to the next level. Unfortunately she does not have the capital that she needs to invest in her business. Additionally, at her age she has never had a loan, which makes it difficult to access a traditional bank.

Today she found through Kiva and Field Partner Interactuar the opportunity to access a loan, which will allow her to purchase a deep fryer and raw materials to cook her food. She is confident that this investment will help her to crow her clientele and consolidate her business so that one day she can leave it for her son. Help María with a loan, so that her dream can become reality.

loans.use: to buy a deep fryer and raw materials to cook meals.

loans.name: Yadira De Jesus

texts.es:
Yadira es una mujer de 32 años de edad a la cual se le están brindo las puertas del progreso, ella siempre se tenía que conformar con un trabajo temporal debido a que tenía la responsabilidad de mantener a sus hijos, pero gracias a Interactuar y sus ganas de progresar está a punto de montar un negocio que será venta de panes.
Por ello con mucho entusiasmo, alegría y algo de incertidumbre por el que parará, solicita un préstamo para montar una panadería inicialmente en su hogar, con el dinero comprara una vitrina, horno, batidora, sillas, mesas.
Para ella será un gran impulso pues junto con su esposo quieren comprar casa y progresar juntos.
texts.en:
Yadira is 32 years old and has been presented with the opportunities to progress. She always had to work with a temporary job because she had the responsibility to take care of her children. However, thanks to Interactuar and her desire to progress, she is about to start a bakery.

With enthusiasm, joy and some uncertainty, she requests a loan to set up a bakery, initially at home. She will buy a cabinet, oven, blender, chairs, and tables.

It will be a big boost because she want to buy a house with her husband and move forward together.

loans.use: to buy a cabinet, oven, blender, chairs, and tables to start a bakery.

loans.name: Elsy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Buscando la sostenibilidad de su negocio, ser una tendera competitiva y no dejarse vencer ni destruir por las grandes cadenas de mercado, la señora Elsy quiere solicitar un préstamo para aumentar la cantidad de inventario y la diversidad de marcar de su tienda de abarrotes.
Ella es una madre de 36 años de edad que ama su trabajo, quiere decir a las grandes cadenas de mercado, estoy presente y el barrio la necesita.
EL dinero del préstamo será para la compra de víveres, abarrotes, legumbres y un enfriador para exhibir mayor cantidad de productos de refrigeración.
texts.en:
In pursuit of making her business more sustainable, being a competitive shopkeeper, and not allowing herself to be overcome or destroyed by big chain stores, Elsy wants to request a loan in order to augment the quantity and variety of inventory of her grocery store.

She is a 36 year-old mother who loves her work. She wants to say to the big chains in the market that she is here and the neighborhood needs her.

The money from the loan will be for foodstuffs, groceries, legumes, and a cooler in order to exhibit a greater variety of refrigerated goods.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs, groceries, legumes, and a cooler in order to display a greater quantity of refrigerated products.

loans.name: Norma Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Norma labora en su puesto de ventas ubicado en su propia vivienda, en el cual comercializa diversos productos, entre esos, productos alimenticios, de uso personal y de limpieza. Con el propósito de aumentar su volumen de existencias  solicita un préstamo de un millón treinta y cinco mil colones( ₡ 1 035 000), esto le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Norma works in a store located in her own home. She sells various products such as food, personal and cleaning products.

In order to increase the stock, she requests a loan of one million thirty five thousand colones (₡ 1,035,000). This will allow the family income to increase.

loans.use: to buy food, personal and cleaning products to sell.

loans.name: Takeshi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TAKESHI” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Celia la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de manteles, venta de tostados, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de frazadas.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Celia es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá y decide emprender su propio negocio hace varios años.  

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de fideo y arroz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración,  lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Takeshi communal bank will begin its seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II bank branch. This group is made up of ten members and is lead by a board of directors, of which Celia is President. The members of this communal bank run a variety of businesses, among which are: tablecloth sales, sandwich sales, food sales, blanket sales, and a neighborhood store. The loan they receive will benefit small business owners, including Celia, who has been a member of Pro Mujer for five years. She joined at the invitation of a friend, who is also a client of the institution. 
Currently, Celia has a business selling food. She says that she learned this business from her mom and decided to open her own business a number of years ago. 
The loan she is taking out now will be to increase her capital (to purchase pasta and rice in bulk) which she will acquire from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto. Afterwards she prepares and sells these items from her place of business. This type of work enables Celia to generate resources to support her family economically. She is married and has four children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health services and the trainings which the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase pasta and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Judith Tivisay

texts.es:
Judith tiene 38 años y vive en la ciudad de Montería. Es madre soltera de dos hijos, una hermosa hija de tan solo 3 años y un hijo de 9. El amor por su familia no tiene límites y la ha impulsado a buscar el éxito siempre con el fin de ser un ejemplo a seguir para sus hijos. Hace 6 años tomó la decisión de comenzar su propio negocio de comidas, el cual le ha permitido sostener su familia. 

Su expareja le enseñó sobre cocina y luego de terminar esa relación, por las necesidades económicas que tenía decidió comenzar este sueño que se materializó y hoy día le brinda grandes alegrías. Ella quiere para su negocio grandes cosas, quiere atraer nuevos clientes y mejorar su local. Pide un préstamo para poder realizar las adecuaciones locativas que su cocina necesita para brindar un mejor servicio. 

Judith tiene grandes sueños, entre ellos el de poder brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad que los haga mejor como personas y los impulsen a buscar el éxito. Ayuda a esta mujer responsable y trabajadora a cumplir sus sueños y ayudar a su familia, un préstamo la llevará muy cerca de lograrlo.
texts.en:
Judith is 38 years old and lives in the city of Montería. She is a single mother of two children--a beautiful daughter of just 3 years and a 9-year-old son. Her love for her family has no limits and it has propelled her to seek success, always with the aim of being an example for her children to follow. Six years ago, she made the decision to begin her own food business, which has allowed her to support her family.

Her ex-partner taught her about cooking. After ending that relationship, she decided to begin this dream due to the economic necessities she had. It materialized, and today it gives her great happiness. She wants great things for her business. She wants to attract new clients and improve her store. She requests a loan to be able to make upgrades that her kitchen needs in order to offer a better service.

Judith has big dreams, among them: being able to offer her children a quality education which may make them better as people and may propel them to search for success. Please help this responsible, hard-working woman to fulfill her dreams and help her family. A loan would bring her very close to achieving it.

loans.use: to make upgrades that her kitchen needs in order to provide better service.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Sunday has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sunday would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sunday can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Sunday will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Sunday is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ezekiel is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Ezekiel would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Ezekiel will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season, when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Ezekiel now has the opportunity to realize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She owns a repair shop, offering services to repair computers and household appliances. Aside from that, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic household commodities ranging from edible oil, sugar, assorted canned goods, seasonings, noodles, coffee, soft drinks and toiletries. She is 58-year-old married woman and has six grown children.

She would like to improve her livelihood by acquiring additional funds to finance her current sources of living. She has requested a loan to buy tools and stocks for the store. These could help boost her income and continue to help her to become more productive. Thus, she could able to pay her obligation and set aside some of the profits for expansion.

Felicidad was able to repay her previous loan back in full. Now she is requesting a new loan to continue to improve both of her sources of income.

loans.use: to buy tools and stocks for the store

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 32 years old and married with one child who is in school. Christine works very hard to provide for them.

Christine has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Christine has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack food and other groceries.

In the future, Christine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Samaila

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer from Galadima Mayau village. As a member of Babban Gona, Yahaya is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Yahaya is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family, and in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

texts.en:
