loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ma. Kristelle

texts.en: To earn a living, Ma. Kristelle and her husband are operating a motorcycle known as a “habal-habal” (a motorcycle with extended seat) in the local area. They have been doing this business for a year to earn a living. In addition to this, Ma. Kristelle  also sells food to the community. She and her husband work together to provide for the needs of their family. Definitely, Ma. Kristelle is asking for a loan for motorcycle maintenance. She will also buy food ingredients such as vegetables, meat, fish, cooking oil and spices. Additionally, she is a mother of three children and she wishes to improve her business in the future to give a good life to their family.

loans.use: pay for motorcycle maintenance and buy food ingredients such as vegetables, meat, fish, cooking oil and spices.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 57 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Fe has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ma.Fe requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Peter is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Peter would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Peter can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Peter has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Peter is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having had no money to increase his farmland and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie works hard to support three children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Elvie requested a PHP 6,750 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Elvie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase solar lamp

loans.name: Endrizeta

texts.en:
Endrizeta is a 58-year-old married woman with twelve children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Endrizeta has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Endrizeta requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell to her local market.

Endrizeta has been in this business for nine years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell to her local market

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Erlinda is 56 years old and has one child still in school.

Erlinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo and other materials for her fishing business.

Erlinda has been in this business for four years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo and other materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Karla Johanna

texts.es: Karla   tiene la edad de 23 años, está en unión libre   y vive con  el esposo y dos   hijos   actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de un novillo    .Ella  espera poder engordar el novillo y vender con el peso adecuado  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Karla is 23 years old. She is in a domestic partnership and she currently lives with her husband and two children. 
She wants the loan to purchase a steer. She hopes to fatten the animal until it is a good weight to earn a greater price.  
In the future, Karla hopes to offer her family a better quality of life and better economic stability, and to continue growing. 
This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. Karla has not had any loans in the past from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase a steer.

loans.name: Fe Maura

texts.en:
Fe Maura is a hard-working entrepreneur with one child.

She sells personal care products in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy body lotion, perfumes and other personal care products to resell.

She successfully paid back a previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business in order to ensure the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy body lotion, perfumes, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer from Kanakargo village. As a Babban Gona member, Haruna is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Haruna can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Haruna no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Haruna hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Arelis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Arelis tiene 33 años y es una mujer que vive feliz junto a su esposo y 5 hermosas hijas. Vive con su familia en el municipio de Tierralta, lugar donde ha visto crecer a sus hijas y donde ha visto como muchos de sus sueños se hacen realidad. 20 años atrás, con su esposo, decidió comenzar un negocio, el cultivo de distintos productos que luego comercializan.

Este negocio que con mucho trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante le ha permitido brindar soporte a su familia, lamentablemente, la falta de capital no le ha permitido impulsarlo para llevarlo al siguiente nivel. Esta madre quiere ver su negocio ser sostenible, pretende diversificar su oferta y ampliar su cultivo, motivo por el cual necesita un préstamo que le permita comprar insumos agropecuarios y una fumigadora que le permita mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos.

Arelis sueña en grande, y el amor a su familia le ha permitido creer que esos sueños, pueden y deben hacerse realidad, motivo por el cual trabaja arduamente para lograrlos. Desea poder pagar por una excelente educación para sus hijas y mejorar las condiciones de su hogar. En sus manos está ayudar a que esta mujer impulse su negocio y se acerque a cumplir sus sueños, realice un préstamo ahora.
texts.en:
Arelis is a 33 year-old woman who lives happily with her husband and five beautiful daughters. She lives with her family in the municipality of Tierralta, a place where she has seen her daughters grow and where she has seen many of her dreams become reality. Twenty years ago she decided to start a business with her husband growing various products that they then bring to market.

This business, which she has been able to move forward with a lot of work, has allowed her to support her family. Unfortunately, the lack of capital has not permitted her to bring her business to the next level.

This mother wants to make her business sustainable. She is trying to diversify her offerings and increase her cultivation. This is the reason she needs a loan that will allow her to purchase agricultural supplies and a fumigator, which will help her improve the quality of her crops.

Arelis dreams big and her love for her family has enabled her to believe in those dreams; they can and must become reality, and this motivates her to work hard to achieve them.

She wants to be able to pay for an excellent education for her daughters and to improve the condition of her home. In your hands is the chance to help this woman advance her business and get closer to her dreams- please give a loan now.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and a fumigator, which will allow her to improve the quality of her crops.

As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jaafaru

texts.en:
Jaafaru is a maize farmer from Gargari village. As a member of Babban Gona, Jaafaru is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Jaafaru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Jaafaru can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Jaafaru is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mardy

texts.en:
Mardy is a 47-year-old woman from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is married and has three children, ages 17, 14 and 12 years old. Her husband works hard as a farmer while Mardy operates a sari-sari store (general store) business where she sells a variety of goods.

Mardy describes her biggest business challenge as having insufficient capital. This is the reason why she is asking for a bigger loan amount. She will buy grocery items such as sugar, salt, flour, eggs, spices, noodles, canned goods, toiletries, chips, biscuits and candies. Mardy’s main goal in life is to augment their livelihood for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, flour, eggs, spices, noodles, canned goods, toiletries, chips, biscuits and candies

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer from Kanakargo village. As a Babban Gona member, Iliya is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Iliya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Iliya can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Iliya no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Iliya hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana tiene 26 años y vive en el municipio de Momil. Tiene 4 hijos, 3 hombres de 10, 3 y un pequeño bebé de tan solo 1 año, además tiene una hija que tiene 7 años. Estos 4 chicos son el motor de vida de Ana, quien se siente agradecida de su hermosa familia. Lamentablemente esta mujer fue víctima de la guerra en Colombia, y hoy intenta renacer después del conflicto.

Hace 7 años, Ana comenzó a criar cerdos con el fin de comercializarlos para así mejorar la situación económica de su hogar. Este negocio lo heredó de sus padres y con el pretende sacar a su familia adelante. La falta de capital la ha llevado a buscar ayuda, y hoy encuentra la posibilidad con Kiva e Interactuar. Pide un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, alimento, vacunas y vitaminas para sus animales. 

Ana quiere ver su negocio triunfar, y está dispuesta a trabajar lo que sea necesario para lograrlo, para que su familia viva mejor. Sueña con la posibilidad de mejorar su casa para que todos vivan felices. Ayuda a Ana con el préstamo que necesita, para impulsar su negocio y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 26 years old and lives in Momil. She has 4 children, 3 boys aged 10, 3, and a baby who is only 1, as well as a daughter who is 7. These 4 kids are the engine of Ana's life, who feels very grateful to her loving family. Lamentably this woman was a victim of the war in Columbia, and today she is trying to be reborn after the conflict. Seven years ago Ana began raising pigs for commercial ends and was able to improve the economic situation of her household. She inherited this business from her parents and with it intends to get her family ahead.

The lack of capital has caused her to seek assistance, and today discovered the opportunity with Kiva and Interactuar. She requests a loan for the purchase of pigs, feed, vaccines, and vitamins for the animals. Ana wants to see her business triumph, and is ready to work to do what is necessary to achieve this, for her family to live better. She dreams of the possibility of improving her home so that everyone will live happily. Help Ana with the loans she needs, to grow her business and help her family.

loans.use: purchase pigs, feed, vaccines, and vitamins for the animals.

loans.name: Lisa's Group

texts.en:
When her hands move on the embroidery hoop, one can hardly make out what is happening there. But once she is finished and puts it down, you can see the magic that is woven on the cloth. And with 10 years of experience on the job, no design is too difficult for Lisa. Lisa, standing on the extreme right in the photograph, is a 32-year-old widow from a rural village in Koraput district, Odisha, India.

What has kept her in business all these years is her ability to gauge the requirements of the market. She knows what her customers want and she gives it to them. It all started when Lisa decided to turn her hobby into her business. It has come a long way since then. Now she is confident of her business and wants to grow it.

Lisa, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy the required tools and materials for her embroidery such as different needles and threads as well as blocks for printing. Can you help this talented woman?

loans.use: to buy the required tools and materials for her embroidery such as different needles and threads as well as blocks for printing.

loans.name: Bina's Group

texts.en:
Bina, standing in the middle in the photograph, is a divorcee and is a blessed mother of two daughters. She is a resident of a small village in Koraput district, Odisha, India. Ten years ago when Bina started working on her farm planting vegetables, she never thought that one day she would be forced to work on fields of other wealthy farmers too. With the income from her own field inadequate to finance her children’s education, she started working in other’s fields to ensure that her children spent their time learning in school rather than ploughing the fields with their parent.

However, now Bina has decided to take the matter into her own hands and started vegetable farming on her own field. Therefore, she along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. The loan amount would not only eliminate her dependence on income from working in other’s fields, but also enhance her income in totality. All she needs now is money to invest in buying fertilizers and disease-resistant seeds.

loans.use: to invest in buying fertilizers and disease-resistant seeds.

loans.name: Naragis's Group

texts.en:
Naragis, standing in the middle in the photograph, is a farmer by profession who lives in a small rural village in the Koraput district in Odisha, India. She is unmarried and lives with her father in a thatched house. Naragis is 10th pass (finished her final year in high school) and pursues vegetable farming as a primary business to earn a livelihood for herself. She produces quality products so that the vegetables stand a good potential in the market.

Lately, Naragis is facing a challenge to increase the volume of vegetable production due to the lack of finances. She, along with her other group members, has applied for a loan of 36,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount for purchasing saplings, fertilizers, weedicide and land preparation, etc.

With this loan, she aims to grow different vegetables every month so that she can harvest one crop each month and make money to sustain herself. Your contribution can help Naragis live a life she deserves.

loans.use: to purchase saplings, fertilizers, weedicide and land preparation

loans.name: Geline

texts.en:
Geline is a widowed woman. She is 40 years old with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Geline has a fishing business in the Philippines. Geline requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Geline has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 56 years old and married with two children. One child is still in school. Mila works very hard to provide for them.

Mila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, eggs and other snack foods to sell.

Mila has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future Mila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, eggs and other snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Nisikrit's Group

texts.en:
Nisikrit, 35, standing on the extreme right in the photograph hailing from Semliguda, Odisha, India, is a woman with strong convictions who firmly believes in financial independence and the perseverance to do something. She draws her support from her family: her two children. Her daughter, 17, and son, 16, are in high school. Nisikrit is a single mother and takes care of her children single handedly.

Nisikrit is determined to contribute her share so that she can improve her financial conditions and provide a bright future for the children. Accordingly, she plans to put her experience in tailoring to best use and start her own tailoring business. But, what she lacks is the equipment and the finances to start a full-fledged tailoring business. Without much waste of time, she along with her group members, have approached Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to borrow a loan of 36,000 INR. She plans to use her portion of the loan amount to buy a sewing machine with a stand and motor and other tailoring materials to increase the productivity of her new venture.

Nisikrit is eagerly awaiting for your kind help and support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine with a stand and motor and other tailoring materials to increase the productivity of her new venture.

loans.name: Ma. Darin

texts.en:
Ma. Darin is a married woman. She is 46 years old.

Ma. Darin has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ma. Darin requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials such as fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Ma. Darin has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Kasmati's Group

texts.en:
Kasmati is a differently abled lady standing in the middle in the photograph. She hails from a humble background in Koraput district, Odisha, India. She has a family of four and his husband works as a carpenter in a nearby shop. Kasmati is engaged in making beautiful embroidery work in tablecloths, cushion covers and bed sheets. She has inherited this art form from her ancestors. After completing her household chores, she devotes five hours daily in order to embroider these cloth pieces. She enjoys doing embroidery work and bringing smiles to her customers' faces.

Kasmati, along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR to Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase raw materials for her business like beads, threads, glitter, colorful ribbons, buttons and colored fabrics in bulk. The loan amount will ultimately help Kasmati in serving her large customer base and increase her earnings so that she can help her husband in meeting daily expenses and save a certain amount of money for her children's bright future.

Kasmati is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her business like beads, threads, glitter, colorful ribbons, buttons and colored fabrics in bulk.

loans.name: Sabita's Group

texts.en:
Sabita, standing in the middle in the photograph, has an obsession for cleanliness. It's a good habit made interesting by the fact that this Semliguda resident is the proud owner of a broom business. Wife of a daily wage labourer and mother of two sons, Sabita has been in business for the last four years. However, the scarcity of resources has made the business challenging from time to time. Sabita's bigger challenge is her lack of personal finances to expand her business and increase her profits.

She, along with her group members, has applied for a loan of 36,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount in order to by raw materials in bulk quantities, as well as tools like foot-held apparatus, knives, scissors, scales, and needles. These tools will help Sabita boost her production and she will be able to raise bigger profits and establish her business in the local markets firmly.

Sabita is eagerly awaiting for your kind hearts to help her.

loans.use: to buy raw materials in bulk quantities, as well as tools like foot-held apparatus, knives, scissors, scales, and needles.

loans.name: Wenchie

texts.en:
Wenchie is a hardworking woman-entrepreneur with two children.

She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines and requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional clothing to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Wenchie dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Roselyn is 25 years old and has two children who are in school.

Roselyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Roselyn has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aida is 45 years old and five of her children are in school.

Aida has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Aida has been in this business for six years. In the future, Aida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Herminia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Herminia is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like milk, sugar and other materials for her food production business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like milk, sugar and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 34 years old and has five children. Geraldine is married and has three children who are in school.

Geraldine is in the agricultural business of raising livestock in the Philippines. Geraldine requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Geraldine has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Geraldine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Rialyn

texts.en:
Rialyn works hard to support her family. Rialyn is single with two children and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Rialyn requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Rialyn has been in this business for 3 years now and also earns additional income from pig-fattening.

In the future, Rialyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rhodora is 55 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rhodora has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. Rhodora requested a loan of 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Rhodora has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rhodora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cristina is 31 years old and all her children are enrolled in school.

Cristina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Cristina has been in this business for six years. In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Lalao Marcelline

texts.fr:
39 ans, mariée à un chauffeur fonctionnaire de 48 ans, Marcelline est marchande de charbon de bois il y a maintenant 11 ans. En fait elle a beaucoup d'année d'expérience dans ce domaine, elle maîtrise parfaitement le métier. Elle connait beaucoup de fournisseurs donc elle n'a pas de difficulté à trouver des marchandises pendant la saison de pluies. Le prêt va lui permettre donc de mieux ravitailler ses stocks en ce début d'été pour éviter la pénurie pendant ladite saison de pluies.
Le couple a cinq enfants les deux premiers travaillent déjà, ils ont 20 et 23 ans et les trois autres sont encore scolarisés, ils ont12,14, et 17 ans
L'objectif du couple est la réussite de ses enfants dans leurs études et la vie même, construire des maisons et devenir grossiste dans le commerce de charbon de bois
texts.en:
Marcelline is 39 years old and is married to a 48-year-old driver for the local government. She has been selling charcoal for 11 years. She has a lot of experience in this area and masters her trade. She knows a number of suppliers so she doesn't have problems acquiring goods during the rainy season. This loan will allow her to do a better job of replenishing her stock at the beginning of the summer to avoid shortages during the rainy season. 

The couple has five children. Their two oldest children are 20 and 23 and are already working. Their three other children are still in school. They are 12,14, and 17.

The couple's goal is for their children to succeed in school and life. They also want to construct homes and become charcoal wholesalers.

loans.use: buy charcoal.

loans.name: Hadakatia's Group

texts.en:
Spring cleaning is tedious business, but a good broom can make things easier. Hadakatia, a broom maker living in the Semliguda village in Odisha, India, would attest to that fact. She has been engaged in making brooms and baskets for the last four years, using a part of her home to run the business. Her family consists of her husband and son who are both day wage labourers. Hadakatia is a differetly abled lady standing on the extreme left in the photograph in a green saree.

Hadakatia's impeccably-woven and stitched products find many takers in the local markets and she manages to make a neat profit. However, expansion of the business remains a challenge. Raw materials are scarce and she lacks the resources to buy them in bulk when available.
Therefore, she along with her group members, have applied for a loan of 36,000 INR. Hadakatia will use her portion of the loan amount in order to purchase a larger consignment of raw materials along with other tools.

With financial assistance, Hadakatia can pave the path for her business to flourish. Hadakatia is eagerly awaiting for your kind hearts to help her.

loans.use: to purchase a larger consignment of raw materials along with other tools.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, tooth paste, fabric conditioner and a variety of canned goods.

She is a 38-year-old married woman with three children ages 11, 9 and 8. Her husband earns a living by means of fishing. He catches and sells fish to support the needs of his family.

She has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for many years now. She would like to improve the inventory of merchandise to attract potential buyers.

She joined CEVI to access loans and wants to buy assorted groceries, soft drinks and hard drinks. In that way, she will be able to do bulk purchases and fill her store with a variety of goods. Thus, it will enable her to provide her family with proper diets and better shelter to live .

Rosemarie is determined that she can make her business more productive to improve the living condition of her family and also support the education of all her children.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries, soft drinks and hard drinks

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en:
Stephanie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Stephanie is 30 years old and both of her children are still in school.

Stephanie has a buy and sell of used clothes business in the Philippines. Stephanie requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of used clothes like shorts, blouses, bed sheets, etc to sell.

Stephanie has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of used clothes like shorts, blouses, and bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Almarie

texts.en:
Almarie is 21 years old and single with two children. Almarie works very hard to provide for them.

Almarie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy a sack of rice, personal care products, and other groceries..

Almarie has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Almarie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Charline

texts.fr:
Charline a 37 ans. Elle est mariée. Son mari l’appuie dans cette activité. Le couple a cinq enfants dont deux suivent encore leurs études, les trois autres sont déjà à la recherche d’emplois pour compléter le revenu familial. 
Charline vend des vêtements fripes. Cette activité est la principale source de revenus du ménage. Le lieu de vente (le marché) se situe à une dizaine de kilomètres de leur maison, le couple vend les produits chaque jour au marché. Charline dispose suffisamment d’expériences  dans l’activité car elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2012. Elle est actuellement à son deuxième prêt pour la développer. Cette activité dépend de la qualité et de la diversification des vêtements offerts aux clients. Elle sait bien choisir les produits répondant aux besoins des cibles. 
Le rêve du couple est de pouvoir vivre dans des conditions meilleurs qu’actuellement : construire une maison afin d’éviter de payer un loyer.
texts.en:
Charline is 37 years old and married. Her husband supports her with her business. The couple has five children, two of whom still go to school. Their three other children are looking for work to contribute to the household.

Charline sells used clothing, and this is the household's primary source of revenue. They sell every day in the market, which is a dozen kilometers from their house. Charline has sufficient experience as she has been working in this domain since 2012.

This is her second loan. Her business depends on the quality and choice of clothing she offers to her clients. She knows how to choose products that respond to the needs of her target market.

The couple's dream is to improve their living conditions and to build a house so they don't have to pay rent.

loans.use: buy two bales of dresses and one bale of capri pants.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maxima is 52 years old and two of her children are in school.

Maxima has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Maxima has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Maxima would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es:
Carlos tiene tan solo 20 años y vive en el municipio de Momil en la costa colombiana. A su corta edad tiene claro lo que quiere en la vida, y está dispuesto a trabajar duro para lograr todos sus sueños. Hace poco heredó el negocio de su familia, una tienda donde ofrecen todo tipo de productos y cuya labor aprendió gracias a su padre. 

Ahora que el negocio le pertenece considera que lo más importante es hacerlo sostenible para poder seguir contribuyendo en su familia, pero además sabe que quiere impulsarlo para siempre mejorar, y es consiente que para esto debe invertir en él, lamentablemente no tiene historial crediticio pero hoy gracias a Kiva y a Interactuar puede acceder a un préstamo con el cual pretende comprar cervezas, maíz y un enfriador con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su tienda.

Carlos a su corta edad sueña con tener una gran calidad de vida, pero no solo para él, sino para toda su familia, con el fin de agradecerle a su familia todo lo que le ha brindado. Ayuda a Carlos a cumplir todos sus sueños, un préstamo que le cambiará la vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is only 20 years old and lives in the municipality of Momil on the Colombian coast. Despite his young age he knows exactly what he wants in life and is willing to work hard to meet his goals. Recently he inherited the family business which is a store where he sells all kinds of products. He learned the trade from his father.

Now that he owns the business what is most important to him is to make it sustainable so he can continue supporting his family. He also wants to keep up the improvements and is conscious that he must invest in the store to do this. Unfortunately he has no credit record at all but thanks to Kiva and Interactuar he now can have access to a loan to buy beers, corn and a cooler in an effort to improve the store's conditions.

Carlos is a young man who dreams of having a better quality of life, not only for himself but for all his family to thank them for everything they do for him. Please help Carlos realize his dreams with a loan that will change his life.

loans.use: to buy beers, corn and a cooler to improve the conditions of his store.

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr: Georgette est une femme mariée dynamique qui vit à Agoè avec ses six enfants à charge. Georgette est âgée de 46 ans et  s’active parfaitement  pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Georgette est une revendeuse de pagnes qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Georgette sollicite ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes afin de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Georgette is a dynamic woman who lives in Agoè with her six dependent children. Georgette is 46 years old and works hard to achieve a good financial situation.

Georgette resells pagnes (traditional wrap arounds) and buys her supplies three times a month in the market. She sells her goods by walking through the neighboring areas.

In order to achieve her goals, Georgette is asking for a loan to buy pagnes to respond to the needs of her clients. She wants to achieve financial independence, so that she can help her children with their education.

loans.use: buy nine pagnes.

loans.name: Nelys Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nelys tiene 39 años y vive en la ciudad de Montería. Es una madre de soltera de 5 hijos, y que a pesar de las dificultades ha logrado ser una madre responsable y amorosa para educar sus hijos de la mejor manera quienes se sienten muy orgullosos de su madre. 5 años atrás Nelys comenzó un negocio de elaboración de productos a base de leche, lo que le ha permitido sostener a su familia. 

La necesidad económica y su gran familia la impulsó a perseguir este sueño que hace muchos tenía y que logró con arduo trabajo. Lamentablemente no tiene el capital que necesita para invertir en su negocio para lograr mejorar su local, algo que ha querido hacer por un largo tiempo, y que hoy puede ser una realidad. Necesita un préstamo que le permita comprar utensilios y leche para realizar su producción y aumentar su oferta. 

Nelys sueña con mejorar las condiciones de su hogar para que su familia pueda vivir en un lugar más cómodo y del que se sientan orgullosos. Usted puede ser parte de esta historia, un préstamo de seguro ayudará a Nelys a mejorar su calidad de vida a través de su negocio.
texts.en:
Nelys is 39 years old and she lives in the city of Montería. She is a single mother with 5 children. Despite the difficulties, she has managed to be a responsible and loving mother and to educate her children in the best possible way, who feel proud of her mother. Nelys started a business to produce dairy based products five years ago, which has allowed her to support her family.

Financial needs and her large family pushed her to chase this dream, which she had for long, and which she achieved with great effort. Sadly, she does not have the capital needed to invest in her business to be able to improve her premises, which is something she has been willing to do for a long time, and which could be made true today. She needs a loan to buy tools and milk to make her products and increase her offer.

Nelys dreams to improve her household conditions so that her family can live in a more confortable place which they can be proud of. You could be part of this story, a loan will help Nelys to improve her quality of life through her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and milk to make her products and increase her offer.

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.ru: Зайнура  милая, общительная девушка в возрасте 23 года. Она разведена и  не имеет детей. Зайнура живет вместе со своей мамой и братиком. Её отец уехал в Россию на заработки.  После развода она долгое время не смогла приходить в себя, она долгое время мучилась, но заботливая мама всегда поддержала её во всём и старалась чтобы она забыла про свою прошлую жизнь. Сейчас  Зайнура вместе с мамой работает на рынке. Она занимается куплей продажей овощей.  Раним утром они идут на рынок  чтобы торговать и заработать  хоть немного денег на жизнь. Чтобы улучшить свой бизнес она решила расширить его. Но достаточного количество денег у неё нету, деньги которые присылает ее отец ушли на учёбу братика поэтому она обратилась в Арванд за кредитом для расширения своего бизнеса.  Заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку!!!
texts.en:
Zaynura is a sweet, sociable young lady 23 years of age. She is divorced and has no children. Zaynura lives with her mother and younger brother. Her father works in Russia. After her divorce, for a long time she was unable to come to her senses, she agonised for a long time, but her caring mother always supported her in everything, and tried to help her forget about her past. 

Now Zaynura and her mother work at the market. She buys and sells vegetables. Early in the morning they go to the market to trade and earn at least a bit of money to survive. In order to improve their business, she has decided to expand it. But she does not have a sufficient amount of money, and the money which her father sends goes into paying for her brother's studies. Thus, she has applied to Arvand for a loan in order to expand her business. She thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигина жительница прекрасного города под названием Душанбе. Душанбе столица Республики Таджикистан. Город Душанбе большой и красивый. Жители города образованные, умные, честные, трудолюбивые и гостеприимные.  Нигина родилась и выросла в городе Душанбе. Ей 44 года. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. У нее один сын в возрасте 29 лет. Дочка в возрасте 21 лет. Нигина образованная женщина, у нее высшая образования. Ее муж работает шеф-поваром в ресторане. Сын работает в Суде города. Ее дочка учится в университете, и занимается шитьем. Нигина занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. 6 лет она занимается портнихой. Нигина сидя дома зарабатывает на жизнь. Нигине удобно заниматься дома, и она просто обожает шить и кроить. Скоро ее дочь выходит замуж, и Нигина хочет помочь мужу в проведении свадебного мероприятия. В Таджикистане свадьба масштабное событие и приглашаются больше количество гостей,  соответственно свадебное мероприятие требует больших расходов. Нигина хочет взять кредит и потратить на свадьбу дочери. Нигине очень нужно деньги. Вы можете поддержать ее финансовой трудности. Нигина верит в Вас и на Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nigina is a resident of the wonderful city Dushanbe. Dushanbe is the capital of the Republic of Tajikistan. Dushanbe city is big and beautiful. The residents of the city are educated, clever, honest, hardworking and hospitable. 

Nigina was born and raised in Dushanbe. She is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. She has one 29-year-old son. Her daughter is 21 years old. Nigina is an educated woman, she has higher education. Her husband is a restaurant chef. Her son works in the local court of law. Her daughter is studying in university, and occupies herself with sewing. 

Nigina sews women's clothes to order. She has been working as a tailor for six years. Nigina earns her living from home. It is convenient for Nigina to work at home, and she simply loves sewing and cutting. Soon her daughter will get married, and Nigina wants to help her husband carry out the wedding arrangements. In Tajikistan weddings are large-scale events and a large number of guests are invited, correspondingly the wedding arrangements demand a lot of expense. 

Nigina wants to take a loan and spend it on her daughter's wedding. Nigina really needs money. You can help her with her financial difficulties. Nigina believes in you and your kindness.

loans.use: to carry out her daughter's wedding arrangements

loans.name: Zaynabbibi

texts.ru:
Зайнаббиби 32 года. Она замужняя женщина и мать двоих детей. Детям 5 и 8 лет. Зайнаббиби добрая и гостеприимная женщина. Она около 10 лет занимается земледелием.
   В этом году Зайнаббиби посадила хлопок. У нее имеется большой земельный участок. Еще немного времени осталось до сбора урожая. На данный момент Зайнаббиби надо обработать урожай минеральными удобрениями. Она планирует получить качественный и богатый урожай, поэтому она хочет купить качественные проверенные удобрения. Но для купли достаточного количества минеральных удобрений Зайнаббиби не хватает не большой суммы денег. Она запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений. Зайнаббиби верит в Вас и Вашу доброту. Ей очень нужно помощь.
texts.en:
Zaynabbibi is 32 and married with two children aged five and eight. She is a kind and hospitable woman who has been working in agriculture for about 10 years.

This year Zaynabbibi has planted cotton. She has a large piece of land and there is still a bit of time before she gathers her harvest. At the moment she needs to fertilize the soil so she can receive a rich, high-quality harvest, which is why she wants to buy some good-quality fertilizer. However, she doesn't have enough money to buy what she needs, so she is looking for a loan to purchase fertilizer. She trusts in you and your kindness, as she very much needs the help.

loans.use: to buy high-quality mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary deals in secondhand clothes and she moves to different markets throughout the week. These movements include the risks of high transport costs, operating from an open place limiting her operations in times of heavy rain and too much sun. She desires to have a room where she can sell from, where she does not have to face the above hindrances and only has to incur the cost of rent.
Another problem she faces is that of changes in tastes and preferences of her customers.

Rosemary is requesting for a loan to buy more secondhand clothes to sell during this Christmas season when she is sure of making high sales.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yuneidis

texts.es:
Yuneidis tiene 27 años y es una mujer felizmente casada. Vive con su esposo y su hermoso hijo de 4 años en la ciudad de Montería. Con el fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, dos años atrás decidió comenzar su propio negocio. Hoy cría cerdos para luego comercializarlos.

Trabaja arduamente para brindar a su familia la mejor calidad de vida, por eso ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio para así poder aumentar sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias. Hoy pide un préstamo que le permita comprar alimento para sus cerdos y para realizar algunas reformas locativas. 

Yuneidis sueña con poder brindarle a su hijo la mejor educación que le sea posible para que crezca y sea un profesional. También espera poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Hoy usted puede ser parte de la historia de vida de esta mujer, preste ahora y véala convertir sus sueños en realidad.
texts.en:
Yuneidis, 27, is a happily married woman who lives with her husband and cute 4-year-old son in the city of Monteria. In an effort to improve the quality of life of her family, two years ago she decided to start her own business. Nowadays she raises pigs to sell.

She works hard to give her family a better lifestyle and has made the decision to invest in her business in order to attract more customers and increase her earnings. Today she is requesting a loan to buy feed for her pigs and to carry out some local improvements.

Yuneldis dreams of giving her son the best education she can so he can grow up and become a professional. She also wants to improve the conditions of her home. Today you can become a part of this woman's life; loan now and help her realize her dreams.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs and carry out local improvements.

loans.name: Euclides Santander

texts.es:
Euclides tiene 53 años y vive en el municipio de Purisima. Es un hombre soltero que ha trabajado toda su vida para salir adelante y tener una buena calidad de vida. Hace 20 años comenzó a criar pollos, para lo que tomó capacitación para profesionalizar su labor.

Su negocio enfrenta una dificultad, esta es el transporte de sus pollos hasta donde los cría, y la falta de capital no le ha permitido mejorar esta situación. Desea invertir en su negocio para hacerlo más competitivo en el mercado y hacerlo sostenible. Pide un préstamo que le permita adquirir pollos, alimento para ellos y vacunas. 

Euclides es un hombre responsable y gran trabajador que está dispuesto a esforzarse para lograr sus sueños, como el de algún día ceder su negocio a algún familiar para que continúe con él. Ayude hoy a Euclides con el préstamo que necesita y permita que él logre todos sus sueños.
texts.en:
Euclides, 53, lives in the municipality of Purisima. He is a single man who has worked all his life to get ahead and lead a good quality of life. He started raising chickens 20 years ago after receiving training to professionalize his work.

His business is facing difficulty which is the transportation of the chickens to the place where they are raised; the lack of capital stands in the way of improving the situation. He wants to invest in his business to make it more competitive in the market as well as sustainable. He is requesting a loan to buy chickens, feed and vaccines.

Euclides is a responsible man and a hard worker who is willing to make every effort to meet his goals which includes leaving his business to a relative one day to continue the work. Help Euclides with the loan he needs and allow him to realize his dreams.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Orozkan

texts.ru: Орозкан, 45 лет,вдова, мама троих детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, работает библиотекарем в школе, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Орозкан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав около 27 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Орозкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: корова, 10 овец. На участке, мерою 1,0 Га арендованной и 0,37 Га собственной земли, она выращивает ячмень для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль Орозкан около 16,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойное содержание семьи, поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Орозкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух бычков для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита позволят Орозкан улучшить благосостояние семьи и вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Orozkan is 45 years old, widowed, and has three children. She has specialised secondary education and works as a librarian in a school. 

As a means of secondary income for her family, Orozkan works in animal husbandry and field husbandry, having started about 27 years ago. Thanks to Orozkan's persistent hard work, on her farm today there are a cow and ten sheep. On a rented land plot of 1.0 hectares, and a 0.37 hectare plot of self-owned land, she cultivates barley for sale. Orozkan's monthly income is about 16,000 som (KGS), and these funds are insufficient for adequately maintaining her family. 

Thus, with the view of further developing her farm, Orozkan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) in order to buy two steers for increasing her herd. The funds from the loan will allow Orozkan to improve her family's well-being, and invest in the further increase of her livestock herd.

loans.use: to buy two steers in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: Doña Adriana es una mujer emprendedora que tiene su propio negocio, el cual consiste en la fabricación y venta de ropa íntima. Solicita un préstamo de trecientos ochenta mil colones, para la compra de una máquina industrial y demás material necesario para la confección de las prendas.
texts.en:
Adriana is an enterprising woman. She has her own business producing and selling underwear.

Adriana is applying for a loan of 380,000 Colones in order to buy an industrial sewing machine and the necessary materials for making underwear.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for making underwear.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Саида, 40 лет, замужем, есть 4 дочери, образование среднее. Саида занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, на 0,80 Га земли выращивает кукурузу, пшеницу для реализации, также занимается виноградным делом. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 19,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров. Кредит поможет улучшить и развить бизнес и накопить на образование ее детей.
texts.en:
Saida is 40 years old, married, has four daughters, and has secondary education. Saida works in animal husbandry and crop husbandry. On her farm there are three cows, and on 0.80 hectares of land she cultivates corn and wheat for sale, and also is involved in the vineyard business. Her monthly income is about 19,000 som (KGS). 

She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) in order to buy three cows. The loan will help to improve and develop her business, and also help her to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy three cows in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Marvin Jose

texts.es: Don Marvin es un hombre ejemplar que ha logrado salir adelante pese a que su esposa falleció, hace 23 años que se dedica a ser sastre empezó a los 16 años de edad en este oficio ya que siempre le ha gustado la moda, también maneja otro negocio como la venta de nacatamales a sus clientes. Don Marvin siempre ha querido dar a conocer sus diseños de forma internacional y sabe que poco a poco lo va a lograr. Para seguir realizando los diseños y ofertarlos en la temporada navideña solicita un crédito para comprar telas y realizar la fabricación de diversos diseños. Su mayor anhelo es tener su propia línea de ropa.
texts.en:
Marvin is a role-model who has managed to get ahead even though his wife died.

Marvin has been a tailor for 23 years. He started when he was 16 years old as he has always liked fashion. Marvin also has a business selling "nacatamales" (maize, meat and rice wrapped in banana leaf) to customers.

Marvina has always wanted his designs to be known across the world and knows that, little by little, he will achieve this.

To continue making his designs and to sell them during the Christmas period, Marvin is applying for a loan in order to buy material and make various designs.

Marvin's biggest wish is to have his own line of clothing.

loans.use: to buy material and make various designs.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 41 años y vive con su mujer en la ciudad de Montería. Con ella tiene 3 hijos ya adultos a los cuales criaron con amor y cariño lo que los convirtió en grandes personas. En el año 2000, y por el amor que tiene por el mercadeo, decidió comenzar su propio negocio, una tienda que lleva ya 15 años funcionando. 

Siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, Jorge quiere impulsar su negocio para mejorar sus ventas y así ofrecer mejor calidad de vida, lamentablemente la falta de capital no le ha permitido invertir en su negocio, por eso hoy pide un préstamo con el fin de comprar cervezas y además comprar cerdos y alimento para ellos para crear un negocio alterno.

La vida de Jorge y su familia no ha sido sencilla pero siempre unidos han encontrado la forma de salir adelante, hoy espera que este préstamo le permita mejorar las condiciones de vida de él y su familia. Ayúdelo ahora con este préstamo y observe como vuelve sus sueños realidad.
texts.en:
Jorge, 41, lives with his wife in the city of Monteria. They have three adult children who they raised lovingly which made them nice people. In the year 2000, because of his love of commerce, Jorge decided to start his own business, a store, which has been running for 15 years.

Always thinking about the well-being of his family, Jorge wants to boost the business to improve sales and improve his lifestyle. Unfortunately, he does not have the capital for the investment. Therefore he is requesting a loan to buy beers, as well as pigs and feed to start an alternative business.

The life of Jorge and his family has not been easy but they always have stayed together to find a way to get ahead. Now he hopes the loan will improve his family's living conditions. Please help him now with the loan and see how his dreams become reality.

loans.use: to buy beers and also buy pigs and feed to set up an alternative business.

loans.name: Karamat

texts.ru: Карамат, 52 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. Образование- среднее. С 2009 года занимается сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день у нее есть 4 коровы, 7 овец, на 0,30 Га земли выращивает кукурузу и пшеницу для реализации. Ежемесячный доход на сегодняшний день составляет до 20,000 сом (KGS). Карамат обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 ковров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Карамат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Karamat is 52 years old, married, and has three children. She has secondary education. From 2009 she has worked as a farmer. Today she has four cows, seven sheep, and on 0.30 hectares of land she cultivates corn and wheat for sale. Her monthly income today comes to about 20,000 som (KGS). 

Karamat has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) in order to buy two cows for increasing her livestock headcount. Karamat plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further proliferation of her business.

loans.use: to purchase two cows in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Leonardo Jose

texts.es:
Leonardo tiene 47 años y vive con su pareja en la ciudad de Montería. Tiene dos hijas ya mayores de edad que son su mayor orgullo y a quienes ama con todo su corazón. 15 años atrás, este responsable padre decidió comenzar su propio negocio, una tienda en su ciudad que le ha permitido sostener su familia. 

Al comienzo, no fue fácil pero logró consolidar su negocio que hoy en día le ha traído grandes alegrías y mucho orgullo por su labor. Quiere impulsar su tienda, lamentablemente no tiene el capital para invertir en su negocio y así mejorar las ventas, por eso pide un préstamo que le permita comprar diferente surtido como alimentos y bebidas para su tienda. 

Leonardo espera que con esta inversión su negocio pueda mejorar y le permita mejor su hogar para que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida. Ayuda a este hombre a cumplir sus sueños, un préstamo lo hará estar más cerca de ello.
texts.en:
Leonardo, 47, lives with his partner in the city of Monteria. He has two adults daughters who are his pride and joy. Some 15 years ago this responsible father started his own business, a store in the city which has allowed him to support his family.

At first it was not easy to consolidate the business but nowadays he is very pleased and proud of his work. He wants to boost the store but unfortunately does not have the capital to invest in it and increase sales. Therefore he is requesting a loan to buy a variety of foods and beverages for the store.

Leonardo hopes that with this investment he can improve the business and his home so the family can have a better quality of lfie. Please help this man realize his dreams. A loan will make him closer to that goal.

loans.use: to buy a variety of foods and beverages for his store.

loans.name: Vecinal 3 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VECINAL 3” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gabriela es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de pan, venta de comida, venta de muebles, servicio de tapicería para vehículos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gabriela es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pan; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de sus padres, quienes comercializaban estos productos como negocio familiar, posteriormente ella decide implementar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de pan al por mayor) que adquirirá de los hornos proveedores de pan y posteriormente lo comercializara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella aún es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “VECINAL 3” will begin the sixth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal Panamericana [Pan American Focal Point]. It is made up of nine members and is headed by a board on which Gabriela is secretary. Businesses that members of the communal bank engage in are varied; among them are: blanket sales, bread sales, food sales, furniture sales, auto upholstery.

The loan they take out will benefit small businesswomen of which Gabriela is a member. She indicates that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for five cycles, joining by invitation of an advisor from the institution. Currently she has a business selling bread; she disclosed that she learned this business several years ago from her parents, who marketed these products as a family business. She subsequently decided to implement her own independent business.

The loan that she will take out now will be for capital increase (purchase of bread wholesale), that she will acquire from the ovens of bread suppliers and subsequently market in her retail space. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, as she is still single.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health services offered by the institution.

loans.use: purchase bread wholesale.
